Gen  At the first God made the heaven and the earth
Gen  And the earth was waste and without form and it was dark on the face of the deep and the Spirit of God was moving on the face of the waters
Gen  And God said Let there be light and there was light
Gen  And God looking on the light saw that it was good and God made a division between the light and the dark
Gen  Naming the light Day and the dark Night And there was evening and there was morning the first day
Gen  And God said Let there be a solid arch stretching over the waters parting the waters from the waters
Gen  And God made the arch for a division between the waters which were under the arch and those which were over it and it was so
Gen  And God gave the arch the name of Heaven And there was evening and there was morning the second day
Gen  And God said Let the waters under the heaven come together in one place and let the dry land be seen and it was so
Gen  And God gave the dry land the name of Earth and the waters together in their place were named Seas and God saw that it was good
Gen  And God said Let grass come up on the earth and plants producing seed and fruittrees giving fruit in which is their seed after their sort and it was so
Gen  And grass came up on the earth and every plant producing seed of its sort and every tree producing fruit in which is its seed of its sort and God saw that it was good
Gen  And there was evening and there was morning the third day
Gen  And God said Let there be lights in the arch of heaven for a division between the day and the night and let them be for signs and for marking the changes of the year and for days and for years
Gen  And let them be for lights in the arch of heaven to give light on the earth and it was so
Gen  And God made the two great lights the greater light to be the ruler of the day and the smaller light to be the ruler of the night and he made the stars
Gen  And God put them in the arch of heaven to give light on the earth
Gen  To have rule over the day and the night and for a division between the light and the dark and God saw that it was good
Gen  And there was evening and there was morning the fourth day
Gen  And God said Let the waters be full of living things and let birds be in flight over the earth under the arch of heaven
Gen  And God made great seabeasts and every sort of living and moving thing with which the waters were full and every sort of winged bird and God saw that it was good
Gen  And God gave them his blessing saying Be fertile and have increase making all the waters of the seas full and let the birds be increased in the earth
Gen  And there was evening and there was morning the fifth day
Gen  And God said Let the earth give birth to all sorts of living things cattle and all things moving on the earth and beasts of the earth after their sort and it was so
Gen  And God made the beast of the earth after its sort and the cattle after their sort and everything moving on the face of the earth after its sort and God saw that it was good
Gen  And God said Let us make man in our image like us and let him have rule over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the air and over the cattle and over all the earth and over every living thing which goes flat on the earth
Gen  And God made man in his image in the image of God he made him male and female he made them
Gen  And God gave them his blessing and said to them Be fertile and have increase and make the earth full and be masters of it be rulers over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the air and over every living thing moving on the earth
Gen  And God said See I have given you every plant producing seed on the face of all the earth and every tree which has fruit producing seed they will be for your food
Gen  And to every beast of the earth and to every bird of the air and every living thing moving on the face of the earth I have given every green plant for food and it was so
Gen  And God saw everything which he had made and it was very good And there was evening and there was morning the sixth day
Gen  And the heaven and the earth and all things in them were complete
Gen  And on the seventh day God came to the end of all his work and on the seventh day he took his rest from all the work which he had done
Gen  And God gave his blessing to the seventh day and made it holy because on that day he took his rest from all the work which he had made and done
Gen  These are the generations of the heaven and the earth when they were made
Gen  In the day when the Lord God made earth and heaven there were no plants of the field on the earth and no grass had come up for the Lord God had not sent rain on the earth and there was no man to do work on the land
Gen  But a mist went up from the earth watering all the face of the land
Gen  And the Lord God made man from the dust of the earth breathing into him the breath of life and man became a living soul
Gen  And the Lord God made a garden in the east in Eden and there he put the man whom he had made
Gen  And out of the earth the Lord made every tree to come delighting the eye and good for food and in the middle of the garden the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil
Gen  And a river went out of Eden giving water to the garden and from there it was parted and became four streams
Gen  The name of the first is Pishon which goes round about all the land of Havilah where there is gold
Gen  And the gold of that land is good there is bdellium and the onyx stone
Gen  And the name of the second river is Gihon this river goes round all the land of Cush
Gen  And the name of the third river is Tigris which goes to the east of Assyria And the fourth river is Euphrates
Gen  And the Lord God took the man and put him in the garden of Eden to do work in it and take care of it
Gen  And the Lord God gave the man orders saying You may freely take of the fruit of every tree of the garden
Gen  But of the fruit of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil you may not take for on the day when you take of it death will certainly come to you
Gen  And the Lord God said It is not good for the man to be by himself I will make one like himself as a help to him
Gen  And from the earth the Lord God made every beast of the field and every bird of the air and took them to the man to see what names he would give them and whatever name he gave to any living thing that was its name
Gen  And the man gave names to all cattle and to the birds of the air and to every beast of the field but Adam had no one like himself as a help
Gen  And the Lord God sent a deep sleep on the man and took one of the bones from his side while he was sleeping joining up the flesh again in its place
Gen  And the bone which the Lord God had taken from the man he made into a woman and took her to the man
Gen  And the man said This is now bone of my bone and flesh of my flesh let her name be Woman because she was taken out of Man
Gen  For this cause will a man go away from his father and his mother and be joined to his wife and they will be one flesh
Gen  And the man and his wife were without clothing and they had no sense of shame
Gen  Now the snake was wiser than any beast of the field which the Lord God had made And he said to the woman Has God truly said that you may not take of the fruit of any tree in the garden
Gen  And the woman said We may take of the fruit of the trees in the garden
Gen  But of the fruit of the tree in the middle of the garden God has said If you take of it or put your hands on it death will come to you
Gen  And the snake said Death will not certainly come to you
Gen  For God sees that on the day when you take of its fruit your eyes will be open and you will be as gods having knowledge of good and evil
Gen  And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food and a delight to the eyes and to be desired to make one wise she took of its fruit and gave it to her husband
Gen  And their eyes were open and they were conscious that they had no clothing and they made themselves coats of leaves stitched together
Gen  And there came to them the sound of the Lord God walking in the garden in the evening wind and the man and his wife went to a secret place among the trees of the garden away from the eyes of the Lord God
Gen  And the voice of the Lord God came to the man saying Where are you
Gen  And he said Hearing your voice in the garden I was full of fear because I was without clothing and I kept myself from your eyes
Gen  And he said Who gave you the knowledge that you were without clothing Have you taken of the fruit of the tree which I said you were not to take
Gen  And the man said The woman whom you gave to be with me she gave me the fruit of the tree and I took it
Gen  And the Lord God said to the woman What have you done And the woman said I was tricked by the deceit of the snake and I took it
Gen  And the Lord God said to the snake Because you have done this you are cursed more than all cattle and every beast of the field you will go flat on the earth and dust will be your food all the days of your life
Gen  And there will be war between you and the woman and between your seed and her seed by him will your head be crushed and by you his foot will be wounded
Gen  To the woman he said Great will be your pain in childbirth in sorrow will your children come to birth still your desire will be for your husband but he will be your master
Gen  And to Adam he said Because you gave ear to the voice of your wife and took of the fruit of the tree which I said you were not to take the earth is cursed on your account in pain you will get your food from it all your life
Gen  Thorns and waste plants will come up and the plants of the field will be your food
Gen  With the hard work of your hands you will get your bread till you go back to the earth from which you were taken for dust you are and to the dust you will go back
Gen  And the man gave his wife the name of Eve because she was the mother of all who have life
Gen  And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife coats of skins for their clothing
Gen  And the Lord God said Now the man has become like one of us having knowledge of good and evil and now if he puts out his hand and takes of the fruit of the tree of life he will go on living for ever
Gen  So the Lord God sent him out of the garden of Eden to be a worker on the earth from which he was taken
Gen  So he sent the man out and at the east of the garden of Eden he put winged ones and a flaming sword turning every way to keep the way to the tree of life
Gen  And the man had connection with Eve his wife and she became with child and gave birth to Cain and said I have got a man from the Lord
Gen  Then again she became with child and gave birth to Abel his brother And Abel was a keeper of sheep but Cain was a farmer
Gen  And after a time Cain gave to the Lord an offering of the fruits of the earth
Gen  And Abel gave an offering of the young lambs of his flock and of their fat And the Lord was pleased with Abels offering
Gen  But in Cain and his offering he had no pleasure And Cain was angry and his face became sad
Gen  And the Lord said to Cain Why are you angry and why is your face sad
Gen  If you do well will you not have honour and if you do wrong sin is waiting at the door desiring to have you but do not let it be your master
Gen  And Cain said to his brother Let us go into the field and when they were in the field Cain made an attack on his brother Abel and put him to death
Gen  And the Lord said to Cain Where is your brother Abel And he said I have no idea am I my brothers keeper
Gen  And he said What have you done the voice of your brothers blood is crying to me from the earth
Gen  And now you are cursed from the earth whose mouth is open to take your brothers blood from your hand
Gen  No longer will the earth give you her fruit as the reward of your work you will be a wanderer in flight over the earth
Gen  And Cain said My punishment is greater than my strength
Gen  You have sent me out this day from the face of the earth and from before your face I will be a wanderer in flight over the earth and whoever sees me will put me to death
Gen  And the Lord said Truly if Cain is put to death seven lives will be taken for his And the Lord put a mark on Cain so that no one might put him to death
Gen  And Cain went away from before the face of the Lord and made his livingplace in the land of Nod on the east of Eden
Gen  And Cain had connection with his wife and she became with child and gave birth to Enoch and he made a town and gave the town the name of Enoch after his son
Gen  And Enoch had a son Irad and Irad became the father of Mehujael and Mehujael became the father of Methushael and Methushael became the father of Lamech
Gen  And Lamech had two wives the name of the one was Adah and the name of the other Zillah
Gen  And Adah gave birth to Jabal he was the father of such as are living in tents and keep cattle
Gen  And his brothers name was Jubal he was the father of all players on instruments of music
Gen  And Zillah gave birth to Tubalcain who is the father of every maker of cutting instruments of brass and iron and the sister of Tubalcain was Naamah
Gen  And Lamech said to his wives Adah and Zillah give ear to my voice you wives of Lamech give attention to my words for I would put a man to death for a wound and a young man for a blow
Gen  If seven lives are to be taken as punishment for Cains death seventyseven will be taken for Lamechs
Gen  And Adam had connection with his wife again and she gave birth to a son to whom she gave the name of Seth for she said God has given me another seed in place of Abel whom Cain put to death
Gen  And Seth had a son and he gave him the name of Enosh at this time men first made use of the name of the Lord in worship
Gen  This is the book of the generations of Adam In the day when God made man he made him in the image of God
Gen  Male and female he made them naming them Man and giving them his blessing on the day when they were made
Gen  Adam had been living for a hundred and thirty years when he had a son like himself after his image and gave him the name of Seth
Gen  And after the birth of Seth Adam went on living for eight hundred years and had sons and daughters
Gen  And all the years of Adams life were nine hundred and thirty and he came to his end
Gen  And Seth was a hundred and five years old when he became the father of Enosh
Gen  And he went on living after the birth of Enosh for eight hundred and seven years and had sons and daughters
Gen  And all the years of Seths life were nine hundred and twelve and he came to his end
Gen  And Enosh was ninety years old when he became the father of Kenan
Gen  And after the birth of Kenan Enosh went on living for eight hundred and fifteen years and had sons and daughters
Gen  And all the years of Enosh were nine hundred and five and he came to his end
Gen  And Kenan was seventy years old when he became the father of Mahalalel
Gen  And after the birth of Mahalalel Kenan went on living for eight hundred and forty years and had sons and daughters
Gen  And all the years of Kenans life were nine hundred and ten and he came to his end
Gen  And Mahalalel was sixtyfive years old when he became the father of Jared
Gen  And after the birth of Jared Mahalalel went on living for eight hundred and thirty years and had sons and daughters
Gen  And all the years of Mahalalels life were eight hundred and ninetyfive and he came to his end
Gen  And Jared was a hundred and sixtytwo years old when he became the father of Enoch
Gen  And Jared went on living after the birth of Enoch for eight hundred years and had sons and daughters
Gen  And all the years of Jareds life were nine hundred and sixtytwo and he came to his end

Gen  And after the birth of Methuselah Enoch went on in Gods ways for three hundred years and had sons and daughters
Gen  And all the years of Enochs life were three hundred and sixtyfive
Gen  And Enoch went on in Gods ways and he was not seen again for God took him
Gen  And Methuselah was a hundred and eightyseven years old when he became the father of Lamech

Gen  And Lamech was a hundred and eightytwo years old when he had a son
Gen  And he gave him the name of Noah saying Truly he will give us rest from our trouble and the hard work of our hands because of the earth which was cursed by God

Gen  And all the years of Lamechs life were seven hundred and seventyseven and he came to his end
Gen  And when Noah was five hundred years old he became the father of Shem Ham and Japheth
Gen  And after a time when men were increasing on the earth and had daughters
Gen  The sons of God saw that the daughters of men were fair and they took wives for themselves from those who were pleasing to them
Gen  And the Lord said My spirit will not be in man for ever for he is only flesh so the days of his life will be a hundred and twenty years
Gen  There were men of great strength and size on the earth in those days and after that when the sons of God had connection with the daughters of men they gave birth to children these were the great men of old days the men of great name
Gen  And the Lord saw that the sin of man was great on the earth and that all the thoughts of his heart were evil
Gen  And the Lord had sorrow because he had made man on the earth and grief was in his heart
Gen  And the Lord said I will take away man whom I have made from the face of the earth even man and beast and that which goes on the earth and every bird of the air for I have sorrow for having made them
Gen  But Noah had grace in the eyes of God
Gen  These are the generations of Noah Noah was an upright man and without sin in his generation he went in the ways of God
Gen  And Noah had three sons Shem Ham and Japheth
Gen  And the earth was evil in Gods eyes and full of violent ways
Gen  And God looking on the earth saw that it was evil for the way of all flesh had become evil on the earth
Gen  And God said to Noah The end of all flesh has come the earth is full of their violent doings and now I will put an end to them with the earth
Gen  Make for yourself an ark of gopher wood with rooms in it and make it safe from the water inside and out
Gen  And this is the way you are to make it it is to be three hundred cubits long fifty cubits wide and thirty cubits high
Gen  You are to put a window in the ark a cubit from the roof and a door in the side of it and you are to make it with a lower and second and third floors
Gen  For truly I will send a great flow of waters over the earth for the destruction from under the heaven of all flesh in which is the breath of life everything on the earth will come to an end
Gen  But with you I will make an agreement and you will come into the ark you and your sons and your wife and your sons wives with you
Gen  And you will take with you into the ark two of every sort of living thing and keep them safe with you they will be male and female
Gen  Two of every sort of bird and cattle and of every sort of living thing which goes on the earth will you take with you to keep them from destruction
Gen  And make a store of every sort of food for yourself and them
Gen  And all these things Noah did as God said so he did
Gen  And the Lord said to Noah Take all your family and go into the ark for you only in this generation have I seen to be upright
Gen  Of every clean beast you will take seven males and seven females and of the beasts which are not clean two the male and his female
Gen  And of the birds of the air seven males and seven females so that their seed may still be living on the face of the earth
Gen  For after seven days I will send rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights for the destruction of every living thing which I have made on the face of the earth
Gen  And Noah did everything which the Lord said he was to do
Gen  And Noah was six hundred years old when the waters came flowing over all the earth
Gen  And Noah with his sons and his wife and his sons wives went into the ark because of the flowing of the waters
Gen  Of clean beasts and of beasts which are not clean and of birds and of everything which goes on the earth
Gen  In twos male and female they went into the ark with Noah as God had said
Gen  And after the seven days the waters came over all the earth
Gen  In the six hundredth year of Noahs life in the second month on the seventeenth day of the month all the fountains of the great deep came bursting through and the windows of heaven were open
Gen  And rain came down on the earth for forty days and forty nights
Gen  On the same day Noah with Shem Ham and Japheth his sons and his wife and his sons wives went into the ark
Gen  And with them every sort of beast and cattle and every sort of thing which goes on the earth and every sort of bird

Gen  Male and female of all flesh went in as God had said and the ark was shut by the Lord
Gen  And for forty days the waters were over all the earth and the waters were increased so that the ark was lifted up high over the earth
Gen  And the waters overcame everything and were increased greatly on the earth and the ark was resting on the face of the waters
Gen  And the waters overcame everything on the earth and all the mountains under heaven were covered
Gen  The waters went fifteen cubits higher till all the mountains were covered
Gen  And destruction came on every living thing moving on the earth birds and cattle and beasts and everything which went on the earth and every man
Gen  Everything on the dry land in which was the breath of life came to its end
Gen  Every living thing on the face of all the earth man and cattle and things moving on the face of the earth and birds of the air came to destruction only Noah and those who were with him in the ark were kept from death
Gen  And the waters were over the earth a hundred and fifty days
Gen  And God kept Noah in mind and all the living things and the cattle which were with him in the ark and God sent a wind over the earth and the waters went down
Gen  And the fountains of the deep and the windows of heaven were shut and the rain from heaven was stopped
Gen  And the waters went slowly back from the earth and at the end of a hundred and fifty days the waters were lower
Gen  And on the seventeenth day of the seventh month the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat
Gen  And still the waters went on falling till on the first day of the tenth month the tops of the mountains were seen
Gen  Then after forty days through the open window of the ark which he had made
Gen  Noah sent out a raven which went this way and that till the waters were gone from the earth
Gen  And he sent out a dove to see if the waters had gone from the face of the earth
Gen  But the dove saw no restingplace for her foot and came back to the ark for the waters were still over all the earth and he put out his hand and took her into the ark
Gen  And after waiting another seven days he sent the dove out again
Gen  And the dove came back at evening and in her mouth was an oliveleaf broken off so Noah was certain that the waters had gone down on the earth
Gen  And after seven days more he sent the dove out again but she did not come back to him
Gen  And in the six hundred and first year on the first day of the first month the waters were dry on the earth and Noah took the cover off the ark and saw that the face of the earth was dry
Gen  And on the twentyseventh day of the second month the earth was dry
Gen  And God said to Noah
Gen  Go out of the ark you and your wife and your sons and your sons wives
Gen  Take out with you every living thing which is with you birds and cattle and everything which goes on the earth so that they may have offspring and be fertile and be increased on the earth
Gen  And Noah went out with his sons and his wife and his sons wives
Gen  And every beast and bird and every living thing of every sort which goes on the earth went out of the ark
Gen  And Noah made an altar to the Lord and from every clean beast and bird he made burned offerings on the altar
Gen  And when the sweet smell came up to the Lord he said in his heart I will not again put a curse on the earth because of man for the thoughts of mans heart are evil from his earliest days never again will I send destruction on all living things as I have done
Gen  While the earth goes on seed time and the getting in of the grain cold and heat summer and winter day and night will not come to an end
Gen  And God gave his blessing to Noah and his sons and said Be fertile and have increase and make the earth full
Gen  And the fear of you will be strong in every beast of the earth and every bird of the air everything which goes on the land and all the fishes of the sea are given into your hands
Gen  Every living and moving thing will be food for you I give them all to you as before I gave you all green things
Gen  But flesh with the lifeblood in it you may not take for food
Gen  And for your blood which is your life will I take payment from every beast I will take it and from every man will I take payment for the blood of his brotherman
Gen  Whoever takes a mans life by man will his life be taken because God made man in his image
Gen  And now be fertile and have increase have offspring on the earth and become great in number
Gen  And God said to Noah and to his sons

Gen  And with every living thing with you all birds and cattle and every beast of the earth which comes out of the ark with you
Gen  And I will make my agreement with you never again will all flesh be cut off by the waters never again will the waters come over all the earth for its destruction
Gen  And God said This is the sign of the agreement which I make between me and you and every living thing with you for all future generations
Gen  I will put my bow in the cloud and it will be for a sign of the agreement between me and the earth
Gen  And whenever I make a cloud come over the earth the bow will be seen in the cloud
Gen  And I will keep in mind the agreement between me and you and every living thing and never again will there be a great flow of waters causing destruction to all flesh
Gen  And the bow will be in the cloud and looking on it I will keep in mind the eternal agreement between God and every living thing on the earth
Gen  And God said to Noah This is the sign of the agreement which I have made between me and all flesh on the earth
Gen  And the sons of Noah who went out of the ark were Shem Ham and Japheth and Ham is the father of Canaan
Gen  These three were the sons of Noah and from them all the earth was peopled
Gen  In those days Noah became a farmer and he made a vinegarden
Gen  And he took of the wine of it and was overcome by drink and he was uncovered in his tent
Gen  And Ham the father of Canaan saw his father unclothed and gave news of it to his two brothers outside
Gen  And Shem and Japheth took a robe and putting it on their backs went in with their faces turned away and put it over their father so that they might not see him unclothed
Gen  And awaking from his wine Noah saw what his youngest son had done to him and he said
Gen  Cursed be Canaan let him be a servant of servants to his brothers
Gen  And he said Praise to the Lord the God of Shem let Canaan be his servant

Gen  And all the earth had one language and one tongue
Gen  And it came about that in their wandering from the east they came to a stretch of flat country in the land of Shinar and there they made their livingplace
Gen  And they said one to another Come let us make bricks burning them well And they had bricks for stone putting them together with sticky earth
Gen  And they said Come let us make a town and a tower whose top will go up as high as heaven and let us make a great name for ourselves so that we may not be wanderers over the face of the earth
Gen  And the Lord came down to see the town and the tower which the children of men were building
Gen  And the Lord said See they are all one people and have all one language and this is only the start of what they may do and now it will not be possible to keep them from any purpose of theirs
Gen  Come let us go down and take away the sense of their language so that they will not be able to make themselves clear to one another
Gen  So the Lord God sent them away into every part of the earth and they gave up building their town
Gen  So it was named Babel because there the Lord took away the sense of all languages and from there the Lord sent them away over all the face of the earth

Gen  And Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them to Abimelech and the two of them made an agreement together
Gen  And Abraham put seven young lambs of the flock on one side by themselves
Gen  Then Abimelech said What are these seven lambs which you have put on one side
Gen  And he said Take these seven lambs from me as a witness that I have made this waterhole
Gen  So he gave that place the name Beersheba because there the two of them had given their oaths
Gen  So they made an agreement at Beersheba and Abimelech and Phicol the captain of his army went back to the land of the Philistines
Gen  And Abraham after planting a holy tree in Beersheba gave worship to the name of the Lord the Eternal God
Gen  And Abraham went on living in the land of the Philistines as in a strange country
Gen  Now after these things God put Abraham to the test and said to him Abraham and he said Here am I
Gen  And he said to him Take your son your dearly loved only son Isaac and go to the land of Moriah and give him as a burned offering on one of the mountains of which I will give you knowledge
Gen  And Abraham got up early in the morning and made ready his ass and took with him two of his young men and Isaac his son and after the wood for the burned offering had been cut he went on his way to the place of which God had given him word
Gen  And on the third day Abraham lifting up his eyes saw the place a long way off
Gen  Then he said to his young men Keep here with the ass and I and the boy will go on and give worship and come back again to you
Gen  And Abraham put the wood for the burned offering on his sons back and he himself took the fire and the knife in his hand and the two of them went on together
Gen  Then Isaac said to Abraham My father and he said Here am I my son And he said We have wood and fire here but where is the lamb for the burned offering
Gen  And Abraham said God himself will give the lamb for the burned offering so they went on together
Gen  And they came to the place of which God had given him knowledge and there Abraham made the altar and put the wood in place on it and having made tight the bands round Isaac his son he put him on the wood on the altar
Gen  And stretching out his hand Abraham took the knife to put his son to death
Gen  But the voice of the angel of the Lord came from heaven saying Abraham Abraham and he said Here am I
Gen  And he said Let not your hand be stretched out against the boy to do anything to him for now I am certain that the fear of God is in your heart because you have not kept back your son your only son from me
Gen  And lifting up his eyes Abraham saw a sheep fixed by its horns in the brushwood and Abraham took the sheep and made a burned offering of it in place of his son
Gen  And Abraham gave that place the name Yahwehyireh as it is said to this day In the mountain the Lord is seen
Gen  And the voice of the angel of the Lord came to Abraham a second time from heaven
Gen  Saying I have taken an oath by my name says the Lord because you have done this and have not kept back from me your dearly loved only son
Gen  That I will certainly give you my blessing and your seed will be increased like the stars of heaven and the sand by the seaside your seed will take the land of those who are against them
Gen  And your seed will be a blessing to all the nations of the earth because you have done what I gave you orders to do
Gen  Then Abraham went back to his young men and they went together to Beersheba the place where Abraham was living
Gen  After these things Abraham had news that Milcah the wife of his brother Nahor had given birth to children
Gen  Uz the oldest and Buz his brother and Kemuel the father of Aram
Gen  And Chesed and Hazo and Pildash and Jidlaph and Bethuel
Gen  Bethuel was the father of Rebekah these eight were the children of Milcah and Nahor Abrahams brother
Gen  And his servant Reumah gave birth to Tebah and Gaham and Tahash and Maacah
Gen  Now the years of Sarahs life were a hundred and twentyseven
Gen  And Sarahs death took place in Kiriatharba that is Hebron in the land of Canaan and Abraham went into his house weeping and sorrowing for Sarah
Gen  And Abraham came from his dead and said to the children of Heth
Gen  I am living among you as one from a strange country give me some land here as my property so that I may put my dead to rest
Gen  And in answer the children of Heth said to Abraham
Gen  My lord truly you are a great chief among us take the best of our restingplaces for your dead not one of us will keep back from you a place where you may put your dead to rest
Gen  And Abraham got up and gave honour to the children of Heth the people of that land
Gen  And he said to them If you will let me put my dead to rest here make a request for me to Ephron the son of Zohar
Gen  That he will give me the hollow in the rock named Machpelah which is his property at the end of his field let him give it to me for its full price as a restingplace for my dead among you
Gen  Now Ephron was seated among the children of Heth and Ephron the Hittite gave Abraham his answer in the hearing of the children of Heth and of all those who came into his town saying
Gen  No my lord I will give you the field with the hollow in the rock before all the children of my people will I give it to you for a restingplace for your dead
Gen  And Abraham went down on his face before the people of the land
Gen  And Abraham said to Ephron in the hearing of the people of the land If only you will give ear to me I will give you the price of the field take it and let me put my dead to rest there
Gen  So Ephron said to Abraham
Gen  My lord give ear to me the value of the land is four hundred shekels what is that between me and you so put your dead to rest there
Gen  And Abraham took note of the price fixed by Ephron in the hearing of the children of Heth and gave him four hundred shekels in current money
Gen  So Ephrons field at Machpelah near Mamre with the hollow in the rock and all the trees in the field and round it
Gen  Became the property of Abraham before the eyes of the children of Heth and of all who came into the town
Gen  Then Abraham put Sarah his wife to rest in the hollow rock in the field of Machpelah near Mamre that is Hebron in the land of Canaan
Gen  And the field and the hollow rock were handed over to Abraham as his property by the children of Heth
Gen  Now Abraham was old and far on in years and the Lord had given him everything in full measure
Gen  And Abraham said to his chief servant the manager of all his property Come now put your hand under my leg
Gen  And take an oath by the Lord the God of heaven and the God of the earth that you will not get a wife for my son Isaac from the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I am living
Gen  But that you will go into my country and to my relations and get a wife there for my son Isaac
Gen  And the servant said If by chance the woman will not come with me into this land am I to take your son back again to the land from which you came
Gen  And Abraham said Take care that you do not let my son go back to that land
Gen  The Lord God of heaven who took me from my fathers house and from the land of my birth and made an oath to me saying To your seed I will give this land he will send his angel before you and give you a wife for my son in that land
Gen  And if the woman will not come with you then you are free from this oath only do not take my son back there
Gen  And the servant put his hand under Abrahams leg and gave him his oath about this thing
Gen  And the servant took ten of his masters camels and all sorts of good things of his masters and went to Mesopotamia to the town of Nahor
Gen  And he made the camels take their rest outside the town by the waterspring in the evening at the time when the women came to get water
Gen  And he said O Lord the God of my master Abraham let me do well in what I have undertaken this day and give your mercy to my master Abraham
Gen  See I am waiting here by the waterspring and the daughters of the town are coming out to get water
Gen  Now may the girl to whom I say Let down your vessel and give me a drink and who says in answer Here is a drink for you and let me give water to your camels may she be the one marked out by you for your servant Isaac so may I be certain that you have been good to my master Abraham
Gen  And even before his words were ended Rebekah the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah who was the wife of Nahor Abrahams brother came out with her watervessel on her arm
Gen  She was a very beautiful girl a virgin who had never been touched by a man and she went down to the spring to get water in her vessel
Gen  And the servant came running to her and said Give me a little water from your vessel
Gen  And she said Take a drink my lord and quickly letting down her vessel onto her hand she gave him a drink
Gen  And having done so she said I will get water for your camels till they have had enough
Gen  And after putting the water from her vessel into the animals drinkingplace she went quickly back to the spring and got water for all the camels
Gen  And the man looking at her said nothing waiting to see if the Lord had given his journey a good outcome
Gen  And when the camels had had enough the man took a gold nosering half a shekel in weight and two ornaments for her arms of ten shekels weight of gold
Gen  And said to her Whose daughter are you is there room in your fathers house for us
Gen  And she said to him I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah Nahors wife
Gen  And she said We have a great store of dry grass and cattlefood and there is room for you
Gen  And with bent head the man gave worship to the Lord
Gen  And said Praise be to the Lord the God of my master Abraham who has given a sign that he is good and true to my master by guiding me straight to the house of my masters family
Gen  So the girl went running and took the news of these things to her mothers house
Gen  Now Rebekah had a brother named Laban and he came out quickly to the man at the waterspring
Gen  And when he saw the nosering and the ornaments on his sisters hands and when she gave him word of what the man had said to her then he went out to the man who was waiting with the camels by the waterspring
Gen  And he said to him Come in you on whom is the blessing of the Lord why are you waiting outside for I have made the house ready for you and a place for the camels
Gen  Then the man came into the house and Laban took their cords off the camels and gave them dry grass and food and he gave to him and the men who were with him water for washing their feet
Gen  And meat was put before him but he said I will not take food till I have made my business clear to you And they said Do so
Gen  And he said I am Abrahams servant
Gen  The Lord has given my master every blessing and he has become great he has given him flocks and herds and silver and gold and menservants and womenservants and camels and asses
Gen  And when Sarah my masters wife was old she gave birth to a son to whom he has given all he has
Gen  And my master made me take an oath saying Do not get a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I am living
Gen  But go to my fathers house and to my relations for a wife for my son
Gen  And I said to my master What if the woman will not come with me
Gen  And he said The Lord whom I have ever kept before me will send his angel with you who will make it possible for you to get a wife for my son from my relations and my fathers house
Gen  And you will be free from your oath to me when you come to my people and if they will not give her to you you will be free from your oath
Gen  And I came today to the waterspring and I said O Lord the God of my master Abraham if it is your purpose to give a good outcome to my journey
Gen  Let it come about that while I am waiting here by the waterspring if a girl comes to get water and I say to her Give me a little water from your vessel and she says
Gen  Take a drink and I will get water for your camels let her be the woman marked out by the Lord for my masters son
Gen  And even while I was saying this to myself Rebekah came out with her vessel on her arm and she went down to the spring to get water and I said to her Give me a drink
Gen  And straight away she took down her vessel from her arm and said Take a drink and I will get water for your camels
Gen  And questioning her I said Whose daughter are you And she said The daughter of Bethuel the son of Nahor and Milcah his wife Then I put the ring on her nose and the ornaments on her hands
Gen  And with bent head I gave worship and praise to the Lord the God of my master Abraham by whom I had been guided in the right way to get the daughter of my masters brother for his son
Gen  And now say if you will do what is good and right for my master or not in order that it may be clear to me what I have to do
Gen  Then Laban and Bethuel said in answer This is the Lords doing it is not for us to say Yes or No to you

Gen  And at these words Abrahams servant went down on his face and gave praise to the Lord
Gen  Then he took jewels of silver and jewels of gold and fair robes and gave them to Rebekah and he gave things of value to her mother and her brother
Gen  Then he and the men who were with him had food and drink and took their rest there that night and in the morning he got up and said Let me now go back to my master
Gen  But her brother and her mother said Let the girl be with us a week or ten days and then she may go
Gen  And he said Do not keep me the Lord has given a good outcome to my journey let me now go back to my master
Gen  And they said We will send for the girl and let her make the decision
Gen  And they sent for Rebekah and said to her Are you ready to go with this man And she said I am ready
Gen  So they sent their sister Rebekah and her servant with Abrahams servant and his men
Gen  And they gave Rebekah their blessing saying O sister may you be the mother of thousands and ten thousands and may your seed overcome all those who make war against them

Gen  Now Isaac had come through the waste land to Beerlahairoi for he was living in the South
Gen  And when the evening was near he went wandering out into the fields and lifting up his eyes he saw camels coming
Gen  And when Rebekah looking up saw Isaac she got down from her camel
Gen  And said to the servant Who is that man coming to us through the field And the servant said It is my master then she took her veil covering her face with it
Gen  Then the servant gave Isaac the story of all he had done
Gen  And Isaac took Rebekah into his tent and she became his wife and in his love for her Isaac was comforted after his fathers death

Gen  And Abraham came to his death an old man full of years and he was put to rest with his people
Gen  And Isaac and Ishmael his sons put him to rest in the hollow rock of Machpelah in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite near Mamre
Gen  The same field which Abraham got from the children of Heth there Abraham was put to rest with Sarah his wife
Gen  Now after the death of Abraham the blessing of God was with Isaac his son
Gen  Now these are the generations of Ishmael the son of Abraham whose mother was Hagar the Egyptian the servant of Sarah
Gen  These are the names of the sons of Ishmael by their generations Ishmaels first son was Nebaioth then Kedar and Adbeel and Mibsam
Gen  And Mishma and Dumah and Massa

Gen  And the years of Ishmaels life were a hundred and thirtyseven and he came to his end and was put to rest with his people
Gen  And their country was from Havilah to Shur which is east of Egypt they took their place to the east of all their brothers
Gen  Now these are the generations of Abrahams son Isaac
Gen  Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah the daughter of Bethuel the Aramaean of Paddanaram and the sister of Laban the Aramaean to be his wife
Gen  Isaac made prayer to the Lord for his wife because she had no children and the Lord gave ear to his prayer and Rebekah became with child
Gen  And the children were fighting together inside her and she said If it is to be so why am I like this So she went to put her question to the Lord
Gen  And the Lord said to her Two nations are in your body and two peoples will come to birth from you the one will be stronger than the other and the older will be the servant of the younger
Gen  And when the time came for her to give birth there were two children in her body
Gen  And the first came out red from head to foot like a robe of hair and they gave him the name of Esau
Gen  And after him his brother came out gripping Esaus foot and he was named Jacob Isaac was sixty years old when she gave birth to them
Gen  And the boys came to full growth and Esau became a man of the open country an expert bowman but Jacob was a quiet man living in tents
Gen  Now Isaacs love was for Esau because Esaus meat was greatly to his taste but Rebekah had more love for Jacob
Gen  And one day Jacob was cooking some soup when Esau came in from the fields in great need of food
Gen  And Esau said to Jacob Give me a full meal of that red soup for I am overcome with need for food for this reason he was named Edom
Gen  And Jacob said First of all give me your birthright
Gen  And Esau said Truly I am at the point of death what profit is the birthright to me
Gen  And Jacob said First of all give me your oath and he gave him his oath handing over his birthright to Jacob
Gen  Then Jacob gave him bread and soup and he took food and drink and went away caring little for his birthright
Gen  Then came a time of great need in the land like that which had been before in the days of Abraham And Isaac went to Abimelech king of the Philistines at Gerar
Gen  And the Lord came to him in a vision and said Do not go down to Egypt keep in the land of which I will give you knowledge
Gen  Keep in this land and I will be with you and give you my blessing for to you and to your seed will I give all these lands giving effect to the oath which I made to your father Abraham
Gen  I will make your seed like the stars of heaven in number and will give them all these lands and your seed will be a blessing to all the nations of the earth
Gen  Because Abraham gave ear to my voice and kept my words my rules my orders and my laws
Gen  So Isaac went on living in Gerar
Gen  And when he was questioned by the men of the place about his wife he said She is my sister fearing to say She is my wife for he said the men of the place may put me to death on account of Rebekah because she is very beautiful
Gen  And when he had been there for some time Abimelech king of the Philistines looking through a window saw Isaac playing with Rebekah his wife
Gen  And he said to Isaac It is clear that she is your wife why then did you say She is my sister And Isaac said For fear that I might be put to death because of her
Gen  Then Abimelech said What have you done to us one of the people might well have had connection with your wife and the sin would have been ours
Gen  And Abimelech gave orders to his people that anyone touching Isaac or his wife was to be put to death
Gen  Now Isaac planting seed in that land got in the same year fruit a hundred times as much for the blessing of the Lord was on him
Gen  And his wealth became very great increasing more and more
Gen  For he had great wealth of flocks and herds and great numbers of servants so that the Philistines were full of envy
Gen  Now all the waterholes which his fathers servants had made in the days of Abraham had been stopped up with earth by the Philistines
Gen  And Abimelech said to Isaac Go away from us for you are stronger than we are
Gen  So Isaac went away from there and put up his tents in the valley of Gerar making his livingplace there
Gen  And he made again the waterholes which had been made in the days of Abraham his father and which had been stopped up by the Philistines and he gave them the names which his father had given them
Gen  Now Isaacs servants made holes in the valley and came to a spring of flowing water
Gen  But the herdmen of Gerar had a fight with Isaacs herdmen for they said The spring is ours so he gave the spring the name of Esek because there was a fight about it
Gen  Then they made another waterhole and there was a fight about that so he gave it the name of Sitnah
Gen  Then he went away from there and made another waterhole about which there was no fighting so he gave it the name of Rehoboth for he said Now the Lord has made room for us and we will have fruit in this land
Gen  And from there he went on to Beersheba
Gen  That night the Lord came to him in a vision and said I am the God of your father Abraham have no fear for I am with you blessing you and your seed will be increased because of my servant Abraham
Gen  Then he made an altar there and gave worship to the name of the Lord and he put up his tents there and there his servants made a waterhole
Gen  And Abimelech had come to him from Gerar with Ahuzzath his friend and Phicol the captain of his army
Gen  And Isaac said to them Why have you come to me seeing that in your hate for me you sent me away from you
Gen  And they said We saw clearly that the Lord was with you so we said Let there be an oath between us and you and let us make an agreement with you
Gen  That you will do us no damage even as we put no hand on you and did you nothing but good and sent you away in peace and now the blessing of the Lord is on you
Gen  Then he made a feast for them and they all had food and drink
Gen  And early in the morning they took an oath one to the other then Isaac sent them away and they went on their way in peace
Gen  And that day Isaacs servants came to him and gave him word of the waterhole which they had made and said to him We have come to water
Gen  And he gave it the name of Shibah so the name of that town is Beersheba to this day

Gen  And Isaac and Rebekah had grief of mind because of them

Gen  And he said See now I am old and my death may take place at any time
Gen  So take your arrows and your bow and go out to the field and get meat for me
Gen  And make me food good to the taste such as is pleasing to me and put it before me so that I may have a meal and give you my blessing before death comes to me

Gen  Go and get some roes meat and make me a good meal so that I may be full and give you my blessing before the Lord before my death
Gen  Now my son do what I say
Gen  Go to the flock and get me two fat young goats and I will make of them a meal to your fathers taste

Gen  And he made ready a meal good to the taste and took it to his father and said to him Let my father get up and take of his sons meat so that you may give me a blessing
Gen  And Isaac his father said to him Who are you And he said I am your oldest son Esau
Gen  And in great fear Isaac said Who then is he who got meat and put it before me and I took it all before you came and gave him a blessing and his it will be

Gen  And he said Your brother came with deceit and took away your blessing

Gen  And Isaac answering said But I have made him your master and have given him all his brothers for servants I have made him strong with grain and wine what then am I to do for you my son
Gen  And Esau said to his father Is that the only blessing you have my father give a blessing to me even me And Esau was overcome with weeping
Gen  Then Isaac his father made answer and said to him Far from the fertile places of the earth and far from the dew of heaven on high will your livingplace be

Gen  Then Rebekah hearing what Esau had said sent for Jacob her younger son and said to him It seems that your brother Esau is purposing to put you to death
Gen  So now my son do what I say go quickly to Haran to my brother Laban
Gen  And be there with him for a little time till your brothers wrath is turned away

Gen  So Isaac sent Jacob away and he went to Paddanaram to Laban son of Bethuel the Aramaean the brother of Rebekah the mother of Jacob and Esau
Gen  So when Esau saw that Isaac had given Jacob his blessing and sent him away to Paddanaram to get a wife for himself there blessing him and saying to him Do not take a wife from among the women of Canaan
Gen  And that Jacob had done as his father and mother said and had gone to Paddanaram
Gen  It was clear to Esau that his father had no love for the women of Canaan
