Gen  So Jacob went out from Beersheba to go to Haran
Gen  And coming to a certain place he made it his restingplace for the night for the sun had gone down and he took one of the stones which were there and putting it under his head he went to sleep in that place
Gen  And he had a dream and in his dream he saw steps stretching from earth to heaven and the angels of God were going up and down on them
Gen  And he saw the Lord by his side saying I am the Lord the God of Abraham your father and the God of Isaac I will give to you and to your seed this land on which you are sleeping
Gen  Your seed will be like the dust of the earth covering all the land to the west and to the east to the north and to the south you and your seed will be a name of blessing to all the families of the earth
Gen  And truly I will be with you and will keep you wherever you go guiding you back again to this land and I will not give you up till I have done what I have said to you
Gen  And Jacob awaking from his sleep said Truly the Lord is in this place and I was not conscious of it
Gen  And fear came on him and he said This is a holy place this is nothing less than the house of God and the doorway of heaven
Gen  And early in the morning Jacob took the stone which had been under his head and put it up as a pillar and put oil on it
Gen  And he gave that place the name of Bethel but before that time the town was named Luz
Gen  Then Jacob took an oath and said If God will be with me and keep me safe on my journey and give me food and clothing to put on
Gen  So that I come again to my fathers house in peace then I will take the Lord to be my God
Gen  And this stone which I have put up for a pillar will be Gods house and of all you give me I will give a tenth part to you
Gen  Then Jacob went on his journey till he came to the land of the children of the East
Gen  And there he saw a waterhole in a field and by the side of it three flocks of sheep for there they got water for the sheep and on the mouth of the waterhole there was a great stone
Gen  And all the flocks would come together there and when the stone had been rolled away they would give the sheep water and put the stone back again in its place on the mouth of the waterhole
Gen  Then Jacob said to the herdmen My brothers where do you come from And they said From Haran
Gen  And he said to them Have you any knowledge of Laban the son of Nahor And they said We have
Gen  And he said to them Is he well And they said He is well and here is Rachel his daughter coming with the sheep
Gen  Then Jacob said The sun is still high and it is not time to get the cattle together get water for the sheep and go and give them their food
Gen  And they said We are not able to do so till all the flocks have come together and the stone has been rolled away from the mouth of the waterhole then we will get water for the sheep
Gen  While he was still talking with them Rachel came with her fathers sheep for she took care of them
Gen  Then when Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mothers brother coming with Labans sheep he came near and rolling the stone away from the mouth of the hole he got water for Labans flock
Gen  And weeping for joy Jacob gave Rachel a kiss
Gen  And Rachel hearing from Jacob that he was her fathers relation and that he was the son of Rebekah went running to give her father news of it
Gen  And Laban hearing news of Jacob his sisters son came running and took Jacob in his arms and kissing him made him come into his house And Jacob gave him news of everything
Gen  And Laban said to him Truly you are my bone and my flesh And he kept Jacob with him for the space of a month
Gen  Then Laban said to Jacob Because you are my brother are you to be my servant for nothing say now what is your payment to be
Gen  Now Laban had two daughters the name of the older was Leah and the name of the younger was Rachel
Gen  And Leahs eyes were clouded but Rachel was fair in face and form
Gen  And Jacob was in love with Rachel and he said I will be your servant seven years for Rachel your younger daughter
Gen  And Laban said It is better for you to have her than another man go on living here with me
Gen  And Jacob did seven years work for Rachel and because of his love for her it seemed to him only a very little time
Gen  Then Jacob said to Laban Give me my wife so that I may have her for the days are ended
Gen  And Laban got together all the men of the place and gave a feast
Gen  And in the evening he took Leah his daughter and gave her to him and he went in to her
Gen  And Laban gave Zilpah his servantgirl to Leah to be her waitingwoman
Gen  And in the morning Jacob saw that it was Leah and he said to Laban What have you done to me was I not working for you so that I might have Rachel why have you been false to me
Gen  And Laban said In our country we do not let the younger daughter be married before the older
Gen  Let the week of the bridefeast come to its end and then we will give you the other in addition if you will be my servant for another seven years
Gen  And Jacob did so and when the week was ended Laban gave him his daughter Rachel for his wife
Gen  And Laban gave Rachel his servantgirl Bilhah to be her waitingwoman
Gen  Then Jacob took Rachel as his wife and his love for her was greater than his love for Leah and he went on working for Laban for another seven years
Gen  Now the Lord seeing that Leah was not loved gave her a child while Rachel had no children
Gen  And Leah was with child and gave birth to a son to whom she gave the name Reuben for she said The Lord has seen my sorrow now my husband will have love for me
Gen  Then she became with child again and gave birth to a son and said Because it has come to the Lords ears that I am not loved he has given me this son in addition and she gave him the name Simeon
Gen  And she was with child again and gave birth to a son and said Now at last my husband will be united to me because I have given him three sons so he was named Levi
Gen  And she was with child again and gave birth to a son and she said This time I will give praise to the Lord so he was named Judah after this she had no more children for a time
Gen  Now Rachel because she had no children was full of envy of her sister and she said to Jacob If you do not give me children I will not go on living
Gen  But Jacob was angry with Rachel and said Am I in the place of God who has kept your body from having fruit
Gen  Then she said Here is my servant Bilhah go in to her so that she may have a child on my knees and I may have a family by her
Gen  So she gave him her servant Bilhah as a wife and Jacob went in to her
Gen  And Bilhah became with child and gave birth to a son
Gen  Then Rachel said God has been my judge and has given ear to my voice and has given me a son so he was named Dan
Gen  And again Bilhah Rachels servant was with child and gave birth to a second son
Gen  And Rachel said I have had a great fight with my sister and I have overcome her and she gave the child the name Naphtali
Gen  When it was clear to Leah that she would have no more children for a time she gave Zilpah her servant to Jacob as a wife
Gen  And Zilpah Leahs servant gave birth to a son
Gen  And Leah said It has gone well for me and she gave him the name Gad
Gen  And Zilpah Leahs servant gave birth to a second son
Gen  And Leah said Happy am I and all women will give witness to my joy and she gave him the name Asher
Gen  Now at the time of the graincutting Reuben saw some lovefruits in the field and took them to his mother Leah And Rachel said to her Let me have some of your sons lovefruits
Gen  But Leah said to her Is it a small thing that you have taken my husband from me and now would you take my sons lovefruits Then Rachel said You may have him tonight in exchange for your sons lovefruits
Gen  In the evening when Jacob came in from the field Leah went out to him and said Tonight you are to come to me for I have given my sons lovefruits as a price for you And he went in to her that night
Gen  And God gave ear to her and she became with child and gave Jacob a fifth son
Gen  Then Leah said God has made payment to me for giving my servantgirl to my husband so she gave her son the name Issachar
Gen  And again Leah became with child and she gave Jacob a sixth son
Gen  And she said God has given me a good brideprice now at last will I have my husband living with me for I have given him six sons and she gave him the name Zebulun
Gen  After that she had a daughter to whom she gave the name Dinah
Gen  Then God gave thought to Rachel and hearing her prayer he made her fertile
Gen  And she was with child and gave birth to a son and she said God has taken away my shame
Gen  And she gave him the name Joseph saying May the Lord give me another son
Gen  Now after the birth of Joseph Jacob said to Laban Let me go away to my place and my country
Gen  Give me my wives and my children for whom I have been your servant and let me go for you have knowledge of all the work I have done for you
Gen  And Laban said If you will let me say so do not go away for I have seen by the signs that the Lord has been good to me because of you
Gen  Say then what your payment is to be and I will give it
Gen  Then Jacob said You have seen what I have done for you and how your cattle have done well under my care
Gen  For before I came you had little and it has been greatly increased and the Lord has given you a blessing in everything I have done but when am I to do something for my family
Gen  And Laban said What am I to give you And Jacob said Do not give me anything but I will again take up the care of your flock if you will only do this for me
Gen  Let me go through all your flock today taking out from among them all the sheep which are marked or coloured or black and all the marked or coloured goats these will be my payment
Gen  And so you will be able to put my honour to the test in time to come if you see among my flocks any goats which are not marked or coloured or any sheep which is not black you may take me for a thief
Gen  And Laban said Let it be as you say
Gen  So that day he took all the hegoats which were banded or coloured and all the shegoats which were marked or coloured or had white marks and all the black sheep and gave them into the care of his sons
Gen  And sent them three days journey away and Jacob took care of the rest of Labans flock
Gen  Then Jacob took young branches of trees cutting off the skin so that the white wood was seen in bands
Gen  And he put the banded sticks in the drinkingplaces where the flock came to get water and they became with young when they came to the water
Gen  And because of this the flock gave birth to young which were marked with bands of colour
Gen  These lambs Jacob kept separate and he put his flock in a place by themselves and not with Labans flock
Gen  And whenever the stronger ones of the flock became with young Jacob put the sticks in front of them in the drinkingplaces so that they might become with young when they saw the sticks
Gen  But when the flocks were feeble he did not put the sticks before them so that the feebler flocks were Labans and the stronger were Jacobs
Gen  So Jacobs wealth was greatly increased he had great flocks and womenservants and menservants and camels and asses
Gen  Now it came to the ears of Jacob that Labans sons were saying Jacob has taken away all our fathers property and in this way he has got all this wealth
Gen  And Jacob saw that Labans feeling for him was no longer what it had been before
Gen  Then the Lord said to Jacob Go back to the land of your fathers and to your relations and I will be with you
Gen  And Jacob sent for Rachel and Leah to come to him in the field among his flock
Gen  And he said to them It is clear to me that your fathers feeling is no longer what it was to me but the God of my father has been with me
Gen  And you have seen how I have done all in my power for your father
Gen  But your father has not kept faith with me and ten times he has made changes in my payment but God has kept him from doing me damage
Gen  If he said All those in the flock which have marks are to be yours then all the flock gave birth to marked young and if he said All the banded ones are to be yours then all the flock had banded young
Gen  So God has taken away your fathers cattle and has given them to me
Gen  And at the time when the flock were with young I saw in a dream that all the hegoats which were joined with the shegoats were banded and marked and coloured
Gen  And in my dream the angel of the Lord said to me Jacob and I said Here am I
Gen  And he said See how all the hegoats are banded and marked and coloured for I have seen what Laban has done to you
Gen  I am the God of Bethel where you put oil on the pillar and took an oath to me now then come out of this land and go back to the country of your birth
Gen  Then Rachel and Leah said to him in answer What part or heritage is there for us in our fathers house
Gen  Are we not as people from a strange country to him for he took a price for us and now it is all used up
Gen  For the wealth which God has taken from him is ours and our childrens so now whatever God has said to you do
Gen  Then Jacob put his wives and his sons on camels
Gen  And sending on before him all his cattle and his property which he had got together in Paddanaram he made ready to go to Isaac his father in the land of Canaan
Gen  Now Laban had gone to see to the cutting of the wool of his sheep so Rachel secretly took the images of the gods of her fathers house
Gen  And Jacob went away secretly without giving news of his flight to Laban the Aramaean
Gen  So he went away with all he had and went across the River in the direction of the hillcountry of Gilead
Gen  And on the third day Laban had news of Jacobs flight
Gen  And taking the men of his family with him he went after him for seven days and overtook him in the hillcountry of Gilead
Gen  Then God came to Laban in a dream by night and said to him Take care that you say nothing good or bad to Jacob
Gen  Now when Laban overtook him Jacob had put up his tent in the hillcountry and Laban and his brothers put up their tents in the hillcountry of Gilead
Gen  And Laban said to Jacob Why did you go away secretly taking my daughters away like prisoners of war
Gen  Why did you make a secret of your flight not giving me word of it so that I might have sent you away with joy and songs with melody and music
Gen  You did not even let me give a kiss to my sons and my daughters This was a foolish thing to do
Gen  It is in my power to do you damage but the God of your father came to me this night saying Take care that you say nothing good or bad to Jacob
Gen  And now it seems you are going because your hearts desire is for your fathers house but why have you taken my gods
Gen  And Jacob in answer said to Laban My fear was that you might take your daughters from me by force
Gen  As for your gods if anyone of us has them let him be put to death make search before us all for what is yours and take it For Jacob had no knowledge that Rachel had taken them
Gen  So Laban went into Jacobs tent and into Leahs tent and into the tents of the two servantwomen but they were not there and he came out of Leahs tent and went into Rachels
Gen  Now Rachel had taken the images and had put them in the camels basket and was seated on them And Laban searching through all the tent did not come across them
Gen  And she said to her father Let not my lord be angry because I do not get up before you for I am in the common condition of women And with all his searching he did not come across the images
Gen  Then Jacob was angry with Laban and said What crime or sin have I done that you have come after me with such passion
Gen  Now that you have made search through all my goods what have you seen which is yours Make it clear now before my people and your people so that they may be judges between us
Gen  These twenty years I have been with you your sheep and your goats have had young without loss not one of your hegoats have I taken for food
Gen  Anything which was wounded by beasts I did not take to you but myself made up for the loss of it you made me responsible for whatever was taken by thieves by day or by night
Gen  This was my condition wasted by heat in the day and by the bitter cold at night and sleep went from my eyes
Gen  These twenty years I have been in your house I was your servant for fourteen years because of your daughters and for six years I kept your flock and ten times was my payment changed
Gen  If the God of my father the God of Abraham and the Fear of Isaac had not been with me you would have sent me away with nothing in my hands But God has seen my troubles and the work of my hands and this night he kept you back
Gen  Then Laban answering said These women are my daughters and these children my children the flocks and all you see are mine what now may I do for my daughters and for their children
Gen  Come let us make an agreement you and I and let it be for a witness between us
Gen  Then Jacob took a stone and put it up as a pillar
Gen  And Jacob said to his people Get stones together and they did so and they had a meal there by the stones
Gen  And the name Laban gave it was Jegarsahadutha but Jacob gave it the name of Galeed
Gen  And Laban said These stones are a witness between you and me today For this reason its name was Galeed
Gen  And Mizpah for he said May the Lord keep watch on us when we are unable to see one anothers doings
Gen  If you are cruel to my daughters or if you take other wives in addition to my daughters then though no man is there to see God will be the witness between us
Gen  And Laban said See these stones and this pillar which I have put between you and me
Gen  They will be witness that I will not go over these stones to you and you will not go over these stones or this pillar to me for any evil purpose
Gen  May the God of Abraham and the God of Nahor the God of their father be our judge Then Jacob took an oath by the Fear of his father Isaac
Gen  And Jacob made an offering on the mountain and gave orders to his people to take food so they had a meal and took their rest that night on the mountain
Gen  And early in the morning Laban after kissing and blessing his daughters went on his way back to his country
Gen  And on his way Jacob came face to face with the angels of God
Gen  And when he saw them he said This is the army of God so he gave that place the name of Mahanaim
Gen  Now Jacob sent servants before him to Esau his brother in the land of Seir the country of Edom
Gen  And he gave them orders to say these words to Esau Your servant Jacob says Till now I have been living with Laban
Gen  And I have oxen and asses and flocks and menservants and womenservants and I have sent to give my lord news of these things so that I may have grace in his eyes
Gen  When the servants came back they said We have seen your brother Esau and he is coming out to you and four hundred men with him
Gen  Then Jacob was in great fear and trouble of mind and he put all the people and the flocks and the herds and the camels into two groups
Gen  And said If Esau meeting one group makes an attack on them the others will get away safely
Gen  Then Jacob said O God of my father Abraham the God of my father Isaac the Lord who said to me Go back to your country and your family and I will be good to you
Gen  I am less than nothing in comparison with all your mercies and your faith to me your servant for with only my stick in my hand I went across Jordan and now I have become two armies
Gen  Be my saviour from the hand of Esau my brother for my fear is that he will make an attack on me putting to death mother and child
Gen  And you said Truly I will be good to you and make your seed like the sand of the sea which may not be numbered
Gen  Then he put up his tent there for the night and from among his goods he took as an offering for his brother Esau
Gen  Two hundred shegoats and twenty hegoats two hundred females and twenty males from the sheep
Gen  Thirty camels with their young ones forty cows ten oxen twenty asses and ten young asses
Gen  These he gave to his servants every herd by itself and he said to his servants Go on before me and let there be a space between one herd and another
Gen  And he gave orders to the first saying When my brother Esau comes to you and says Whose servant are you and where are you going and whose are these herds
Gen  Then say to him These are your servant Jacobs they are an offering for my lord for Esau and he himself is coming after us
Gen  And he gave the same orders to the second and the third and to all those who were with the herds saying This is what you are to say to Esau when you see him
Gen  And you are to say further Jacob your servant is coming after us For he said to himself I will take away his wrath by the offering which I have sent on and then I will come before him it may be that I will have grace in his eyes
Gen  So the servants with the offerings went on in front and he himself took his rest that night in the tents with his people
Gen  And in the night he got up and taking with him his two wives and the two servantwomen and his eleven children he went over the river Jabbok
Gen  He took them and sent them over the stream with all he had
Gen  Then Jacob was by himself and a man was fighting with him till dawn
Gen  But when the man saw that he was not able to overcome Jacob he gave him a blow in the hollow part of his leg so that his leg was damaged
Gen  And he said to him Let me go now for the dawn is near But Jacob said I will not let you go till you have given me your blessing
Gen  Then he said What is your name And he said Jacob
Gen  And he said Your name will no longer be Jacob but Israel for in your fight with God and with men you have overcome
Gen  Then Jacob said What is your name And he said What is my name to you Then he gave him a blessing
Gen  And Jacob gave that place the name of Peniel saying I have seen God face to face and still I am living
Gen  And while he was going past Peniel the sun came up And he went with unequal steps because of his damaged leg
Gen  For this reason the children of Israel even today never take that muscle in the hollow of the leg as food because the hollow of Jacobs leg was touched
Gen  Then Jacob lifting up his eyes saw Esau coming with his four hundred men So he made a division of the children between Leah and Rachel and the two womenservants
Gen  He put the servants and their children in front Leah and her children after them and Rachel and Joseph at the back
Gen  And he himself going before them went down on his face to the earth seven times till he came near his brother
Gen  Then Esau came running up to him and folding him in his arms gave him a kiss and the two of them were overcome with weeping
Gen  Then Esau lifting up his eyes saw the women and the children and said Who are these with you And he said The children whom God in his mercy has given to your servant
Gen  Then the servants and their children came near and went down on their faces
Gen  And Leah came near with her children and then Joseph and Rachel and they did the same
Gen  And he said What were all those herds which I saw on the way And Jacob said They were an offering so that I might have grace in my lords eyes
Gen  But Esau said I have enough keep what is yours my brother for yourself
Gen  And Jacob said Not so but if I have grace in your eyes take them as a sign of my love for I have seen your face as one may see the face of God and you have been pleased with me
Gen  Take my offering then with my blessing for God has been very good to me and I have enough so at his strong request he took it
Gen  And he said Let us go on our journey together and I will go in front
Gen  But Jacob said My lord may see that the children are only small and there are young ones in my flocks and herds one days overdriving will be the destruction of all the flock
Gen  Do you my lord go on before your servant I will come on slowly at the rate at which the cattle and the children are able to go till I come to my lord at Seir
Gen  And Esau said Then keep some of my men with you And he said What need is there for that if my lord is pleased with me
Gen  So Esau turning back that day went on his way to Seir
Gen  And Jacob went on to Succoth where he made a house for himself and put up tents for his cattle for this reason the place was named Succoth
Gen  So Jacob came safely from Paddanaram to the town of Shechem in the land of Canaan and put up his tents near the town
Gen  And for a hundred bits of money he got from the children of Hamor the builder of Shechem the field in which he had put up his tents
Gen  And there he put up an altar naming it El the God of Israel
Gen  Now Dinah the daughter whom Leah had by Jacob went out to see the women of that country
Gen  And when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite who was the chief of that land saw her he took her by force and had connection with her
Gen  Then his heart went out in love to Dinah the daughter of Jacob and he said comforting words to her
Gen  And Shechem said to Hamor his father Get me this girl for my wife
Gen  Now Jacob had word of what Shechem had done to his daughter but his sons were in the fields with the cattle and Jacob said nothing till they came
Gen  Then Hamor the father of Shechem came out to have a talk with Jacob
Gen  Now the sons of Jacob came in from the fields when they had news of it and they were wounded and very angry because of the shame he had done in Israel by having connection with Jacobs daughter and they said Such a thing is not to be done
Gen  But Hamor said to them Shechem my son is full of desire for your daughter will you then give her to him for a wife
Gen  And let our two peoples be joined together give your daughters to us and take our daughters for yourselves
Gen  Go on living with us and the country will be open to you do trade and get property there
Gen  And Shechem said to her father and her brothers If you will give ear to my request whatever you say I will give to you
Gen  However great you make the brideprice and payment I will give it only let me have the girl for my wife
Gen  But the sons of Jacob gave a false answer to Shechem and Hamor his father because of what had been done to Dinah their sister
Gen  And they said It is not possible for us to give our sister to one who is without circumcision for that would be a cause of shame to us
Gen  But on this condition only will we come to an agreement with you if every male among you becomes like us and undergoes circumcision
Gen  Then we will give our daughters to you and take your daughters to us and go on living with you as one people
Gen  But if you will not undergo circumcision as we say then we will take our daughter and go
Gen  And their words were pleasing to Hamor and his son Shechem
Gen  And without loss of time the young man did as they said because he had delight in Jacobs daughter and he was the noblest of his fathers house
Gen  Then Hamor and Shechem his son went to the meetingplace of their town and said to the men of the town
Gen  It is the desire of these men to be at peace with us let them then go on living in this country and doing trade here for the country is wide open before them let us take their daughters as wives and let us give them our daughters
Gen  But these men will make an agreement with us to go on living with us and to become one people only on the condition that every male among us undergoes circumcision as they have done
Gen  Then will not their cattle and their goods and all their beasts be ours so let us come to an agreement with them so that they may go on living with us
Gen  Then all the men of the town gave ear to the words of Hamor and Shechem his son and every male in the town underwent circumcision
Gen  But on the third day after before the wounds were well two of the sons of Jacob Simeon and Levi Dinahs brothers took their swords and came into the town by surprise and put all the males to death
Gen  And Hamor and his son they put to death with the sword and they took Dinah from Shechems house and went away
Gen  And the sons of Jacob came on them when they were wounded and made waste the town because of what had been done to their sister
Gen  They took their flocks and their herds and their asses and everything in their town and in their fields
Gen  And all their wealth and all their little ones and their wives everything in their houses they took and made them waste
Gen  And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi You have made trouble for me and given me a bad name among the people of this country among the Canaanites and the Perizzites and because we are small in number they will come together against me and make war on me and it will be the end of me and all my people
Gen  But they said Were we to let him make use of our sister as a loose woman
Gen  And God said to Jacob Go up now to Bethel and make your livingplace there and put up an altar there to the God who came to you when you were in flight from your brother Esau
Gen  Then Jacob said to all his people Put away the strange gods which are among you and make yourselves clean and put on a change of clothing
Gen  And let us go up to Bethel and there I will make an altar to God who gave me an answer in the day of my trouble and was with me wherever I went
Gen  Then they gave to Jacob all the strange gods which they had and the rings which were in their ears and Jacob put them away under the holy tree at Shechem
Gen  So they went on their journey and the fear of God was on the towns round about so that they made no attack on the sons of Jacob
Gen  And Jacob came to Luz in the land of Canaan which is the same as Bethel he and all his people
Gen  And there he made an altar naming the place Elbethel because it was there he had the vision of God when he was in flight from his brother
Gen  And Deborah the servant who had taken care of Rebekah from her birth came to her end and was put to rest near Bethel under the holy tree and they gave it the name of Allonbacuth
Gen  Now when Jacob was on his way from Paddanaram God came to him again and blessing him said
Gen  Jacob is your name but it will be so no longer from now your name will be Israel so he was named Israel
Gen  And God said to him I am God the Ruler of all be fertile and have increase a nation truly a group of nations will come from you and kings will be your offspring
Gen  And the land which I gave to Abraham and Isaac I will give to you and to your seed after you I will give the land
Gen  Then God went up from him in the place where he had been talking with him
Gen  And Jacob put up a pillar in the place where he had been talking with God and put a drink offering on it and oil
Gen  And he gave to the place where God had been talking with him the name of Bethel
Gen  So they went on from Bethel and while they were still some distance from Ephrath the pains of birth came on Rachel and she had a hard time
Gen  And when her pain was very great the woman who was helping her said Have no fear for now you will have another son
Gen  And in the hour when her life went from her for death came to her she gave the child the name Benoni but his father gave him the name of Benjamin
Gen  So Rachel came to her end and was put to rest on the road to Ephrath which is Bethlehem
Gen  And Jacob put up a pillar on her restingplace which is named The Pillar of the restingplace of Rachel to this day
Gen  And Israel went journeying on and put up his tents on the other side of the tower of the flock
Gen  Now while they were living in that country Reuben had connection with Bilhah his fathers servantwoman and Israel had news of it
Gen  Now Jacob had twelve sons the sons of Leah Reuben Jacobs first son and Simeon and Levi and Judah and Issachar and Zebulun
Gen  The sons of Rachel Joseph and Benjamin
Gen  The sons of Bilhah Rachels servant Dan and Naphtali
Gen  The sons of Zilpah Leahs servant Gad and Asher these are the sons whom Jacob had in Paddanaram
Gen  And Jacob came to his father Isaac at Mamre at Kiriatharba that is Hebron where Abraham and Isaac had been living
Gen  And Isaac was a hundred and eighty years old
Gen  Then Isaac came to his end and was put to rest with his fathers people an old man after a long life and Jacob and Esau his sons put him in his last restingplace
Gen  Now these are the generations of Esau that is to say Edom
Gen  Esaus wives were women of Canaan Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite and Oholibamah the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite
Gen  And Basemath Ishmaels daughter the sister of Nebaioth
Gen  Adah had a son Eliphaz and Basemath was the mother of Reuel
Gen  Oholibamah was the mother of Jeush Jalam and Korah these are the sons of Esau whose birth took place in the land of Canaan
Gen  Esau took his wives and his sons and his daughters and all the people of his house and his beasts and his cattle and all his goods which he had got together in the land of Canaan and went into the land of Seir away from his brother Jacob
Gen  For their wealth was so great that the land was not wide enough for the two of them and all their cattle
Gen  So Esau made his livingplace in the hillcountry of Seir Esau is Edom
Gen  And these are the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in the hillcountry of Seir
Gen  These are the names of Esaus sons Eliphaz the son of Esaus wife Adah and Reuel the son of Esaus wife Basemath
Gen  The sons of Eliphaz were Teman Omar Zepho Gatam and Kenaz
Gen  And Eliphaz the son of Esau had connection with a woman named Timna who gave birth to Amalek all these were the children of Esaus wife Adah
Gen  And these are the sons of Reuel Nahath Zerah Shammah and Mizzah they were the children of Esaus wife Basemath
Gen  And these are the sons of Esaus wife Oholibamah the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon she was the mother of Jeush Jalam and Korah
Gen  These were the chiefs among the sons of Esau the sons of Eliphaz Esaus first son Teman Omar Zepho Kenaz
Gen  Korah Gatam Amalek all these were chiefs in the land of Edom the offspring of Eliphaz the seed of Adah
Gen  And these are the sons of Esaus son Reuel Nahath Zerah Shammah Mizzah these were the chiefs of Reuel in the land of Edom the children of Esaus wife Basemath
Gen  And these are the sons of Esaus wife Oholibamah Jeush Jalam and Korah these were the chiefs who came from Esaus wife Oholibamah daughter of Anah
Gen  These were the sons of Esau that is Edom and these were their chiefs
Gen  These are the sons of Seir the Horite who were living in that country Lotan Shobal Zibeon Anah
Gen  Dishon Ezer and Dishan these are the chiefs of the Horites offspring of Seir in the land of Edom
Gen  The children of Lotan were Hori and Hemam Lotans sister was Timna
Gen  And these are the children of Shobal Alvan Manahath Ebal Shepho and Onam
Gen  And these are the children of Zibeon Aiah and Anah that same Anah who made the discovery of the watersprings in the waste land when he was looking after the asses of his father Zibeon
Gen  And these are the children of Anah Dishon and Oholibamah his daughter
Gen  These are the children of Dishon Hemdan Eshban Ithran and Keran
Gen  These are the children of Ezer Bilhan Zaavan and Akan
Gen  These are the children of Dishan Uz and Aran
Gen  These were the Horite chiefs Lotan Shobal Zibeon Anah
Gen  Dishon Ezer and Dishan Such were the Horite chiefs in their order in the land of Seir
Gen  And these are the kings who were ruling in the land of Edom before there was any king over the children of Israel
Gen  Bela son of Beor was king in Edom and the name of his chief town was Dinhabah
Gen  At his death Jobab son of Zerah of Bozrah became king in his place
Gen  And at the death of Jobab Husham from the country of the Temanites became king in his place
Gen  And at the death of Husham Hadad son of Bedad who overcame the Midianites in the field of Moab became king his chief town was named Avith
Gen  And at the death of Hadad Samlah of Masrekah became king
Gen  And at the death of Samlah Shaul of Rehoboth by the River became king in his place
Gen  And at the death of Shaul Baalhanan son of Achbor became king
Gen  And at the death of Baalhanan Hadar became king in his place his chief town was named Pau and his wifes name was Mehetabel she was the daughter of Matred the daughter of Mezahab
Gen  These are the names of the chiefs of Esau in the order of their families and their places Timna Alvah Jetheth
Gen  Oholibamah Elah Pinon
Gen  Kenaz Teman Mibzar
Gen  Magdiel Iram these are the Edomite chiefs in their places in their heritage this is Esau the father of the Edomites
Gen  Now Jacob was living in the land where his father had made a place for himself in the land of Canaan
Gen  These are the generations of Jacob Joseph a boy seventeen years old was looking after the flock together with his brothers the sons of Bilhah and Zilpah his fathers wives and Joseph gave their father a bad account of them
Gen  Now the love which Israel had for Joseph was greater than his love for all his other children because he got him when he was an old man and he had a long coat made for him
Gen  And because his brothers saw that Joseph was dearer to his father than all the others they were full of hate for him and would not say a kind word to him
Gen  Now Joseph had a dream and he gave his brothers an account of it which made their hate greater than ever
Gen  And he said to them Let me give you the story of my dream
Gen  We were in the field getting the grain stems together and my grain kept upright and yours came round and went down on the earth before mine
Gen  And his brothers said to him Are you to be our king will you have authority over us And because of his dream and his words their hate for him became greater than ever
Gen  Then he had another dream and gave his brothers an account of it saying I have had another dream the sun and the moon and eleven stars gave honour to me
Gen  And he gave word of it to his father and his brothers but his father protesting said What sort of a dream is this am I and your mother and your brothers to go down on our faces to the earth before you
Gen  And his brothers were full of envy but his father kept his words in mind
Gen  Now his brothers went to keep watch over their fathers flock in Shechem
Gen  And Israel said to Joseph Are not your brothers with the flock in Shechem come I will send you to them And he said to him Here am I
Gen  And he said to him Go now and see if your brothers are well and how the flock is then come back and give me word So he sent him out of the valley of Hebron and he came to Shechem
Gen  And a man saw him wandering in the country and said to him What are you looking for
Gen  And he said I am looking for my brothers please give me word of where they are keeping their flock
Gen  And the man said They have gone away from here for they said in my hearing Let us go to Dothan So Joseph went after them and came up with them at Dothan
Gen  But they saw him when he was a long way off and before he came near them they made a secret design against him to put him to death
Gen  Saying to one another See here comes this dreamer
Gen  Let us now put him to death and put his body into one of these holes and we will say An evil beast has put him to death then we will see what becomes of his dreams
Gen  But Reuben hearing these words got him out of their hands saying Let us not take his life
Gen  Do not put him to a violent death but let him be placed in one of the holes this he said to keep him safe from their hands with the purpose of taking him back to his father again
Gen  So when Joseph came to his brothers they took off his long coat which he had on
Gen  And they took him and put him in the hole now the hole had no water in it
Gen  Then seating themselves they took their meal and looking up they saw a travelling band of Ishmaelites coming from Gilead on their way to Egypt with spices and perfumes on their camels
Gen  And Judah said to his brothers What profit is there in putting our brother to death and covering up his blood
Gen  Let us give him to these Ishmaelites for a price and let us not put violent hands on him for he is our brother our flesh And his brothers gave ear to him
Gen  And some traders from Midian went by so pulling Joseph up out of the hole they gave him to the Ishmaelites for twenty bits of silver and they took him to Egypt
Gen  Now when Reuben came back to the hole Joseph was not there and giving signs of grief
Gen  He went back to his brothers and said The child is gone what am I to do
Gen  Then they took Josephs coat and put on it some of the blood from a young goat which they had put to death
Gen  And they took the coat to their father and said We came across this is it your sons coat or not
Gen  And he saw that it was and said It is my sons coat an evil beast has put him to death without doubt Joseph has come to a cruel end
Gen  Then Jacob giving signs of grief put on haircloth and went on weeping for his son day after day
Gen  And all his sons and all his daughters came to give him comfort but he would not be comforted saying with weeping I will go down to the underworld to my son So great was his fathers sorrow for him
Gen  And in Egypt the men of Midian gave him for a price to Potiphar a captain of high position in Pharaohs house
Gen  Now at that time Judah went away from his brothers and became the friend of a man of Adullam named Hirah
Gen  And there he saw the daughter of a certain man of Canaan named Shua and took her as his wife
Gen  And she gave birth to a son and he gave him the name Er
Gen  And again she gave birth to a son and he gave him the name Onan
Gen  Then she had another son to whom she gave the name Shelah she was at Chezib when the birth took place
Gen  And Judah took a wife for his first son Er and her name was Tamar
Gen  Now Er Judahs first son did evil in the eyes of the Lord so that he put him to death
Gen  Then Judah said to Onan Go in to your brothers wife and do what it is right for a husbands brother to do make her your wife and get offspring for your brother
Gen  But Onan seeing that the offspring would not be his went in to his brothers wife but let his seed go on to the earth so that he might not get offspring for his brother
Gen  And what he did was evil in the eyes of the Lord so that he put him to death like his brother
Gen  Then Judah said to Tamar his daughterinlaw Go back to your fathers house and keep yourself as a widow till my son Shelah becomes a man for he had in his mind the thought that death might come to him as it had come to his brothers So Tamar went back to her fathers house
Gen  And after a time Bathshua Judahs wife came to her end and after Judah was comforted for her loss he went to Timnah where they were cutting the wool of his sheep and his friend Hirah of Adullam went with him
Gen  And when Tamar had news that her fatherinlaw was going up to Timnah to the woolcutting
Gen  She took off her widows clothing and covering herself with her veil she took her seat near Enaim on the road to Timnah for she saw that Shelah was now a man but she had not been made his wife
Gen  When Judah saw her he took her to be a loose woman of the town because her face was covered
Gen  And turning to her by the roadside he said to her Let me come in to you for he had no idea that she was his daughterinlaw And she said What will you give me as my price
Gen  And he said I will give you a young goat from the flock And she said What will you give me as a sign till you send it
Gen  And he said What would you have And she said Your ring and its cord and the stick in your hand So he gave them to her and went in to her and she became with child by him
Gen  Then she got up and went away and took off her veil and put on her widows clothing
Gen  Then Judah sent his friend Hirah with the young goat to get back the things which he had given as a sign to the woman but she was not there
Gen  And he put questions to the men of the place saying Where is the loose woman who was in Enaim by the wayside And they said There was no such woman there
Gen  So he went back to Judah and said I have not seen her and the men of the place say that there is no such woman there
Gen  And Judah said Let her keep the things so that we may not be shamed I sent the young goat but you did not see the woman
Gen  Now about three months after this word came to Judah that Tamar his daughterinlaw had been acting like a loose woman and was with child And Judah said Take her out and let her be burned
Gen  And while she was being taken out she sent word to her fatherinlaw saying The man whose property these things are is the father of my child say then whose are this ring and this cord and this stick
Gen  Then Judah said openly that they were his and said She is more upright than I am for I did not give her to Shelah my son And he had no more connection with her
Gen  And when the time came for her to give birth it was clear that there were two children in her body
Gen  And while she was in the act of giving birth one of them put out his hand and the woman who was with her put a red thread round his hand saying This one came out first
Gen  But then he took his hand back again and his brother came first to birth and the woman said What an opening you have made for yourself So he was named Perez
Gen  And then his brother came out with the red thread round his hand and he was named Zerah
Gen  Now Joseph was taken down to Egypt and Potiphar the Egyptian a captain of high position in Pharaohs house got him for a price from the Ishmaelites who had taken him there
Gen  And the Lord was with Joseph and he did well and he was living in the house of his master the Egyptian
Gen  And his master saw that the Lord was with him making everything he did go well
Gen  And having a high opinion of Joseph as his servant he made him the overseer of his house and gave him control over all he had
Gen  And from the time when he made him overseer and gave him control of all his property the blessing of the Lord was with the Egyptian because of Joseph the blessing of the Lord was on all he had in the house and in the field
Gen  And he gave Joseph control of all his property keeping no account of anything but only the food which was put before him Now Joseph was very beautiful in form and face
Gen  And after a time his masters wife looking on Joseph with desire said to him Be my lover
Gen  But he would not and said to her You see that my master keeps no account of what I do in his house and has put all his property in my control
Gen  So that no one has more authority in this house than I have he has kept nothing back from me but you because you are his wife how then may I do this great wrong sinning against God
Gen  And day after day she went on requesting Joseph to come to her and be her lover but he would not give ear to her
Gen  Now one day he went into the house to do his work and not one of the men of the house was inside
Gen  And pulling at his coat she said Come to my bed but slipping out of his coat he went running away
Gen  And when she saw that he had got away letting her keep his coat
Gen  She sent for the men of her house and said to them See he has let a Hebrew come here and make sport of us he came to my bed and I gave a loud cry
Gen  And hearing it he went running out without his coat
Gen  And she kept his coat by her till his master came back
Gen  Then she gave him the same story saying The Hebrew servant whom you have taken into our house came in to make sport of me
Gen  And when I gave a loud cry he went running out without his coat
Gen  And hearing his wifes account of what his servant had done he became very angry
Gen  And Josephs master took him and put him in prison in the place where the kings prisoners were kept in chains and he was there in the prisonhouse
Gen  But the Lord was with Joseph and was good to him and made the keeper of the prison his friend
Gen  And the keeper of the prison put all the prisoners under Josephs control and he was responsible for whatever was done there
Gen  And the keeper of the prison gave no attention to anything which was under his care because the Lord was with him and the Lord made everything he did go well
Gen  Now after these things the chief servant who had the care of the wine and the chief breadmaker in Pharaohs house did something against Pharaohs orders
Gen  And Pharaoh was angry with his two servants with the chief wineservant and the chief breadmaker
Gen  And he put them in prison under the care of the captain of the army in the same prison where Joseph himself was shut up
Gen  And the captain put them in Josephs care and he did what was needed for them and they were kept in prison for some time
Gen  And these two had a dream on the same night the chief wineservant and the chief breadmaker of the king of Egypt who were in prison the two of them had dreams with a special sense
Gen  And in the morning when Joseph came to them he saw that they were looking sad
Gen  And he said to the servants of Pharaoh who were in prison with him Why are you looking so sad
Gen  Then they said to him We have had a dream and no one is able to give us the sense And Joseph said Does not the sense of dreams come from God what was your dream
Gen  Then the chief wineservant gave Joseph an account of his dream and said In my dream I saw a vine before me
Gen  And on the vine were three branches and it seemed as if it put out buds and flowers and from them came grapes ready for cutting
Gen  And Pharaohs cup was in my hand and I took the grapes and crushing them into Pharaohs cup gave the cup into Pharaohs hand
Gen  Then Joseph said This is the sense of your dream the three branches are three days
Gen  After three days Pharaoh will give you honour and put you back into your place and you will give him his cup as you did before when you were his wineservant
Gen  But keep me in mind when things go well for you and be good to me and say a good word for me to Pharaoh and get me out of this prison
Gen  For truly I was taken by force from the land of the Hebrews and I have done nothing for which I might be put in prison
Gen  Now when the chief breadmaker saw that the first dream had a good sense he said to Joseph I had a dream and in my dream there were three baskets of white bread on my head
Gen  And in the top basket were all sorts of cooked meats for Pharaoh and the birds were taking them out of the baskets on my head
Gen  Then Joseph said This is the sense of your dream the three baskets are three days
Gen  After three days Pharaoh will take you out of prison hanging you on a tree so that your flesh will be food for birds
Gen  Now the third day was Pharaohs birthday and he gave a feast for all his servants and he gave honour to the chief wineservant and the chief breadmaker among the others
Gen  And he put the chief wineservant back in his old place and he gave the cup into Pharaohs hand
Gen  But the chief breadmaker was put to death by hanging as Joseph had said
Gen  But the wineservant did not keep Joseph in mind or give a thought to him
Gen  Now after two years had gone by Pharaoh had a dream and in his dream he was by the side of the Nile
Gen  And out of the Nile came seven cows goodlooking and fat and their food was the rivergrass
Gen  And after them seven other cows came out of the Nile poorlooking and thin and they were by the side of the other cows
Gen  And the seven thin cows made a meal of the seven fat cows Then Pharaoh came out of his sleep
Gen  But he went to sleep again and had a second dream in which he saw seven heads of grain full and good all on one stem
Gen  And after them came up seven other heads thin and wasted by the east wind
Gen  And the seven thin heads made a meal of the good heads And when Pharaoh was awake he saw it was a dream
Gen  And in the morning his spirit was troubled and he sent for all the wise men of Egypt and all the holy men and put his dream before them but no one was able to give him the sense of it
Gen  Then the chief wineservant said to Pharaoh The memory of my sin comes back to me now
Gen  Pharaoh had been angry with his servants and had put me in prison in the house of the captain of the army together with the chief breadmaker
Gen  And we had a dream on the same night the two of us and the dreams had a special sense
Gen  And there was with us a young Hebrew the captains servant and when we put our dreams before him he gave us the sense of them
Gen  And it came about as he said I was put back in my place and the breadmaker was put to death by hanging
Gen  Then Pharaoh sent for Joseph and they took him quickly out of prison and when his hair had been cut and his dress changed he came before Pharaoh
Gen  And Pharaoh said to Joseph I have had a dream and no one is able to give me the sense of it now it has come to my ears that you are able to give the sense of a dream when it is put before you
Gen  Then Joseph said Without God there will be no answer of peace for Pharaoh
Gen  Then Pharaoh said In my dream I was by the side of the Nile
Gen  And out of the Nile came seven cows fat and goodlooking and their food was the rivergrass
Gen  Then after them came seven other cows very thin and poorlooking worse than any I ever saw in the land of Egypt
Gen  And the thin cows made a meal of the seven fat cows who came up first
Gen  And even with the fat cows inside them they seemed as bad as before And so I came out of my sleep
Gen  And again in a dream I saw seven heads of grain full and good coming up on one stem
Gen  And then I saw seven other heads dry thin and wasted by the east wind coming up after them
Gen  And the seven thin heads made a meal of the seven good heads and I put this dream before the wise men but not one of them was able to give me the sense of it
Gen  Then Joseph said These two dreams have the same sense God has made clear to Pharaoh what he is about to do
Gen  The seven fat cows are seven years and the seven good heads of grain are seven years the two have the same sense
Gen  The seven thin and poorlooking cows who came up after them are seven years and the seven heads of grain dry and wasted by the east wind are seven years when there will be no food
Gen  As I said to Pharaoh before God has made clear to him what he is about to do
Gen  Seven years are coming in which there will be great wealth of grain in Egypt
Gen  And after that will come seven years when there will not be enough food and the memory of the good years will go from mens minds and the land will be made waste by the bad years
Gen  And men will have no memory of the good time because of the need which will come after for it will be very bitter
Gen  And this dream came to Pharaoh twice because this thing is certain and God will quickly make it come about
Gen  And now let Pharaoh make search for a man of wisdom and good sense and put him in authority over the land of Egypt
Gen  Let Pharaoh do this and let him put overseers over the land of Egypt to put in store a fifth part of the produce of the land in the good years
Gen  And let them get together all the food in those good years and make a store of grain under Pharaohs control for the use of the towns and let them keep it
Gen  And let that food be kept in store for the land till the seven bad years which are to come in Egypt so that the land may not come to destruction through need of food
Gen  And this seemed good to Pharaoh and to all his servants
Gen  Then Pharaoh said to his servants Where may we get such a man as this a man in whom is the spirit of God
Gen  And Pharaoh said to Joseph Seeing that God has made all this clear to you there is no other man of such wisdom and good sense as you
Gen  You then are to be over my house and all my people will be ruled by your word only as king will I be greater than you
Gen  And Pharaoh said to Joseph See I have put you over all the land of Egypt
Gen  Then Pharaoh took off his ring from his hand and put it on Josephs hand and he had him clothed with the best linen and put a chain of gold round his neck
Gen  And he made him take his seat in the second of his carriages and they went before him crying Make way So he made him ruler over all the land of Egypt
Gen  Then Pharaoh said to Joseph I am Pharaoh and without your order no man may do anything in all the land of Egypt
Gen  And Pharaoh gave Joseph the name of Zaphnathpaaneah and he gave him Asenath the daughter of Potiphera the priest of On to be his wife So Joseph went through all the land of Egypt
Gen  Now Joseph was thirty years old when he came before Pharaoh king of Egypt And Joseph went out from before the face of Pharaoh and went through all the land of Egypt
Gen  Now in the seven good years the earth gave fruit in masses
Gen  And Joseph got together all the food of those seven years and made a store of food in the towns the produce of the fields round every town was stored up in the town
Gen  So he got together a store of grain like the sand of the sea so great a store that after a time he gave up measuring it for it might not be measured
Gen  And before the time of need Joseph had two sons to whom Asenath the daughter of Potiphera priest of On gave birth
Gen  And to the first he gave the name Manasseh for he said God has taken away from me all memory of my hard life and of my fathers house
Gen  And to the second he gave the name Ephraim for he said God has given me fruit in the land of my sorrow
Gen  And so the seven good years in Egypt came to an end
Gen  Then came the first of the seven years of need as Joseph had said and in every other land they were short of food but in the land of Egypt there was bread
Gen  And when all the land of Egypt was in need of food the people came crying to Pharaoh for bread and Pharaoh said to the people Go to Joseph and whatever he says to you do it
Gen  And everywhere on the earth they were short of food then Joseph opening all his storehouses gave the people of Egypt grain for money so great was the need of food in the land of Egypt
Gen  And all lands sent to Egypt to Joseph to get grain for the need was great over all the earth
Gen  Now Jacob hearing that there was grain in Egypt said to his sons Why are you looking at one another
Gen  And he said I have had news that there is grain in Egypt go down there and get grain for us so that life and not death may be ours
Gen  So Josephs ten brothers went down to get grain from Egypt
Gen  But Jacob did not send Benjamin Josephs brother with them for fear as he said that some evil might come to him
Gen  And the sons of Israel came with all the others to get grain for they were very short of food in the land of Canaan
Gen  Now Joseph was ruler over all the land and it was he who gave out the grain to all the people of the land and Josephs brothers came before him and went down on their faces to the earth
Gen  And when Joseph saw his brothers it was clear to him who they were but he made himself strange to them and talking roughly to them said Where do you come from And they said From the land of Canaan to get food
Gen  Now though Joseph saw that these were his brothers they had no idea who he was
Gen  Then the memory of his dreams about them came back to Joseph and he said to them You have come secretly to see how poor the land is
Gen  And they said to him Not so my lord your servants have come with money to get food
Gen  We are all one mans sons we are true men we have not come with any secret purpose
Gen  And he said to them No but you have come to see how poor the land is
Gen  Then they said We your servants are twelve brothers sons of one man in the land of Canaan the youngest of us is now with our father and one is dead
Gen  And Joseph said It is as I said you have come with some secret purpose
Gen  But in this way will you be put to the test by the life of Pharaoh you will not go away from this place till your youngest brother comes here
Gen  Send one of your number to get your brother and the rest of you will be kept in prison so that your words may be tested to see if you are true if not by the life of Pharaoh your purpose is certainly secret
Gen  So he put them in prison for three days
Gen  And on the third day Joseph said to them Do this if you would keep your lives for I am a godfearing man
Gen  If you are true men let one of you be kept in prison while you go and take grain for the needs of your families
Gen  And come back to me with your youngest brother so that your words may be seen to be true and you will not be put to death This is what you are to do
Gen  And they said to one another Truly we did wrong to our brother for we saw his grief of mind and we did not give ear to his prayers that is why this trouble has come on us
Gen  And Reuben said to them Did I not say to you Do the child no wrong but you gave no attention so now punishment has come on us for his blood
Gen  They were not conscious that the sense of their words was clear to Joseph for he had been talking to them through one who had knowledge of their language
Gen  And turning away from them he was overcome with weeping then he went on talking to them again and took Simeon and put chains on him before their eyes
Gen  Then Joseph gave orders for their bags to be made full of grain and for every mans money to be put back into his bag and for food to be given them for the journey which was done
Gen  Then they put the bags of grain on their asses and went away
Gen  Now at their nights restingplace one of them opening his bag to give his ass some food saw his money in the mouth of the bag
Gen  And he said to his brothers My money has been given back it is in my bag then their hearts became full of fear and turning to one another they said What is this which God has done to us
Gen  So when they came to Jacob their father in the land of Canaan they gave him an account of all their experiences saying
Gen  The man who is the ruler of the country was rough with us and put us in prison saying that we had come with a secret evil purpose
Gen  And we said to him We are true men we have no evil designs
Gen  We are twelve brothers sons of our father one is dead and the youngest is now with our father in the land of Canaan
Gen  And the ruler of the land said In this way I may be certain that you are true men let one of you be kept here with me while you go and take grain for the needs of your families
Gen  And come back to me with your youngest brother then I will be certain that you are true men and I will give your brother back to you and let you do trade in the land
Gen  And when they took the grain out of their bags it was seen that every mans parcel of money was in his bag and when they and their father saw the money they were full of fear
Gen  And Jacob their father said to them You have taken my children from me Joseph is gone and Simeon is gone and now you would take Benjamin away all these things have come on me
Gen  And Reuben said Put my two sons to death if I do not come back to you with him let him be in my care and I will give him safely back to you
Gen  And he said I will not let my son go down with you for his brother is dead and he is all I have if evil overtakes him on the journey then through you will my grey head go down to the underworld in sorrow
Gen  Now the land was in bitter need of food
Gen  And when the grain which they had got in Egypt was all used up their father said to them Go again and get us a little food
Gen  And Judah said to him The man said to us with an oath You are not to come before me again without your brother
Gen  If you will let our brother go with us we will go down and get food
Gen  But if you will not send him we will not go down for the man said to us You are not to come before me if your brother is not with you
Gen  And Israel said Why were you so cruel to me as to say to him that you had a brother
Gen  And they said The man put a number of questions to us about ourselves and our family saying Is your father still living have you another brother And we had to give him answers how were we to have any idea that he would say Come back with your brother
Gen  Then Judah said to Israel his father Send the boy with me and let us be up and going so that we and you and our little ones may not come to destruction
Gen  Put him into my care and make me responsible for him if I do not give him safely back to you let mine be the sin for ever
Gen  Truly if we had not let the time go by we might have come back again by now
Gen  Then their father Israel said to them If it has to be so then do this take of the best fruits of the land in your vessels to give the man perfumes and honey and spices and nuts
Gen  And take twice as much money with you that is to say take back the money which was put in your bags for it may have been an error
Gen  And take your brother and go back to the man
Gen  And may God the Ruler of all give you mercy before the man so that he may give you back your other brother and Benjamin If my children are to be taken from me there is no help for it
Gen  So they took what their father said for the man and twice as much money in their hands and Benjamin and went on their journey to Egypt and came before Joseph
Gen  And when Joseph saw Benjamin he said to his chief servant Take these men into my house and make ready a meal for they will take food with me in the middle of the day
Gen  And the servant did as Joseph said and took the men into Josephs house
Gen  Now the men were full of fear because they had been taken into Josephs house and they said It is because of the money which was put back in our bags the first time he is looking for something against us so that he may come down on us and take us and our asses for his use
Gen  So they went up to Josephs chief servant at the door of the house
Gen  And said O my lord we only came down the first time to get food
Gen  And when we came to our nights restingplace on opening our bags we saw that every mans money was in the mouth of his bag all our money in full weight and we have it with us to give it back
Gen  As well as more money with which to get food we have no idea who put our money in our bags
Gen  Then the servant said Peace be with you have no fear your God even the God of your father has put wealth in your bags for you I had your money Then he let Simeon come out to them
Gen  And the servant took them into Josephs house and gave them water for washing their feet and he gave their asses food
Gen  And they got ready the things for Joseph before he came in the middle of the day for word was given to them that they were to have a meal there
Gen  And when Joseph came in they gave him the things which they had for him and went down to the earth before him
Gen  And he said How are you is your father well the old man of whom you were talking to me is he still living
Gen  And they said Your servant our father is well he is still living And they went down on their faces before him
Gen  Then lifting up his eyes he saw Benjamin his brother his mothers son and he said Is this your youngest brother of whom you gave me word And he said God be good to you my son
Gen  Then Josephs heart went out to his brother and he went quickly into his room for he was overcome with weeping
Gen  Then after washing his face he came out and controlling his feelings said Put food before us
Gen  And they put a meal ready for him by himself and for them by themselves and for the Egyptians who were with him by themselves because the Egyptians may not take food with the Hebrews for that would make them unclean
Gen  And they were all given their seats before him in order of birth from the oldest to the youngest so that they were looking at one another in wonder
Gen  And Joseph sent food to them from his table but he sent five times as much to Benjamin as to any of the others And they took wine freely with him

Exo  And he said to his people See the people of Israel are greater in number and in power than we are
Exo  Let us take care for fear that their numbers may become even greater and if there is a war they may be joined with those who are against us and make an attack on us and go up out of the land
Exo  So they put overseers of forced work over them in order to make their strength less by the weight of their work And they made storetowns for Pharaoh Pithom and Raamses
Exo  But the more cruel they were to them the more their number increased till all the land was full of them And the children of Israel were hated by the Egyptians
Exo  And they gave the children of Israel even harder work to do
Exo  And made their lives bitter with hard work making buildingmaterial and bricks and doing all sorts of work in the fields under the hardest conditions
Exo  And the king of Egypt said to the Hebrew women who gave help at the time of childbirth the name of the one was Shiphrah and the name of the other Puah
Exo  When you are looking after the Hebrew women in childbirth if it is a son you are to put him to death but if it is a daughter she may go on living
Exo  But the women had the fear of God and did not do as the king of Egypt said but let the male children go on living
Exo  And the king of Egypt sent for the women and said to them Why have you done this and let the male children go on living
Exo  And they said to Pharaoh Because the Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women for they are strong and the birth takes place before we come to them
Exo  And the blessing of God was on these women and the people were increased in number and became very strong
Exo  And because the women who took care of the Hebrew mothers had the fear of God he gave them families
Exo  And Pharaoh gave orders to all his people saying Every son who comes to birth is to be put into the river but every daughter may go on living
Exo  Now a man of the house of Levi took as his wife a daughter of Levi
Exo  And she became with child and gave birth to a Son and when she saw that he was a beautiful child she kept him secretly for three months
Exo  And when she was no longer able to keep him secret she made him a basket out of the stems of waterplants pasting sticky earth over it to keep the water out and placing the baby in it she put it among the plants by the edge of the Nile
Exo  And his sister took her place at a distance to see what would become of him
Exo  Now Pharaohs daughter came down to the Nile to take a bath while her women were walking by the riverside and she saw the basket among the riverplants and sent her servantgirl to get it
Exo  And opening it she saw the child and he was crying And she had pity on him and said This is one of the Hebrews children
Exo  Then his sister said to Pharaohs daughter May I go and get you one of the Hebrew women to give him the breast
Exo  And Pharaohs daughter said to her Go And the girl went and got the childs mother
Exo  And Pharaohs daughter said to her Take the child away and give it milk for me and I will give you payment And the woman took the child and gave it milk at her breast
Exo  And when the child was older she took him to Pharaohs daughter and he became her son and she gave him the name Moses Because she said I took him out of the water
Exo  Now when Moses had become a man one day he went out to his people and saw how hard their work was and he saw an Egyptian giving blows to a Hebrew one of his people
Exo  And turning this way and that and seeing no one he put the Egyptian to death covering his body with sand
Exo  And he went out the day after and saw two of the Hebrews fighting and he said to him who was in the wrong Why are you fighting your brother
Exo  And he said Who made you a ruler and a judge over us are you going to put me to death as you did the Egyptian And Moses was in fear and said It is clear that the thing has come to light
Exo  Now when Pharaoh had news of this he would have put Moses to death But Moses went in flight from Pharaoh into the land of Midian and he took his seat by a waterspring
Exo  Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters and they came to get water for their fathers flock
Exo  And the keepers of the sheep came up and were driving them away but Moses got up and came to their help watering their flock for them
