Lev  And on the fifteenth day of the same month is the feast of unleavened bread for seven days let your food be unleavened bread
Lev  On the first day you will have a holy meeting you may do no sort of fieldwork
Lev  And every day for seven days you will give a burned offering to the Lord and on the seventh day there will be a holy meeting you may do no fieldwork
Lev  And the Lord said to Moses
Lev  Say to the children of Israel When you have come to the land which I will give you and have got in the grain from its fields take some of the firstfruits of the grain to the priest
Lev  And let the grain be waved before the Lord so that you may be pleasing to him on the day after the Sabbath let it be waved by the priest
Lev  And on the day of the waving of the grain you are to give a male lamb of the first year without any mark for a burned offering to the Lord
Lev  And let the meal offering with it be two tenth parts of an ephah of the best meal mixed with oil an offering made by fire to the Lord for a sweet smell and the drink offering with it is to be of wine the fourth part of a hin
Lev  And you may take no bread or dry grain or new grain for food till the very day on which you have given the offering for your God this is a rule for ever through all your generations wherever you are living
Lev  And let seven full weeks be numbered from the day after the Sabbath the day when you give the grain for the wave offering
Lev  Let fifty days be numbered to the day after the seventh Sabbath then you are to give a new meal offering to the Lord
Lev  Take from your houses two cakes of bread made of a fifth part of an ephah of the best meal cooked with leaven to be waved for firstfruits to the Lord
Lev  And with the bread take seven lambs of the first year without any marks and one ox and two male sheep to be a burned offering to the Lord with their meal offering and their drink offerings an offering of a sweet smell made by fire to the Lord
Lev  And you are to give one male goat for a sinoffering and two male lambs of the first year for peaceofferings
Lev  And these will be waved by the priest with the bread of the firstfruits for a wave offering to the Lord with the two lambs they will be holy to the Lord for the priest
Lev  And on the same day let it be given out that there will be a holy meeting for you you may do no fieldwork on that day it is a rule for ever through all your generations wherever you are living
Lev  And when you get in the grain from your land do not let all the grain at the edges of the field be cut and do not take up the grain which has been dropped in the field let that be for the poor and for the man from another country I am the Lord your God
Lev  And the Lord said to Moses
Lev  Say to the children of Israel In the seventh month on the first day of the month let there be a special day of rest for you a day of memory marked by the blowing of horns a meeting for worship
Lev  Do no fieldwork and give to the Lord an offering made by fire
Lev  And the Lord said to Moses
Lev  The tenth day of this seventh month is the day for the taking away of sin let it be a holy day of worship you are to keep from pleasure and give to the Lord an offering made by fire
Lev  And on that day you may do no sort of work for it is a day of taking away sin to make you clean before the Lord your God
Lev  For any person whoever he may be who takes his pleasure on that day will be cut off from his people
Lev  And if any person whoever he may be on that day does any sort of work I will send destruction on him from among his people
Lev  You may not do any sort of work this is an order for ever through all your generations wherever you may be living
Lev  Let this be a Sabbath of special rest to you and keep yourselves from all pleasure on the ninth day of the month at nightfall from evening to evening let this Sabbath be kept
Lev  And the Lord said to Moses
Lev  Say to the children of Israel On the fifteenth day of this seventh month let the feast of tents be kept to the Lord for seven days
Lev  On the first day there will be a holy meeting do no fieldwork
Lev  Every day for seven days give an offering made by fire to the Lord and on the eighth day there is to be a holy meeting when you are to give an offering made by fire to the Lord this is a special holy day you may do no fieldwork on that day
Lev  These are the fixed feasts of the Lord to be kept by you as holy days of worship for making an offering by fire to the Lord a burned offering a meal offering an offering of beasts and drink offerings every one on its special day
Lev  In addition to the Sabbaths of the Lord and in addition to the things you give and the oaths you make and the free offerings to the Lord
Lev  But on the fifteenth day of the seventh month when you have got in all the fruits of the land you will keep the feast of the Lord for seven days the first day will be a Sabbath and the eighth day the same
Lev  On the first day take the fruit of fair trees branches of palmtrees and branches of thick trees and trees from the riverside and be glad before the Lord for seven days
Lev  And let this feast be kept before the Lord for seven days in the year it is a rule for ever from generation to generation in the seventh month let it be kept
Lev  For seven days you will be living in tents all those who are Israelites by birth are to make tents their livingplaces
Lev  So that future generations may keep in mind how I gave the children of Israel tents as their livingplaces when I took them out of the land of Egypt I am the Lord your God
Lev  And Moses made clear to the children of Israel the orders about the fixed feasts of the Lord
Lev  And the Lord said to Moses
Lev  Give orders to the children of Israel to give you clean olive oil for the light so that a light may be burning at all times
Lev  Outside the veil of the ark in the Tent of meeting let Aaron see that it is burning from evening till morning at all times before the Lord it is a rule for ever through all your generations
Lev  Let Aaron put the lights in order on the support before the Lord at all times
Lev  And take the best meal and make twelve cakes of it a fifth part of an ephah in every cake
Lev  And put them in two lines six in a line on the holy table before the Lord
Lev  And on the lines of cakes put clean sweetsmelling spices for a sign on the bread an offering made by fire to the Lord
Lev  Every Sabbath day regularly the priest is to put it in order before the Lord it is offered for the children of Israel an agreement made for ever
Lev  And it will be for Aaron and his sons they are to take it for food in a holy place it is the most holy of all the offerings made by fire to the Lord a rule for ever
Lev  And a son of an Israelite woman whose father was an Egyptian went out among the children of Israel and had a fight with a man of Israel by the tents
Lev  And the son of the Israelite woman said evil against the holy Name with curses and they took him to Moses His mothers name was Shelomith the daughter of Dibri of the tribe of Dan
Lev  And they kept him shut up till a decision might be given by the mouth of the Lord
Lev  And the Lord said to Moses
Lev  Take the curser outside the tentcircle and let all in whose hearing the words were said put their hands on his head and let him be stoned by all the people
Lev  And say to the children of Israel As for any man cursing God his sin will be on his head
Lev  And he who says evil against the name of the Lord will certainly be put to death he will be stoned by all the people the man who is not of your nation and one who is an Israelite by birth whoever says evil against the holy Name is to be put to death
Lev  And anyone who takes anothers life is certainly to be put to death
Lev  And anyone wounding a beast and causing its death will have to make payment for it a life for a life
Lev  And if a man does damage to his neighbour as he has done so let it be done to him
Lev  Wound for wound eye for eye tooth for tooth whatever damage he has done so let it be done to him
Lev  He who puts a beast to death will have to make payment for it he who puts a man to death will himself be put to death
Lev  You are to have the same law for a man of another nation living among you as for an Israelite for I am the Lord your God
Lev  And Moses said these words to the children of Israel and they took the man who had been cursing outside the tentcircle and had him stoned The children of Israel did as the Lord gave orders to Moses
Lev  And the Lord said to Moses on Mount Sinai
Lev  Say to the children of Israel When you come into the land which I will give you let the land keep a Sabbath to the Lord
Lev  For six years put seed into your land and for six years give care to your vines and get in the produce of them
Lev  But let the seventh year be a Sabbath of rest for the land a Sabbath to the Lord do not put seed into your land or have your vines cut
Lev  That which comes to growth of itself may not be cut and the grapes of your uncaredfor vines may not be taken off let it be a year of rest for the land
Lev  And the Sabbath of the land will give food for you and your manservant and your womanservant and those working for payment and for those of another country who are living among you
Lev  And for your cattle and the beasts on the land all the natural increase of the land will be for food
Lev  And let seven Sabbaths of years be numbered to you seven times seven years even the days of seven Sabbaths of years that is fortynine years
Lev  Then let the loud horn be sounded far and wide on the tenth day of the seventh month on the day of taking away sin let the horn be sounded through all your land
Lev  And let this fiftieth year be kept holy and say publicly that everyone in the land is free from debt it is the Jubilee and every man may go back to his heritage and to his family
Lev  Let this fiftieth year be the Jubilee no seed may be planted and that which comes to growth of itself may not be cut and the grapes may not be taken from the uncaredfor vines
Lev  For it is the Jubilee and it is holy to you your food will be the natural increase of the field
Lev  In this year of Jubilee let every man go back to his heritage
Lev  And in the business of trading goods for money do no wrong to one another
Lev  Let your exchange of goods with your neighbours have relation to the number of years after the year of Jubilee and the number of times the earth has given her produce
Lev  If the number of years is great the price will be increased and if the number of years is small the price will be less for it is the produce of a certain number of years which the man is giving you
Lev  And do no wrong one to another but let the fear of your God be before you for I am the Lord your God
Lev  So keep my rules and my decisions and do them and you will be safe in your land
Lev  And the land will give her fruit and you will have food in full measure and be safe in the land
Lev  And if you say Where will our food come from in the seventh year when we may not put in seed or get in the increase
Lev  Then I will send my blessing on you in the sixth year and the land will give fruit enough for three years
Lev  And in the eighth year you will put in your seed and get your food from the old stores till the fruit of the ninth year is ready
Lev  No exchange of land may be for ever for the land is mine and you are as my guests living with me for a time
Lev  Wherever there is property in land the owner is to have the right of getting it back
Lev  If your brother becomes poor and has to give up some of his land for money his nearest relation may come and get back that which his brother has given up
Lev  And if he has no one to get it back for him and later he himself gets wealth and has enough money to get it back
Lev  Then let him take into account the years from the time when he gave it up and make up the loss for the rest of the years to him who took it and so get back his property
Lev  But if he is not able to get it back for himself then it will be kept by him who gave a price for it till the year of Jubilee and in that year it will go back to its first owner and he will have his property again
Lev  And if a man gives his house in a walled town for money he has the right to get it back for the space of a full year after he has given it up
Lev  And if he does not get it back by the end of the year then the house in the town will become the property of him who gave the money for it and of his children for ever it will not go from him in the year of Jubilee
Lev  But houses in small unwalled towns will be the same as property in the country they may be got back and they will go back to their owners in the year of Jubilee
Lev  But the houses in the towns of the Levites may be got back by the Levites at any time
Lev  And if a Levite does not give money to get back his property his house in the town which was exchanged for money will come back to him in the year of Jubilee For the houses of the towns of the Levites are their property among the children of Israel
Lev  But the land on the outskirts of their towns may not be exchanged for money for it is their property for ever
Lev  And if your brother becomes poor and is not able to make a living then you are to keep him with you helping him as you would a man from another country who is living among you
Lev  Take no interest from him in money or in goods but have the fear of your God before you and let your brother make a living among you
Lev  Do not take interest on the money which you let him have or on the food which you give him
Lev  I am the Lord your God who took you out of the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan that I might be your God
Lev  And if your brother becomes poor and gives himself to you for money do not make use of him like a servant who is your property
Lev  But let him be with you as a servant working for payment till the year of Jubilee
Lev  Then he will go out from you he and his children with him and go back to his family and to the property of his fathers
Lev  For they are my servants whom I took out from the land of Egypt they may not become the property of another
Lev  Do not be a hard master to him but have the fear of God before you
Lev  But you may get servants as property from among the nations round about from them you may take menservants and womenservants
Lev  And in addition you may get for money servants from among the children of other nations who are living with you and from their families which have come to birth in your land and these will be your property
Lev  And they will be your childrens heritage after you to keep as their property they will be your servants for ever but you may not be hard masters to your countrymen the children of Israel
Lev  And if one from another nation living among you gets wealth and your countryman at his side becomes poor and gives himself for money to the man from another nation or to one of his family
Lev  After he has given himself he has the right to be made free for a price by one of his brothers
Lev  Or his fathers brother or the son of his fathers brother or any near relation or if he gets money he may make himself free
Lev  And let the years be numbered from the time when he gave himself to his owner till the year of Jubilee and the price given for him will be in relation to the number of years on the scale of the payment of a servant
Lev  If there is still a long time he will give back on account of it a part of the price which was given for him
Lev  And if there is only a short time he will take account of it with his master and in relation to the number of years he will give back the price of making him free
Lev  And he will be with him as a servant working for payment year by year his master is not to be cruel to him before your eyes
Lev  And if he is not made free in this way he will go out in the year of Jubilee he and his children with him
Lev  For the children of Israel are servants to me they are my servants whom I took out of the land of Egypt I am the Lord your God
Lev  Do not make images of false gods or put up an image cut in stone or a pillar or any pictured stone in your land to give worship to it for I am the Lord your God
Lev  Keep my Sabbaths and give honour to my holy place I am the Lord
Lev  If you are guided by my rules and keep my laws and do them
Lev  Then I will give you rain at the right time and the land will give her increase and the trees of the field will give their fruit
Lev  And the crushing of the grain will overtake the cutting of the grapes and the cutting of the grapes will overtake the planting of the seed and there will be bread in full measure and you will be living in your land safely
Lev  And I will give you peace in the land and you will take your rest and no one will give you cause for fear and I will put an end to all evil beasts in the land and no sword of war will go through your land
Lev  And you will put to flight those who are against you and they will be put to death by your swords
Lev  Then five of you will put to flight a hundred and a hundred of you will put to flight ten thousand and all who are against you will be put to death by your swords
Lev  And I will have pleasure in you and make you fertile and greater in number and I will keep my agreement with you
Lev  And old stores long kept will be your food and you will take out the old because of the new
Lev  And I will put my holy House among you and my soul will not be turned away from you in disgust
Lev  And I will be present among you and will be your God and you will be my people
Lev  I am the Lord your God who took you out of the land of Egypt so that you might not be servants to them by me the cords of your yoke were broken and I made you go upright
Lev  But if you do not give ear to me and do not keep all these my laws
Lev  And if you go against my rules and if you have hate in your souls for my decisions and you do not do all my orders but go against my agreement
Lev  This will I do to you I will put fear in your hearts even wasting disease and burning pain drying up the eyes and making the soul feeble and you will get no profit from your seed for your haters will take it for food
Lev  And my face will be turned from you and you will be broken before those who are against you and your haters will become your rulers and you will go in flight when no man comes after you
Lev  And if even after these things you will not give ear to me then I will send you punishment seven times more for your sins
Lev  And the pride of your strength will be broken and I will make your heaven as iron and your earth as brass
Lev  And your strength will be used up without profit for your land will not give her increase and the trees of the field will not give their fruit
Lev  And if you still go against me and will not give ear to me I will put seven times more punishments on you because of your sins
Lev  I will let loose the beasts of the field among you and they will take away your children and send destruction on your cattle so that your numbers will become small and your roads become waste
Lev  And if by these things you will not be turned to me but still go against me
Lev  Then I will go against you and I will give you punishment I myself seven times for all your sins
Lev  And I will send a sword on you to give effect to the punishment of my agreement and when you come together into your towns I will send disease among you and you will be given up into the hands of your haters
Lev  When I take away your bread of life ten women will be cooking bread in one oven and your bread will be measured out by weight you will have food but never enough
Lev  And if after all this you do not give ear to me but go against me still
Lev  Then my wrath will be burning against you and I will give you punishment I myself seven times for your sins
Lev  Then you will take the flesh of your sons and the flesh of your daughters for food
Lev  And I will send destruction on your high places overturning your perfume altars and will put your dead bodies on your broken images and my soul will be turned from you in disgust
Lev  And I will make your towns waste and send destruction on your holy places I will take no pleasure in the smell of your sweet perfumes
Lev  And I will make your land a waste a wonder to your haters living in it
Lev  And I will send you out in all directions among the nations and my sword will be uncovered against you and your land will be without any living thing and your towns will be made waste
Lev  Then will the land take pleasure in its Sabbaths while it is waste and you are living in the land of your haters then will the land have rest
Lev  All the days while it is waste will the land have rest such rest as it never had in your Sabbaths when you were living in it
Lev  And as for the rest of you I will make their hearts feeble in the land of their haters and the sound of a leaf moved by the wind will send them in flight and they will go in flight as from the sword falling down when no one comes after them
Lev  Falling on one another as before the sword when no one comes after them you will give way before your haters
Lev  And death will overtake you among strange nations and the land of your haters will be your destruction
Lev  And those of you who are still living will be wasting away in their sins in the land of your haters in the sins of their fathers they will be wasting away
Lev  And they will have grief for their sins and for the sins of their fathers when their hearts were untrue to me and they went against me
Lev  So that I went against them and sent them away into the land of their haters if then the pride of their hearts is broken and they take the punishment of their sins
Lev  Then I will keep in mind the agreement which I made with Jacob and with Isaac and with Abraham and I will keep in mind the land
Lev  And the land while she is without them will keep her Sabbaths and they will undergo the punishment of their sins because they were turned away from my decisions and in their souls was hate for my laws
Lev  But for all that when they are in the land of their haters I will not let them go or be turned away from them or give them up completely my agreement with them will not be broken for I am the Lord their God
Lev  And because of them I will keep in mind the agreement which I made with their fathers whom I took out of the land of Egypt before the eyes of the nations to be their God I am the Lord
Lev  These are the rules decisions and laws which the Lord made between himself and the children of Israel in Mount Sinai by the hand of Moses
Lev  And the Lord said to Moses
Lev  Say to the children of Israel If a man makes a special oath you will give your decision as to the value of the persons for the Lord
Lev  And you will put the value of a male from twenty years to sixty years old at fifty shekels of silver by the scale of the holy place
Lev  And if it is a female the value will be thirty shekels
Lev  And if the person is from five to twenty years old the value will be twenty shekels for a male and ten for a female
Lev  And if the person is from one month to five years old then the value for a male will be five shekels of silver and for a female three shekels
Lev  And for sixty years old and over for a male the value will be fifteen shekels and for a female ten
Lev  But if he is poorer than the value which you have put on him then let him be taken to the priest and the priest will put a value on him such as it is possible for him to give
Lev  And if it is a beast of which men make offerings to the Lord whatever any man gives of such to the Lord will be holy
Lev  It may not be changed in any way a good given for a bad or a bad for a good if one beast is changed for another the two will be holy
Lev  And if it is any unclean beast of which offerings are not made to the Lord then let him take the beast before the priest
Lev  And let the priest put a value on it if it is good or bad whatever value the priest puts on it so will it be
Lev  But if he has a desire to get it back for himself let him give a fifth more than your value
Lev  And if a man has given his house as holy to the Lord then the priest will put a value on it if it is good or bad as the priest gives decision so will the value be fixed
Lev  And if the owner has a desire to get back his house let him give a fifth more than your value and it will be his
Lev  And if a man gives to the Lord part of the field which is his property then let your value be in relation to the seed which is planted in it a measure of barley grain will be valued at fifty shekels of silver
Lev  If he gives his field from the year of Jubilee the value will be fixed by your decision
Lev  But if he gives his field after the year of Jubilee the amount of the money will be worked out by the priest in relation to the number of years till the coming year of Jubilee and the necessary amount will be taken off your value
Lev  And if the man who has given the field has a desire to get it back let him give a fifth more than the price at which it was valued and it will be his
Lev  But if he has no desire to get it back or if he has given it for a price to another man it may not be got back again
Lev  But the field when it becomes free at the year of Jubilee will be holy to the Lord as a field given under oath it will be the property of the priest
Lev  And if a man gives to the Lord a field which he has got for money from another which is not part of his heritage
Lev  Then the value fixed by you up to the year of Jubilee will be worked out for him by the priest and in that day he will give the amount of your value as holy to the Lord
Lev  In the year of Jubilee the field will go back to him from whom he got it that is to him whose heritage it was
Lev  And let all your values be based on the shekel of the holy place that is twenty gerahs to the shekel
Lev  But a man may not give by oath to the Lord the firstfruits of cattle which are offered to the Lord if it is an ox or a sheep it is the Lords
Lev  And if it is an unclean beast then the owner of it may give money to get it back in agreement with the value fixed by you by giving a fifth more or if it is not taken back let it be given for money in agreement with your valuing
Lev  But nothing which a man has given completely to the Lord out of all his property of man or beast or of the land which is his heritage may be given away or got back in exchange for money anything completely given is most holy to the Lord
Lev  Any man given completely to the Lord may not be got back he is certainly to be put to death
Lev  And every tenth part of the land of the seed planted or of the fruit of trees is holy to the Lord
Lev  And if a man has a desire to get back any of the tenth part which he has given let him give a fifth more
Lev  And a tenth part of the herd and of the flock whatever goes under the rod of the valuer will be holy to the Lord
Lev  He may not make search to see if it is good or bad or make any changes in it and if he makes exchange of it for another the two will be holy he will not get them back again
Lev  These are the orders which the Lord gave to Moses for the children of Israel in Mount Sinai
Num  And the Lord said to Moses in the waste land of Sinai in the Tent of meeting on the first day of the second month in the second year after they came out of the land of Egypt

Num  And all the Levites who were numbered by Moses and Aaron and the chiefs of the people by families in the order of their fathers houses
Num  Those from thirty to fifty years old who were able to do the work of the Tent of meeting and of its transport
Num  Came to eight thousand five hundred and eighty
Num  At the order of the Lord they were numbered by Moses every one in relation to his work and to his part in the transport so they were numbered by Moses at the order of the Lord
Num  And the Lord said to Moses
Num  Give orders to the children of Israel to put outside the tentcircle every leper and anyone who has any sort of flow from his body and anyone who is unclean from the touch of the dead
Num  Male or female they are to be put outside the tentcircle so that they may not make unclean my restingplace among them
Num  So the children of Israel did as the Lord had said to Moses and put them outside the tentcircle
Num  And the Lord said to Moses
Num  Say to the children of Israel If a man or a woman does any of the sins of men going against the word of the Lord and is in the wrong
Num  Let them say openly what they have done and make payment for the wrong done with the addition of a fifth part and give it to him to whom the wrong was done
Num  But if the man has no relation to whom the payment may be made then the payment for sin made to the Lord will be the priests in addition to the sheep offered to take away his sin
Num  And every offering lifted up of all the holy things which the children of Israel give to the priest will be his
Num  And every mans holy things will be his whatever a man gives to the priest will be his
Num  And the Lord said to Moses
Num  Say to the children of Israel If any mans wife does wrong sinning against him
Num  By taking as her lover another man and keeps it secret so that her husband has no knowledge of it and there is no witness against her and she is not taken in the act
Num  If the spirit of doubt comes into her husbands heart and he has doubts of his wife with good cause or if he has doubts of her without cause
Num  Then let him take her to the priest offering for her the tenth part of an ephah of barley meal without oil or perfume for it is a meal offering of a bitter spirit a meal offering keeping wrongdoing in mind
Num  And the priest will make her come near and put her before the Lord
Num  And the priest will take holy water in a pot and put in it dust from the floor of the House
Num  And he will make the woman come before the Lord with her hair loose and will put the meal offering the offering of a bitter spirit in her hands and the priest will take in his hand the bitter water causing the curse
Num  And he will make her take an oath and say to her If no man has been your lover and you have not been with another in place of your husband you are free from this bitter water causing the curse
Num  But if you have been with another in place of your husband and have made yourself unclean with a lover
Num  Then the priest will put the oath of the curse on the woman and say to her May the Lord make you a curse and an oath among your people sending on you wasting of the legs and disease of the stomach
Num  And this water of the curse will go into your body causing disease of your stomach and wasting of your legs and the woman will say So be it
Num  And the priest will put these curses in a book washing out the writing with the bitter water
Num  And he will give to the woman the bitter water for drink and the bitter water causing the curse will go into her
Num  And the priest will take from her hand the meal offering of doubt waving it before the Lord and will take it to the altar
Num  And he will take some of it in his hand burning it on the altar as a sign and then he will give the woman the bitter water
Num  And it will be that if the woman has become unclean sinning against her husband when she has taken the bitter water it will go into her body causing disease of the stomach and wasting of the legs and she will be a curse among her people
Num  But if she is clean she will be free and will have offspring
Num  This is the law for testing a wife who goes with another in place of her husband and becomes unclean
Num  Or for a husband who in a bitter spirit has doubts in his heart about his wife let him take her to the priest who will put in force this law
Num  Then the man will be free from all wrong and the womans sin will be on her
Num  And the Lord said to Moses
Num  Say to the children of Israel If a man or a woman takes an oath to keep himself separate and give himself to the Lord
Num  He is to keep himself from wine and strong drink and take no mixed wine or strong drink or any drink made from grapes or any grapes green or dry
Num  All the time he is separate he may take nothing made from the grapevine from its seeds to its skin
Num  All the time he is under his oath let no blade come near his head till the days while he is separate are ended he is holy and his hair may not be cut
Num  All the time he is separate he may not come near any dead body
Num  He may not make himself unclean for his father or his mother his sister or his brother if death comes to them because he is under an oath to keep himself separate for God
Num  All the time he is separate he is holy to the Lord
Num  If death comes suddenly to a man at his side so that he becomes unclean let his hair be cut off on the day when he is made clean on the seventh day
Num  And on the eighth day let him take to the priest at the door of the Tent of meeting two doves or two young pigeons
Num  And the priest will give one for a sinoffering and the other for a burned offering to take away the sin which came on him on account of the dead and he will make his head holy that same day
Num  And he will give to the Lord his days of being separate offering a helamb of the first year as an offering for error but the earlier days will be a loss because he became unclean
Num  And this is the law for him who is separate when the necessary days are ended he is to come to the door of the Tent of meeting
Num  And make his offering to the Lord one helamb of the first year without a mark for a burned offering and one female lamb of the first year without a mark for a sinoffering and one male sheep without a mark for peaceofferings
Num  And a basket of unleavened bread cakes of the best meal mixed with oil and thin unleavened cakes covered with oil with their meal offering and drink offerings
Num  And the priest will take them before the Lord and make his sinoffering and his burned offering
Num  Giving the sheep of the peaceofferings with the basket of unleavened bread and at the same time the priest will make his meal offering and his drink offering
Num  Then let his long hair the sign of his oath be cut off at the door of the Tent of meeting and let him put it on the fire on which the peaceofferings are burning
Num  And the priest will take the cooked leg of the sheep and one unleavened cake and one thin cake out of the basket and put them on the hands of the separate one after his hair has been cut
Num  Waving them for a wave offering before the Lord this is holy for the priest together with the waved breast and the leg which is lifted up after that the man may take wine
Num  This is the law for him who takes an oath to keep himself separate and for his offering to the Lord on that account in addition to what he may be able to get this is the law of his oath which he will have to keep

Num  And when Moses went into the Tent of meeting to have talk with him then the Voice came to his ears from over the cover which was on the ark of witness from between the two winged ones And he had talk with him
Num  And the Lord said to Moses
Num  Say to Aaron When you put the lights in their places the seven lights will give light in front of the support
Num  And Aaron did so he put the lights in their places so that they gave light in front of the support as the Lord gave orders to Moses
Num  The support for the lights was of hammered gold work from its base to its flowers it was of hammered work from the design which the Lord had given to Moses he made the support for the lights
Num  And the Lord said to Moses
Num  Take the Levites out from among the children of Israel and make them clean
Num  And this is how you are to make them clean let the holy water which takes away sin be put on them and let the hair all over their bodies be cut off with a sharp blade and let their clothing be washed and their bodies made clean
Num  Then let them take a young ox and its meal offering crushed grain mixed with oil and take another ox for a sinoffering
Num  And make the Levites come forward in front of the Tent of meeting and let all the children of Israel come together
Num  And you are to take the Levites before the Lord and the children of Israel are to put their hands on them
Num  And Aaron is to give the Levites to the Lord as a wave offering from the children of Israel so that they may do the Lords work
Num  And the Levites are to put their hands on the heads of the oxen and one of the oxen is to be offered for a sinoffering and the other for a burned offering to the Lord to take away the sin of the Levites
Num  Then the Levites are to be put before Aaron and his sons to be offered as a wave offering to the Lord
Num  So you are to make the Levites separate from the children of Israel and the Levites will be mine
Num  After that the Levites will go in to do whatever has to be done in the Tent of meeting you are to make them clean and give them as a wave offering
Num  For they have been given to me from among the children of Israel in place of every mothers first son the first to come to birth in Israel I have taken them for myself
Num  For every mothers first son among the children of Israel is mine the first male birth of man or beast on the day when I sent death on all the first sons in the land of Egypt I made them mine
Num  And in place of the first sons among the children of Israel I have taken the Levites
Num  And I have given them to Aaron and to his sons from among the children of Israel to undertake for them all the work of the Tent of meeting and to take away sin from the children of Israel so that no evil may come on them when they come near the holy place
Num  All these things Moses and Aaron and the children of Israel did to the Levites as the Lord gave orders to Moses about the Levites so the children of Israel did
Num  And the Levites were made clean from sin and their clothing was washed and Aaron gave them for a wave offering before the Lord and Aaron took away their sin and made them clean
Num  And then the Levites went in to do their work in the Tent of meeting before Aaron and his sons all the orders which the Lord had given Moses about the Levites were put into effect
Num  And the Lord said to Moses
Num  This is the rule for the Levites those of twentyfive years old and over are to go in and do the work of the Tent of meeting
Num  But after they are fifty years old they are to give up their work and do no more
Num  But be with their brothers in the Tent of meeting taking care of it but doing no work This is what you are to do in connection with the Levites and their work
Num  And the Lord said to Moses in the waste land of Sinai in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt
Num  Let the children of Israel keep the Passover at its regular time
Num  In the fourteenth day of this month at evening you are to keep it at the regular time and in the way ordered in the law
Num  And Moses gave orders to the children of Israel to keep the Passover
Num  So they kept the Passover in the first month on the fourteenth day of the month at evening in the waste land of Sinai as the Lord gave orders to Moses so the children of Israel did
Num  And there were certain men who were unclean because of a dead body so that they were not able to keep the Passover on that day and they came before Moses and before Aaron on that day
Num  And these men said to him We have been made unclean by the dead body of a man why may we not make the offering of the Lord at the regular time among the children of Israel
Num  And Moses said to them Do nothing till the Lord gives me directions about you
Num  And the Lord said to Moses
Num  Say to the children of Israel If any one of you or of your families is unclean because of a dead body or is on a journey far away still he is to keep the Passover to the Lord
Num  In the second month on the fourteenth day in the evening they are to keep it taking it with unleavened bread and bittertasting plants
Num  Nothing of it is to be kept till the morning and no bone of it is to be broken they are to keep it by the rules of the Passover
Num  But the man who not being unclean or on a journey does not keep the Passover will be cut off from his people because he did not make the offering of the Lord at the regular time his sin will be on him
Num  And if a man from another country is among you and has a desire to keep the Passover to the Lord let him do as is ordered in the law of the Passover there is to be the same rule for the man from another nation and for him who had his birth in the land
Num  And on the day when the House was put up the cloud came down on it on the Tent of witness and in the evening there was a light like fire over the House till the morning
Num  And so it was at all times it was covered by the cloud and by a light as of fire by night
Num  And whenever the cloud was taken up from over the House then the children of Israel went journeying on and in the place where the cloud came to rest there the children of Israel put up their tents
Num  At the order of the Lord the children of Israel went forward and at the order of the Lord they put up their tents as long as the cloud was resting on the House they did not go away from that place
Num  When the cloud was resting on the House for a long time the children of Israel waiting for the order of the Lord did not go on
Num  Sometimes the cloud was resting on the House for two or three days then by the order of the Lord they kept their tents in that place and when the Lord gave the order they went on
Num  And sometimes the cloud was there only from evening to morning and when the cloud was taken up in the morning they went on their journey again or if it was resting there by day and by night whenever the cloud was taken up they went forward
Num  Or if the cloud came to rest on the House for two days or a month or a year without moving the children of Israel went on waiting there and did not go on but whenever it was taken up they went forward on their journey
Num  At the word of the Lord they put up their tents and at the word of the Lord they went forward on their journey they kept the orders of the Lord as he gave them by Moses
Num  And the Lord said to Moses
Num  Make two silver horns of hammered work to be used for getting the people together and to give the sign for the moving of the tents
Num  When they are sounded all the people are to come together to you at the door of the Tent of meeting
Num  If only one of them is sounded then the chiefs the heads of the thousands of Israel are to come to you
Num  When a loud note is sounded the tents placed on the east side are to go forward
Num  At the sound of a second loud note the tents on the south side are to go forward the loud note will be the sign to go forward
Num  But when all the people are to come together the horn is to be sounded but not loudly
Num  The horns are to be sounded by the sons of Aaron the priests this is to be a law for you for ever from generation to generation
Num  And if you go to war in your land against any who do you wrong then let the loud note of the horn be sounded and the Lord your God will keep you in mind and give you salvation from those who are against you
Num  And on days of joy and on your regular feasts and on the first day of every month let the horns be sounded over your burned offerings and your peaceofferings and they will put the Lord in mind of you I am the Lord your God
Num  Now in the second year on the twentieth day of the second month the cloud was taken up from over the Tent of witness
Num  And the children of Israel went on their journey out of the waste land of Sinai and the cloud came to rest in the waste land of Paran

Num  Then Moses said to Hobab the son of his fatherinlaw Reuel the Midianite We are journeying to that place of which the Lord has said I will give it to you so come with us and it will be for your profit for the Lord has good things in store for Israel
Num  But he said I will not go with you I will go back to the land of my birth and to my relations
Num  And he said Do not go from us for you will be eyes for us guiding us to the right places in the waste land to put up our tents
Num  And if you come with us we will give you a part in whatever good the Lord does for us
Num  So they went forward three days journey from the mountain of the Lord and the ark of the Lords agreement went three days journey before them looking for a restingplace for them
Num  And by day the cloud of the Lord went over them when they went forward from the place where they had put up their tents
Num  And when the ark went forward Moses said Come up O Lord and let the armies of those who are against you be broken and let your haters go in flight before you
Num  And when it came to rest he said Take rest O Lord and give a blessing to the families of Israel
Num  Now the people were saying evil against the Lord and the Lord hearing it was angry and sent fire on them burning the outer parts of the tentcircle
Num  And the people made an outcry to Moses and Moses made prayer to the Lord and the fire was stopped
Num  So that place was named Taberah because of the fire of the Lord which had been burning among them
Num  And the mixed band of people who went with them were overcome by desire and the children of Israel weeping again said Who will give us flesh for our food
Num  Sweet is the memory of the fish we had in Egypt for nothing and the fruit and green plants of every sort sharp and pleasing to the taste
Num  But now our soul is wasted away there is nothing at all we have nothing but this manna before our eyes
Num  Now the manna was like a seed of grain like small clear drops
Num  The people went about taking it up from the earth crushing it between stones or hammering it to powder and boiling it in pots and they made cakes of it its taste was like the taste of cakes cooked with oil
Num  When the dew came down on the tents at night the manna came down with it
Num  And at the sound of the people weeping every man at his tentdoor the wrath of the Lord was great and Moses was very angry
Num  And Moses said to the Lord Why have you done me this evil and why have I not grace in your eyes that you have put on me the care of all this people
Num  Am I the father of all this people have I given them birth that you say to me Take them in your arms like a child at the breast to the land which you gave by an oath to their fathers
Num  Where am I to get flesh to give to all this people For they are weeping to me and saying Give us flesh for our food
Num  I am not able by myself to take the weight of all this people for it is more than my strength
Num  If this is to be my fate put me to death now in answer to my prayer if I have grace in your eyes and let me not see my shame
Num  And the Lord said to Moses Send for seventy of the responsible men of Israel who are in your opinion men of weight and authority over the people make them come to the Tent of meeting and be there with you
Num  And I will come down and have talk with you there and I will take some of the spirit which is on you and put it on them and they will take part of the weight of the people off you so that you do not have to take it by yourself
Num  And say to the people Make yourselves clean before tomorrow and you will have flesh for your food for in the ears of the Lord you have been weeping and saying Who will give us flesh for food for we were well off in Egypt and so the Lord will give you flesh and it will be your food
Num  Not for one day only or even for five or ten or twenty days
Num  But every day for a month till you are tired of it turning from it in disgust because you have gone against the Lord who is with you and have been weeping before him saying Why did we come out of Egypt
Num  Then Moses said The people among whom I am are six hundred thousand men on foot and you have said I will give them flesh to be their food for a month
Num  Are flocks and herds to be put to death for them or are all the fish in the sea to be got together so that they may be full
Num  And the Lord said to Moses Has the Lords hand become short Now you will see if my word comes true for you or not
Num  And Moses went out and gave the people the words of the Lord and he took seventy of the responsible men of the people placing them round the Tent
Num  Then the Lord came down in the cloud and had talk with him and put on the seventy men some of the spirit which was on him now when the spirit came to rest on them they were like prophets but only at that time
Num  But two men were still in the tentcircle one of them named Eldad and the other Medad and the spirit came to rest on them they were among those who had been sent for but they had not gone out to the Tent and the prophets power came on them in the tentcircle
Num  And a young man went running to Moses and said Eldad and Medad are acting as prophets in the tentcircle
Num  Then Joshua the son of Nun who had been Moses servant from the time when he was a child said My lord Moses let them be stopped
Num  And Moses said to him Are you moved by envy on my account If only all the Lords people were prophets and the Lord might put his spirit on them
Num  Then Moses with the responsible men of Israel went back to the tentcircle
Num  Then the Lord sent a wind driving little birds from the sea so that they came down on the tents and all round the tentcircle about a days journey on this side and on that in masses about two cubits high over the face of the earth
Num  And all that day and all night and the day after the people were taking up the birds the smallest amount which anyone got was ten homers and they put them out all round the tents
Num  But while the meat was still between their teeth before it was tasted the wrath of the Lord was moved against the people and he sent a great outburst of disease on them
Num  So that place was named Kibrothhattaavah because there they put in the earth the bodies of the people who had given way to their desires
Num  From Kibrothhattaavah the people went on to Hazeroth and there they put up their tents

Num  Now the man Moses was more gentle than any other man on earth

Num  My servant Moses is not so he is true to me in all my house

Num  Then Aaron said to Moses O my lord let not our sin be on our heads for we have done foolishly and are sinners

Num  So Miriam was shut up outside the tentcircle for seven days and the people did not go forward on their journey till Miriam had come in again

Num  Then let him who is making his offering give to the Lord a meal offering of a tenth part of a measure of the best meal mixed with a fourth part of a hin of oil
Num  And for the drink offering you are to give with the burned offering or other offering the fourth part of a hin of wine for every lamb
Num  Or for a male sheep give as a meal offering two tenth parts of a measure of the best meal mixed with a third part of a hin of oil
Num  And for the drink offering give a third part of a hin of wine for a sweet smell to the Lord
Num  And when you make ready a young ox for a burned or other offering or for the effecting of an oath or for peaceofferings to the Lord
Num  Then with the ox give a meal offering of three tenth parts of a measure of the best meal mixed with half a hin of oil
Num  And for the drink offering give half a hin of wine for an offering made by fire for a sweet smell to the Lord
Num  This is to be done for every young ox and for every male sheep or helamb or young goat
Num  Whatever number you make ready so you are to do for every one
Num  All those who are Israelites by birth are to do these things in this way when giving an offering made by fire of a sweet smell to the Lord
Num  And if a man from another country or any other person living among you through all your generations has the desire to give an offering made by fire of a sweet smell to the Lord let him do as you do
Num  There is to be one law for you and for the man of another country living with you one law for ever from generation to generation as you are so is he to be before the Lord
Num  The law and the rule are to be the same for you and for those from other lands living with you
Num  And the Lord said to Moses

Num  From generation to generation you are to give to the Lord a lifted offering from the first of your rough meal

Num  And all the meeting of the children of Israel as well as those from other lands living among them will have forgiveness for it was an error on the part of the people
Num  And if one person does wrong without being conscious of it then let him give a shegoat of the first year for a sinoffering
Num  And the priest will take away the sin of the person who has done wrong if the wrong was done unconsciously and he will have forgiveness
Num  The law in connection with wrong done unconsciously is to be the same for him who is an Israelite by birth and for the man from another country who is living among them
Num  But the person who does wrong in the pride of his heart if he is one of you or of another nation by birth is acting without respect for the Lord and will be cut off from his people

Num  This is the rule of the law which the Lord has made saying Give orders to the children of Israel to give you a red cow without any mark on her and on which the yoke has never been put
Num  Give her to Eleazar the priest and let him take her outside the tentcircle and have her put to death before him
Num  Then let Eleazar the priest take some of her blood on his finger shaking the blood seven times in the direction of the front of the Tent of meeting
Num  And the cow is to be burned before him her skin and her flesh and her blood and her waste are to be burned
Num  Then let the priest take cedarwood and hyssop and red thread and put them into the fire where the cow is burning
Num  And the priest after washing his clothing and bathing his body in water may come back to the tentcircle and will be unclean till evening
Num  And he who does the burning is to have his clothing washed and his body bathed in water and be unclean till evening
Num  Then let a man who is clean take the dust of the burned cow and put it outside the tentcircle in a clean place where it is to be kept for the children of Israel and used in making the water which takes away what is unclean it is a sinoffering
Num  And he who takes up the dust of the burned cow is to have his clothing washed with water and be unclean till evening this is to be a law for ever for the children of Israel as well as for the man from another country who is living among them
Num  Anyone touching a dead body will be unclean for seven days
Num  On the third day and on the seventh day he is to make himself clean with the water and so he will be clean but if he does not do this on the third day and on the seventh day he will not be clean
Num  Anyone touching the body of a dead man without making himself clean in this way makes the House of the Lord unclean and that man will be cut off from Israel because the water was not put on him he will be unclean his unclean condition is unchanged
Num  This is the law when death comes to a man in his tent everyone who comes into the tent and everyone who is in the tent will be unclean for seven days
Num  And every open vessel without a cover fixed on it will be unclean
Num  And anyone touching one who has been put to death with the sword in the open country or the body of one who has come to his end by a natural death or a mans bone or the restingplace of a dead body will be unclean for seven days
Num  And for the unclean they are to take the dust of the burning of the sinoffering and put flowing water on it in a vessel
Num  And a clean person is to take hyssop and put it in the water shaking it over the tent and all the vessels and the people who were there and over him by whom the bone or the body of one who has been put to death with the sword or the body of one who has come to his end by a natural death or the restingplace was touched
Num  Let the clean person do this to the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day and on the seventh day he is to make him clean and after washing his clothing and bathing himself in water he will be clean in the evening
Num  But the man who being unclean does not make himself clean in this way will be cut off from the meeting of the people because he has made the holy place of the Lord unclean the water has not been put on him he is unclean
Num  This is to be a law for them for ever he who puts the water on the unclean person is to have his clothing washed and anyone touching the water will be unclean till evening
Num  Anything touched by the unclean person will be unclean and any person touching it will be unclean till evening
Num  In the first month all the children of Israel came into the waste land of Zin and put up their tents in Kadesh there death came to Miriam and they put her body to rest in the earth
Num  And there was no water for the people and they came together against Moses and against Aaron
Num  And the people were angry with Moses and said If only death had overtaken us when our brothers came to their death before the Lord
Num  Why have you taken the Lords people into this waste for death to come to us and to our cattle there
Num  Why have you made us come out of Egypt into this evil place This is no place of seed or figs or vines or other fruits and there is no water for drinking
Num  Then Moses and Aaron went away from the people to the door of the Tent of meeting and falling on their faces there they saw the glory of the Lord
Num  And the Lord said to Moses
Num  Take the rod you and Aaron your brother and make all the people come together and before their eyes give orders to the rock to give out its water and so make water come out of the rock for them and give the people and their cattle drink
Num  And Moses took the rod from before the Lord as he gave him orders
Num  Then Moses and Aaron made the people come together in front of the rock and he said to them Give ear now you people whose hearts are turned from the Lord are we to get water for you out of the rock
Num  And lifting up his hand Moses gave the rock two blows with his rod and water came streaming out and the people and their cattle had drink enough
Num  Then the Lord said to Moses and Aaron Because you had not enough faith in me to keep my name holy before the children of Israel you will not take this people into the land which I have given them
Num  These are the waters of Meribah because the children of Israel went against the Lord and they saw that he was holy among them
Num  Then Moses sent men from Kadesh to the king of Edom to say to him Your brother Israel says You have knowledge of all the things we have been through
Num  How our fathers went down into Egypt and we were living in Egypt for a long time and the Egyptians were cruel to us and to our fathers
Num  And the Lord gave ear to the voice of our cry and sent an angel and took us out of Egypt and now we are in Kadesh a town on the edge of your land
Num  Let us now go through your land we will not go into field or vinegarden or take the water of the springs we will go by the highway not turning to the right or to the left till we have gone past the limits of your land
Num  And Edom said You are not to go through my land for if you do I will come out against you with the sword
Num  And the children of Israel said to him We will go up by the highway and if we or our cattle take of your water we will give you a price for it only let us go through on our feet nothing more
Num  But he said You are not to go through And Edom came out against them in his strength with a great army
Num  So Edom would not let Israel go through his land and Israel went in another direction
Num  And they went on from Kadesh and came with all their people to Mount Hor
Num  And at Mount Hor at the edge of the land of Edom the Lord said to Moses and Aaron
Num  Aaron will be put to rest with his people he will not go into the land which I have given to the children of Israel because you went against my word at the waters of Meribah
Num  So take Aaron and Eleazar his son up into Mount Hor
Num  And take Aarons robes off him and put them on Eleazar his son and death will come to Aaron there and he will be put to rest with his people
Num  So Moses did as the Lord had said and before the eyes of all the people they went up Mount Hor
Num  And Moses took off Aarons robes and put them on Eleazar his son and there on the top of the mountain death came to Aaron then Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain
Num  And when the people saw that Aaron was dead all the children of Israel gave themselves up to weeping for him for thirty days
Num  And it came to the ears of the Canaanite the king of Arad living in the South that Israel was coming by the way of Atharim and he came out against them and took some of them prisoners
Num  Then Israel made an oath to the Lord and said If you will give up this people into my hands then I will send complete destruction on all their towns
Num  And the Lord in answer to the voice of Israel gave the Canaanites up to them and they put them and their towns completely to destruction and that place was named Hormah
Num  Then they went on from Mount Hor by the way to the Red Sea going round the land of Edom and the spirit of the people was overcome with weariness on the way
Num  And crying out against God and against Moses they said Why have you taken us out of Egypt to come to our death in the waste land For there is no bread and no water and this poor bread is disgusting to us
Num  Then the Lord sent poisonsnakes among the people and their bites were a cause of death to numbers of the people of Israel
Num  Then the people came to Moses and said We have done wrong in crying out against the Lord and against you make prayer to the Lord to take away the snakes from us So Moses made prayer for the people
Num  And the Lord said to Moses Make an image of a snake and put it on a rod and anyone who has been wounded by the snakes looking on it will be made well
Num  So Moses made a snake of brass and put it on a rod and anyone who had a snakebite after looking on the snake of brass was made well
Num  Then the children of Israel went on and put up their tents in Oboth
Num  And journeying on again from Oboth they put up their tents in Iyeabarim in the waste land before Moab looking east
Num  And moving on from there they put up their tents in the valley of Zered
Num  From there they went on and put up their tents on the other side of the Arnon which is on the waste land at the edge of the land of the Amorites for the Arnon is the line of division between Moab and the Amorites
Num  As it says in the book of the Wars of the Lord Vaheb in Suphah and the valley of the Amon
Num  The slope of the valleys going down to the tents of Ar and touching the edge of Moab
Num  From there they went on to Beer the waterspring of which the Lord said to Moses Make the people come together and I will give them water
Num  Then Israel gave voice to this song Come up O waterspring let us make a song to it
Num  The fountain made by the chiefs made deep by the great ones of the people with the lawgivers rod and with their sticks Then from the waste land they went on to Mattanah
Num  And from Mattanah to Nahaliel and from Nahaliel to Bamoth
Num  And from Bamoth to the valley in the open country of Moab and to the top of Pisgah looking over Jeshimon
Num  And Israel sent men to Sihon king of the Amorites saying
Num  Let me go through your land we will not go into field or vinegarden or take the water of the springs we will go by the highway till we have gone past the limits of your land
Num  And Sihon would not let Israel go through his land but got all his people together and went out against Israel into the waste land as far as Jahaz to make war on Israel
Num  But Israel overcame him and took all his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok as far as the country of the children of Ammon for the country of the children of Ammon was strongly armed
Num  And Israel took all their towns living in Heshbon and all the towns and small places of the Amorites
Num  For Heshbon was the town of Sihon king of the Amorites who had made war against an earlier king of Moab and taken from him all his land as far as the Arnon
Num  So the makers of wise sayings say Come to Heshbon building up the town of Sihon and making it strong
Num  For a fire has gone out of Heshbon a flame from the town of Sihon for the destruction of Ar in Moab and the lords of the high places of the Arnon
Num  Sorrow is yours O Moab Destruction is your fate O people of Chemosh his sons have gone in flight and his daughters are prisoners in the hands of Sihon king of the Amorites
Num  They are wounded with our arrows destruction has come on Heshbon even to Dibon and we have made the land waste as far as Nophah stretching out to Medeba
Num  So Israel put up their tents in the land of the Amorites
Num  And Moses sent men secretly to Jazer and they took its towns driving out the Amorites who were living there
Num  Then turning they went up by the way of Bashan and Og king of Bashan went out against them with all his people to the fight at Edrei
Num  And the Lord said to Moses Have no fear of him for I have given him up into your hands with all his people and his land do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites at Heshbon
Num  So they overcame him and his sons and his people driving them all out and they took his land for their heritage
Num  Then the children of Israel journeying on put up their tents in the lowlands of Moab on the other side of Jordan at Jericho
Num  Now Balak the son of Zippor saw what Israel had done to the Amorites
Num  And in Moab there was great fear of the people because their numbers were so great and the feeling of Moab was bitter against the children of Israel
Num  Then Moab said to the responsible men of Midian It is clear that this great people will be the destruction of everything round us making a meal of us as the ox does of the grass of the field At that time Balak the son of Zippor was king of Moab
Num  So he sent men to Balaam son of Beor at Pethor by the River in the land of the children of his people saying to him See a people has come out of Egypt covering all the face of the earth and they have put up their tents opposite to me
Num  Come now in answer to my prayer and put a curse on this people for they are greater than I and then I may be strong enough to overcome them and send them out of the land for it is clear that good comes to him who has your blessing but he on whom you put your curse is cursed
Num  So the responsible men of Moab and Midian went away taking in their hands rewards for the prophet and they came to Balaam and said to him what Balak had given them orders to say
Num  And he said to them Take your rest here tonight and I will give you an answer after hearing what the Lord says so the chiefs of Moab kept there with Balaam that night
Num  And God came to Balaam and said Who are these men with you
Num  And Balaam said to God Balak the son of Zippor king of Moab has sent them to me saying
Num  See the people who have come out of Egypt are covering all the earth now put a curse on this people for me so that I may be able to make war on them driving them out of the land
Num  And God said to Balaam You are not to go with them or put a curse on this people for they have my blessing
Num  In the morning Balaam got up and said to the chiefs of Balak Go back to your land for the Lord will not let me go with you
Num  So the chiefs of Moab went back to Balak and said Balaam will not come with us
Num  So Balak sent more chiefs greater in number and of higher position than the others
Num  And they came to Balaam and said Balak son of Zippor says Let nothing keep you from coming to me
Num  For I will give you a place of very great honour and whatever you say to me I will do so come in answer to my prayer and put a curse on this people
Num  But Balaam in answer said to the servants of Balak Even if Balak gave me his house full of silver and gold it would not be possible for me to do anything more or less than the orders of the Lord my God
Num  So take your rest here this night till I have knowledge what more the Lord has to say to me
Num  And that night God came to Balaam and said to him If these men have come for you go with them but do only what I say to you
Num  So in the morning Balaam got up and making his ass ready went with the chiefs of Moab
Num  But God was moved to wrath because he went and the angel of the Lord took up a position in the road to keep him from his purpose Now he was seated on his ass and his two servants were with him
Num  And the ass saw the angel of the Lord waiting in the road with his sword in his hand and turning from the road the ass went into the field and Balaam gave the ass blows to get her back on to the road
Num  Then the angel of the Lord took up his position in a narrow road through the vinegardens with a wall on this side and on that
Num  And the ass saw the angel of the Lord and went near the wall crushing Balaams foot against the wall and he gave her more blows
Num  Then the angel of the Lord went further stopping in a narrow place where there was no room for turning to the right or to the left
Num  And the ass saw the angel of the Lord and went down on the earth under Balaam and full of wrath Balaam gave her hard blows with his stick
Num  Then the Lord gave the ass the power of talking and opening her mouth she said to Balaam What have I done to you that you have given me blows these three times
Num  And Balaam said to the ass You have made me seem foolish if only I had a sword in my hand I would put you to death
Num  And the ass said to Balaam Am I not your ass upon which you have gone all your life till this day and have I ever done this to you before And he said No
Num  Then the Lord made Balaams eyes open and he saw the angel of the Lord in the way with his sword in his hand and he went down on his face to the earth
Num  And the angel of the Lord said to him Why have you given your ass blows these three times See I have come out against you to keep you back because your purpose is not pleasing to me
Num  And the ass saw me turning to one side from me three times if she had not gone to one side I would certainly have put you to death and kept her safe
Num  And Balaam said to the angel of the Lord I have done wrong for I did not see that you were in the way against me but now if it is evil in your eyes I will go back again
Num  And the angel of the Lord said to Balaam Go with the men but say only what I give you to say Then Balaam went on with the chiefs of Balak
Num  Now Balak hearing that Balaam had come went to the chief town of Moab on the edge of the Arnon in the farthest part of the land for the purpose of meeting him
Num  And Balak said to Balaam Did I not send to you requesting you with all my heart to come to me why did you not come am I not able to give you a place of honour
Num  Then Balaam said to Balak Now I have come to you but have I power to say anything Only what God puts into my mouth may I say
Num  And Balaam went with Balak to Kiriathhuzoth
Num  And Balak made offerings of oxen and sheep and sent to Balaam and the chiefs who were with him
Num  And in the morning Balak took Balaam up to the high places of Baal and from there he was able to see the outer limits of the people
Num  And Balaam said to Balak Make me here seven altars and get ready seven oxen and seven male sheep
Num  And Balak did as Balaam had said and Balak and Balaam made an offering on every altar of an ox and a male sheep
Num  Then Balaam said to Balak Take your place by your burned offering and I will go and see if the Lord comes to me and I will give you word of whatever he says to me And he went to an open place on a hill
Num  And God came to Balaam and Balaam said to him I have made ready seven altars offering an ox and a male sheep on every altar
Num  And the Lord put words in Balaams mouth and said Go back to Balak and this is what you are to say
Num  So he went back to him where he was waiting by his burned offering with all the chiefs of Moab
Num  And in the words which the Lord had given him he said From Aram Balak has sent for me the king of Moab from the mountains of the East come put curses on Jacob for me and be angry with Israel
Num  How may I put curses on him who is not cursed by God how may I be angry with him with whom the Lord is not angry
Num  From the top of the rocks I see him looking down on him from the hills it is a people made separate not to be numbered among the nations
Num  Who is able to take the measure of the dust of Jacob or the number of the thousands of Israel May my death be the death of the upright and my last end like his
Num  Then Balak said to Balaam What have you done to me I sent for you so that my haters might be cursed and see you have given them a blessing
Num  And in answer he said Am I not ordered to say only what the Lord puts into my mouth

Num  And in the words which the Lord had given him he said Up Balak and give ear give attention to me O son of Zippor
Num  God is not a man to say what is false or the son of man that his purpose may be changed what he has said will he not do and will he not give effect to the words of his mouth
Num  See I have had orders to give blessing and he has given a blessing which I have no power to take away
Num  He has seen no evil in Jacob or wrongdoing in Israel the Lord his God is with him and the glad cry of a king is among them

Num  No evil power has effect against Jacob no secret arts against Israel at the right time it will be said of Jacob and of Israel See what God has done
Num  See Israel comes up like a shelion lifting himself up like a lion he will take no rest till he has made a meal of those he has overcome drinking the blood of those he has put to death

Num  And Moses said to the heads of the tribes of the children of Israel This is the order of the Lord
Num  When a man takes an oath to the Lord or gives an undertaking having the force of an oath let him not go back from his word but let him do whatever he has said he will do
Num  If a woman being young and under the authority of her father takes an oath to the Lord or gives an undertaking
Num  If her father hearing of her oath or the undertaking she has given says nothing to her then all her oaths and every undertaking she has given will have force
Num  But if her father hearing of it makes her take back her word then the oaths or the undertakings she has given will have no force and she will have forgiveness from the Lord because her oath was broken by her father
Num  And if she is married to a husband at the time when she is under an oath or an undertaking given without thought
Num  If her husband hearing of it says nothing to her at the time then the oaths she made and the undertakings she gave will have force
Num  But if her husband hearing of it makes her take it back then the oath she made and the undertaking she gave without thought will have no force or effect and she will have the Lords forgiveness
Num  But an oath made by a widow or one who is no longer married to her husband and every undertaking she has given will have force
Num  If she made an oath while she was under the authority of her husband
Num  And her husband hearing of it said nothing to her and did not put a stop to it then all her oaths and every undertaking she gave will have force
Num  But if her husband on hearing of it made them without force or effect then whatever she has said about her oaths or her undertaking has no force her husband has made them without effect and she will have the Lords forgiveness
Num  Every oath and every undertaking which she gives to keep herself from pleasure may be supported or broken by her husband
Num  But if the days go on and her husband says nothing whatever to her then he is giving the support of his authority to her oaths and undertakings because at the time of hearing them he said nothing to her
Num  But if at some time after hearing of them he makes them without force then he is responsible for her wrongdoing
