Deu  It may be used for food in your houses the unclean and the clean may take of it as of the gazelle and the roe
Deu  Only do not take its blood for food but let it be drained out on the earth like water
Deu  Take note of the month of Abib and keep the Passover to the Lord your God for in the month of Abib the Lord your God took you out of Egypt by night
Deu  The Passover offering from your flock or your herd is to be given to the Lord your God in the place marked out by him as the restingplace of his name
Deu  Take no leavened bread with it for seven days let your food be unleavened bread that is the bread of sorrow for you came out of the land of Egypt quickly so the memory of that day when you came out of the land of Egypt will be with you all your life
Deu  For seven days let no leaven be used through all your land and nothing of the flesh which is put to death in the evening of the first day is to be kept through the night till morning
Deu  The Passover offering is not to be put to death in any of the towns which the Lord your God gives you
Deu  But in the place marked out by the Lord your God as the restingplace of his name there you are to put the Passover to death in the evening at sundown at that time of the year when you came out of Egypt
Deu  It is to be cooked and taken as food in the place marked out by the Lord and in the morning you are to go back to your tents
Deu  For six days let your food be unleavened bread and on the seventh day there is to be a holy meeting to the Lord your God no work is to be done
Deu  Let seven weeks be numbered from the first day when the grain is cut
Deu  Then keep the feast of weeks to the Lord your God with an offering freely given to him from the wealth he has given you
Deu  Then you are to be glad before the Lord your God you and your son and your daughter your manservant and your womanservant and the Levite who is with you and the man from a strange country and the child without a father and the widow who are living among you in the place marked out by the Lord your God as a restingplace for his name
Deu  And you will keep in mind that you were a servant in the land of Egypt and you will take care to keep all these laws
Deu  You are to keep the feast of tents for seven days after you have got in all your grain and made your wine
Deu  You are to keep the feast with joy you and your son and your daughter your manservant and your womanservant and the Levite and the man from a strange country and the child without a father and the widow who are living among you
Deu  Keep the feast to the Lord your God for seven days in the place marked out by the Lord because the blessing of the Lord your God will be on all the produce of your land and all the work of your hands and you will have nothing but joy
Deu  Three times in the year let all your males come before the Lord your God in the place named by him at the feast of unleavened bread the feast of weeks and the feast of tents and they are not to come before the Lord with nothing in their hands
Deu  Every man is to give as he is able in the measure of the blessing which the Lord your God has given you
Deu  You are to make judges and overseers in all your towns which the Lord your God gives you for every tribe and they are to be upright men judging the people in righteousness
Deu  You are not to be moved in your judging by a mans position you are not to take rewards for rewards make the eyes of the wise man blind and the decisions of the upright false
Deu  Let righteousness be your guide so that you may have life and take for your heritage the land which the Lord your God is giving you
Deu  Let no holy tree of any sort be planted by the altar of the Lord your God which you will make
Deu  You are not to put up stone pillars for they are hated by the Lord your God
Deu  No ox or sheep which has a mark on it or is damaged in any way may be offered to the Lord your God for that is disgusting to the Lord your God
Deu  If there is any man or woman among you in any of the towns which the Lord your God gives you who does evil in the eyes of the Lord your God sinning against his agreement
Deu  By becoming a servant of other gods and worshipping them or the sun or the moon or all the stars of heaven against my orders
Deu  If word of this comes to your ears then let this thing be looked into with care and if there is no doubt that it is true and such evil has been done in Israel
Deu  Then you are to take the man or woman who has done the evil to the public place of your town and they are to be stoned with stones till they are dead
Deu  On the word of two or three witnesses a man may be given the punishment of death but he is not to be put to death on the word of one witness
Deu  The hands of the witnesses will be the first to put him to death and after them the hands of all the people So you are to put away the evil from among you
Deu  If you are not able to give a decision as to who is responsible for a death or who is right in a cause or who gave the first blow in a fight and there is a division of opinion about it in your town then go to the place marked out by the Lord your God
Deu  And come before the priests the Levites or before him who is judge at the time and they will go into the question and give you a decision
Deu  And you are to be guided by the decision they give in the place named by the Lord and do whatever they say
Deu  Acting in agreement with their teaching and the decision they give not turning to one side or the other from the word they have given you
Deu  And any man who in his pride will not give ear to the priest whose place is there before the Lord your God or to the judge is to be put to death you are to put away the evil from Israel
Deu  And all the people hearing of it will be full of fear and put away their pride
Deu  When you have come into the land which the Lord your God is giving you and have taken it for a heritage and are living in it if it is your desire to have a king over you like the other nations round about you
Deu  Then see that you take as your king the man named by the Lord your God let your king be one of your countrymen not a man of another nation who is not one of yourselves
Deu  And he is not to get together a great army of horses for himself or make the people go back to Egypt to get horses for him because the Lord has said You will never again go back that way
Deu  And he is not to have a great number of wives for fear that his heart may be turned away or great wealth of silver and gold
Deu  And when he has taken his place on the seat of his kingdom he is to make in a book a copy of this law from that which the priests the Levites have in their care
Deu  And it is to be with him for his reading all the days of his life so that he may be trained in the fear of the Lord his God to keep and do all the words of this teaching and these laws
Deu  So that his heart may not be lifted up over his countrymen and he may not be turned away from the orders to one side or the other but that his life and the lives of his children may be long in his kingdom in Israel
Deu  The priests the Levites that is all the tribe of Levi will have no part or heritage with Israel their food and their heritage will be the offerings of the Lord made by fire
Deu  And they will have no heritage among their countrymen the Lord is their heritage as he has said to them
Deu  And this is to be the priests right those who make an offering of a sheep or an ox are to give to the priest the top part of the leg and the two sides of the head and the stomach
Deu  And in addition you are to give him the first of your grain and wine and oil and the first wool cut from your sheep
Deu  For he and his sons after him for ever have been marked out by the Lord your God from all your tribes to do the work of priests in the name of the Lord
Deu  And if a Levite moved by a strong desire comes from any town in all Israel where he is living to the place marked out by the Lord
Deu  Then he will do the work of a priest in the name of the Lord his God with all his brothers the Levites who are there before the Lord
Deu  His food will be the same as theirs in addition to what has come to him as the price of his property
Deu  When you have come into the land which the Lord your God is giving you do not take as your example the disgusting ways of those nations
Deu  Let there not be seen among you anyone who makes his son or his daughter go through the fire or anyone using secret arts or a maker of strange sounds or a reader of signs or any wonderworker
Deu  Or anyone using secret force on people or putting questions to a spirit or having secret knowledge or going to the dead for directions
Deu  For all who do such things are disgusting to the Lord and because of these disgusting things the Lord your God is driving them out before you
Deu  You are to be upright in heart before the Lord your God
Deu  For these nations whose land you are taking give attention to readers of signs and to those using secret arts but the Lord your God will not let you do so
Deu  The Lord your God will give you a prophet from among your people like me you will give ear to him
Deu  In answer to the request you made to the Lord your God in Horeb on the day of the great meeting when you said Let not the voice of the Lord my God come to my ears again and let me not see this great fire any more or death will overtake me
Deu  Then the Lord said to me What they have said is well said
Deu  I will give them a prophet from among themselves like you and I will put my words in his mouth and he will say to them whatever I give him orders to say
Deu  And whoever does not give ear to my words which he will say in my name will be responsible to me
Deu  But the prophet who takes it on himself to say words in my name which I have not given him orders to say or who says anything in the name of other gods will come to his death
Deu  And if you say in your hearts How are we to be certain that the word does not come from the Lord
Deu  When a prophet makes a statement in the name of the Lord if what he says does not take place and his words do not come true then his word is not the word of the Lord the words of the prophet were said in the pride of his heart and you are to have no fear of him
Deu  When the nations whose land the Lord your God is giving you have been cut off by him and you have taken their place and are living in their towns and in their houses
Deu  You are to have three towns marked out in the land which the Lord your God is giving you for your heritage
Deu  You are to make ready a way and see that the land which the Lord your God is giving you for your heritage is marked out into three parts to which any taker of life may go in flight
Deu  This is to be the rule for anyone who goes in flight there after causing the death of his neighbour in error and not through hate
Deu  For example if a man goes into the woods with his neighbour for the purpose of cutting down trees and when he takes his axe to give a blow to the tree the head of the axe comes off and falling on to his neighbour gives him a wound causing his death then the man may go in flight to one of these towns and be safe
Deu  For if not he who has the right of punishment may go running after the taker of life in the heat of his wrath and overtake him because the way is long and give him a deathblow though it is not right for him to be put to death because he was not moved by hate
Deu  And so I am ordering you to see that three towns are marked out for this purpose
Deu  And if the Lord your God makes wide the limits of your land as he said in his oath to your fathers and gives you all the land which he undertook to give to your fathers
Deu  If you keep and do all these orders which I give you today loving the Lord your God and walking ever in his ways then let three more towns in addition to these three be marked out for you
Deu  So that in all your land which the Lord your God is giving you for your heritage no man may be wrongly put to death for which you will be responsible
Deu  But if any man has hate for his neighbour and waiting for him secretly makes an attack on him and gives him a blow causing his death and then goes in flight to one of these towns
Deu  The responsible men of his town are to send and take him and give him up to the one who has the right of punishment to be put to death
Deu  Have no pity on him so that Israel may be clear from the crime of putting a man to death without cause and it will be well for you
Deu  Your neighbours landmark which was put in its place by the men of old times is not to be moved or taken away in the land of your heritage which the Lord your God is giving you
Deu  One witness may not make a statement against a man in relation to any sin or wrongdoing which he has done on the word of two or three witnesses a question is to be judged
Deu  If a false witness makes a statement against a man saying that he has done wrong
Deu  Then the two men between whom the argument has taken place are to come before the Lord before the priests and judges who are then in power
Deu  And the judges will have the question looked into with care and if the witness is seen to be false and to have made a false statement against his brother
Deu  Then do to him what it was his purpose to do to his brother and so put away the evil from among you
Deu  And the rest of the people hearing of it will be full of fear and never again do such evil among you
Deu  Have no pity let life be given for life eye for eye tooth for tooth hand for hand foot for foot
Deu  When you go out to war against other nations and come face to face with horses and warcarriages and armies greater in number than yourselves have no fear of them for the Lord your God is with you who took you up out of the land of Egypt
Deu  And when you are on the point of attacking let the priest come forward and say to the people
Deu  Give ear O Israel today you are going forward to the fight let your heart be strong do not let uncontrolled fear overcome you because of those who are against you
Deu  For the Lord your God goes with you fighting for you to give you salvation from those who are against you
Deu  And let the overseers say to the people If there is any man who has made for himself a new house and has not gone into it let him go back to his house so that in the event of his death in the fight another may not take his house for himself
Deu  Or if any man has made a vinegarden without taking the firstfruits of it let him go back to his house so that in the event of his death in the fight another may not be the first to make use of the fruit
Deu  Or if any man is newly married and has had no sex relations with his wife let him go back to his house so that in the event of his death in the fight another man may not take her
Deu  And let the overseers go on to say to the people If there is any man whose heart is feeble with fear let him go back to his house before he makes the hearts of his countrymen feeble
Deu  Then after saying these words to the people let the overseers put captains over the army
Deu  When you come to a town before attacking it make an offer of peace
Deu  And if it gives you back an answer of peace opening its doors to you then all the people in it may be put to forced work as your servants
Deu  If however it will not make peace with you but war then let it be shut in on all sides
Deu  And when the Lord your God has given it into your hands let every male in it be put to death without mercy
Deu  But the women and the children and the cattle and everything in the town and all its wealth you may take for yourselves the wealth of your haters which the Lord your God has given you will be your food
Deu  So you are to do to all the towns far away which are not the towns of these nations
Deu  But in the towns of these peoples whose land the Lord your God is giving you for your heritage let no living thing be kept from death
Deu  Give them up to the curse the Hittite the Amorite the Canaanite the Perizzite the Hivite and the Jebusite as the Lord your God has given you orders
Deu  So that you may not take them as your example and do all the disgusting things which they do in the worship of their gods so sinning against the Lord your God
Deu  If in war a town is shut in by your armies for a long time do not let its trees be cut down and made waste for their fruit will be your food are the trees of the countryside men for you to take up arms against them
Deu  Only those trees which you are certain are not used for food may be cut down and put to destruction and you are to make walls of attack against the town till it is taken
Deu  If in the land which the Lord your God is giving you you come across the dead body of a man in the open country and you have no idea who has put him to death
Deu  Then your responsible men and your judges are to come out and give orders for the distance from the dead body to the towns round about it to be measured
Deu  And whichever town is nearest to the body the responsible men of that town are to take from the herd a young cow which has never been used for work or put under the yoke
Deu  And they are to take the cow into a valley where there is flowing water and which is not ploughed or planted and there the neck of the cow is to be broken
Deu  Then the priests the sons of Levi are to come near for they have been marked out by the Lord your God to be his servants and to give blessings in the name of the Lord and by their decision every argument and every blow is to be judged
Deu  And all the responsible men of that town which is nearest to the dead man washing their hands over the cow whose neck was broken in the valley
Deu  Will say This death is not the work of our hands and our eyes have not seen it
Deu  Have mercy O Lord on your people Israel whom you have made free and take away from your people the crime of a death without cause Then they will no longer be responsible for the mans death
Deu  So you will take away the crime of a death without cause from among you when you do what is right in the eyes of the Lord
Deu  When you go out to war against other nations and the Lord your God gives them up into your hands and you take them as prisoners
Deu  If among the prisoners you see a beautiful woman and it is your desire to make her your wife
Deu  Then take her back to your house and let her hair and her nails be cut
Deu  And let her take off the dress in which she was made prisoner and go on living in your house and weeping for her father and mother for a full month and after that you may go in to her and be her husband and she will be your wife
Deu  But if you have no delight in her you are to let her go wherever she will you may not take a price for her as if she was your property for you have made use of her for your pleasure
Deu  If a man has two wives one greatly loved and the other hated and the two of them have had children by him and if the first son is the child of the hated wife
Deu  Then when he gives his property to his sons for their heritage he is not to put the son of his loved one in the place of the first son the son of the hated wife
Deu  But he is to give his first son his birthright and twice as great a part of his property for he is the firstfruits of his strength and the right of the first son is his
Deu  If a man has a son who is hardhearted and uncontrolled who gives no attention to the voice of his father and mother and will not be ruled by them though they give him punishment
Deu  Then let his father and mother take him to the responsible men of the town to the public place
Deu  And say to them This son of ours is hardhearted and uncontrolled he will not give attention to us he gives himself up to pleasure and strong drink
Deu  Then he is to be stoned to death by all the men of the town so you are to put away the evil from among you and all Israel hearing of it will be full of fear
Deu  If a man does a crime for which the punishment is death and he is put to death by hanging him on a tree
Deu  Do not let his body be on the tree all night but put it to rest in the earth the same day for the man who undergoes hanging is cursed by God so do not make unclean the land which the Lord your God is giving you for your heritage
Deu  If you see your brothers ox or his sheep wandering do not go by without helping but take them back to your brother
Deu  If their owner is not near or if you are not certain who he is then take the beast to your house and keep it till its owner comes in search of it and then you are to give it back to him
Deu  Do the same with his ass or his robe or anything which has gone from your brothers keeping and which you have come across do not keep it to yourself
Deu  If you see your brothers ox or his ass falling down on the road do not go by without giving him help in lifting it up again
Deu  It is not right for a woman to be dressed in mans clothing or for a man to put on a womans robe whoever does such things is disgusting to the Lord your God
Deu  If by chance you see a place which a bird has made for itself in a tree or on the earth with young ones or eggs and the mother bird seated on the young ones or on the eggs do not take the mother bird with the young
Deu  See that you let the mother bird go but the young ones you may take so it will be well for you and your life will be long
Deu  If you are building a house make a railing for the roof so that the blood of any man falling from it will not come on your house
Deu  Do not have your vinegarden planted with two sorts of seed or all of it may become a loss the seed you have put in as well as the increase
Deu  Do not do your ploughing with an ox and an ass yoked together
Deu  Do not have clothing made of two sorts of thread wool and linen together
Deu  On the four edges of your robe with which your body is covered put ornaments of twisted threads
Deu  If any man takes a wife and having had connection with her has no delight in her
Deu  And says evil things about her and gives her a bad name saying I took this woman and when I had connection with her it was clear to me that she was not a virgin
Deu  Then let the girls father and mother put before the responsible men of the town in the public place signs that the girl was a virgin
Deu  And let the girls father say to the responsible men I gave my daughter to this man for his wife but he has no love for her
Deu  And now he has put shame on her saying that she is not a virgin but here is the sign that she is a virgin Then they are to put her clothing before the responsible men of the town
Deu  Then the responsible men of the town are to give the man his punishment
Deu  They will take from him a hundred shekels of silver which are to be given to the father of the girl because he has given an evil name to a virgin of Israel she will go on being his wife he may never put her away all his life
Deu  But if what he has said is true and she is seen to be not a virgin
Deu  Then they are to make the girl come to the door of her fathers house and she will be stoned to death by the men of the town because she has done evil and put shame on Israel by acting as a loose woman in her fathers house so you are to put away evil from among you
Deu  If a man is taken in the act of going in to a married woman the two of them the man as well as the woman are to be put to death so you are to put away the evil from Israel
Deu  If a young virgin has given her word to be married to a man and another man meeting her in the town has connection with her
Deu  Then you are to take the two of them to the doorway of the town and have them stoned to death the young virgin because she gave no cry for help though it was in the town and the man because he has put shame on his neighbours wife so you are to put away evil from among you
Deu  But if the man meeting such a virgin in the open country takes her by force then only the man is to be put to death
Deu  Nothing is to be done to the virgin because there is no cause of death in her it is the same as if a man made an attack on his neighbour and put him to death
Deu  For he came across her in the open country and there was no one to come to the help of the virgin in answer to her cry
Deu  If a man sees a young virgin who has not given her word to be married to anyone and he takes her by force and has connection with her and discovery is made of it
Deu  Then the man will have to give the virgins father fifty shekels of silver and make her his wife because he has put shame on her he may never put her away all his life
Deu  A man may not take his fathers wife or have sex relations with a woman who is his fathers
Deu  No man whose private parts have been wounded or cut off may come into the meeting of the Lords people
Deu  One whose father and mother are not married may not come into the meeting of the Lords people or any of his family to the tenth generation
Deu  No Ammonite or Moabite or any of their people to the tenth generation may come into the meeting of the Lords people
Deu  Because they gave you no bread or water on your way when you came out of Egypt and they got Balaam the son of Peor from Pethor in Aramnaharaim to put curses on you
Deu  But the Lord your God would not give ear to Balaam but let the curse be changed into a blessing to you because of his love for you
Deu  Do nothing for their peace or wellbeing for ever
Deu  But have no hate for an Edomite because he is your brother or for an Egyptian for you were living in his land
Deu  Their children in the third generation may come into the meeting of the Lords people
Deu  When you go out to war and put your tents in position keep from every evil thing
Deu  If any man among you becomes unclean through anything which has taken place in the night he is to go out from the tentcircle and keep outside it
Deu  But when evening comes near let him take a bath and after sundown he may come back to the tents
Deu  Let there be a place outside the tentcircle to which you may go
Deu  And have among your arms a spade and when you have been to that place let that which comes from you be covered up with earth
Deu  For the Lord your God is walking among your tents to keep you safe and to give up into your hands those who are fighting against you then let your tents be holy so that he may see no unclean thing among you and be turned away from you
Deu  Do not give back to his master a servant who has gone in flight from his master and come to you
Deu  Let him go on living among you in whatever place is most pleasing to him do not be hard on him
Deu  No daughter of Israel is to let herself be used as a loose woman for a strange god and no son of Israel is to give himself to a man
Deu  Do not take into the house of the Lord your God as an offering for an oath the price of a loose woman or the money given to one used for sex purposes in the worship of the gods for these two things are disgusting to the Lord your God
Deu  Do not take interest from an Israelite on anything money or food or any other goods which you let him have
Deu  From men of other nations you may take interest but not from an Israelite so that the blessing of the Lord your God may be on everything to which you put your hand in the land which you are about to take as your heritage
Deu  When you take an oath to the Lord do not be slow to give effect to it for without doubt the Lord your God will make you responsible and will put it to your account as sin
Deu  But if you take no oath there will be no sin
Deu  Whatever your lips have said see that you do it for you gave your word freely to the Lord your God
Deu  When you go into your neighbours vinegarden you may take of his grapes at your pleasure but you may not take them away in your vessel
Deu  When you go into your neighbours field you may take the heads of grain with your hand but you may not put your blade to his grain
Deu  If a man takes a wife and after they are married she is unpleasing to him because of some bad quality in her let him give her a statement in writing and send her away from his house
Deu  And when she has gone away from him she may become another mans wife
Deu  And if the second husband has no love for her and giving her a statement in writing sends her away or if death comes to the second husband to whom she was married
Deu  Her first husband who had sent her away may not take her back after she has been wife to another for that is disgusting to the Lord and you are not to be a cause of sin in the land which the Lord your God is giving you for your heritage
Deu  A newly married man will not have to go out with the army or undertake any business but may be free for one year living in his house for the comfort of his wife
Deu  No one is to take on account of a debt the stones with which grain is crushed for in doing so he takes a mans living
Deu  If a man takes by force one of his countrymen the children of Israel using him as his property or getting a price for him that thief is to be put to death so you are to put away evil from among you
Deu  In connection with the lepers disease take care to keep and do every detail of the teaching of the priests the Levites as I gave them orders so you are to do
Deu  Keep in mind what the Lord your God did to Miriam on the way when you came out of Egypt
Deu  If you let your brother have the use of anything which is yours do not go into his house and take anything of his as a sign of his debt
Deu  But keep outside till he comes out and gives it to you
Deu  If he is a poor man do not keep his property all night
Deu  But be certain to give it back to him when the sun goes down so that he may have his clothing for sleeping in and will give you his blessing and this will be put to your account as righteousness before the Lord your God
Deu  Do not be hard on a servant who is poor and in need if he is one of your countrymen or a man from another nation living with you in your land
Deu  Give him his payment day by day not keeping it back over night for he is poor and his living is dependent on it and if his cry against you comes to the ears of the Lord it will be judged as sin in you
Deu  Fathers are not to be put to death for their children or children for their fathers every man is to be put to death for the sin which he himself has done
Deu  Be upright in judging the cause of the man from a strange country and of him who has no father do not take a widows clothing on account of a debt
Deu  But keep in mind that you were a servant in the land of Egypt and the Lord your God made you free for this is why I give you orders to do this
Deu  When you get in the grain from your field if some of the grain has been dropped by chance in the field do not go back and get it but let it be for the man from a strange land the child without a father and the widow so that the blessing of the Lord your God may be on all the work of your hands
Deu  When you are shaking the fruit from your olivetrees do not go over the branches a second time let some be for the man from a strange land the child without a father and the widow
Deu  When you are pulling the grapes from your vines do not take up those which have been dropped let them be for the man from a strange land the child without a father and the widow
Deu  Keep in mind that you were a servant in the land of Egypt for this is why I give you orders to do this
Deu  If there is an argument between men and they go to law with one another let the judges give their decision for the upright and against the wrongdoer
Deu  And if the wrongdoer is to undergo punishment by whipping the judge will give orders for him to go down on his face and be whipped before him the number of the blows being in relation to his crime
Deu  He may be given forty blows not more for if more are given your brother may be shamed before you
Deu  Do not keep the ox from taking the grain when he is crushing it
Deu  If brothers are living together and one of them at his death has no son the wife of the dead man is not to be married outside the family to another man let her husbands brother go in to her and make her his wife doing as it is right for a brotherinlaw to do
Deu  Then the first male child she has will take the rights of the brother who is dead so that his name may not come to an end in Israel
Deu  But if the man says he will not take his brothers wife then let the wife go to the responsible men of the town and say My husbands brother will not keep his brothers name living in Israel he will not do what it is right for a husbands brother to do
Deu  Then the responsible men of the town will send for the man and have talk with him and if he still says I will not take her
Deu  Then his brothers wife is to come to him before the responsible men of the town and take his shoe off his foot and put shame on him and say So let it be done to the man who will not take care of his brothers name
Deu  And his family will be named in Israel The house of him whose shoe has been taken off
Deu  If two men are fighting and the wife of one of them coming to the help of her husband takes the other by the private parts
Deu  Her hand is to be cut off have no pity on her
Deu  Do not have in your bag different weights a great and a small
Deu  Or in your house different measures a great and a small
Deu  But have a true weight and a true measure so that your life may be long in the land which the Lord your God is giving you
Deu  For all who do such things and all whose ways are not upright are disgusting to the Lord your God
Deu  Keep in mind what Amalek did to you on your way from Egypt
Deu  How meeting you on the way he made an attack on you when you were tired and without strength cutting off all the feeble ones at the end of your line and the fear of God was not in him
Deu  So when the Lord your God has given you rest from all who are against you on every side in the land which the Lord your God is giving you for your heritage see to it that the memory of Amalek is cut off from the earth keep this in mind
Deu  Now when you have come into the land which the Lord is giving you for your heritage and you have made it yours and are living in it
Deu  You are to take a part of the firstfruits of the earth which you get from the land which the Lord your God is giving you and put it in a basket and go to the place marked out by the Lord your God as the restingplace of his name
Deu  And you are to come to him who is priest at that time and say to him I give witness today before the Lord your God that I have come into the land which the Lord made an oath to our fathers to give us
Deu  Then the priest will take the basket from your hand and put it down in front of the altar of the Lord your God
Deu  And these are the words which you will say before the Lord your God My father was a wandering Aramaean and he went down with a small number of people into Egypt there he became a great and strong nation
Deu  And the Egyptians were cruel to us crushing us under a hard yoke
Deu  And our cry went up to the Lord the God of our fathers and the Lords ear was open to the voice of our cry and his eyes took note of our grief and the crushing weight of our work
Deu  And the Lord took us out of Egypt with a strong hand and a stretchedout arm with works of power and signs and wonders
Deu  And he has been our guide to this place and has given us this land a land flowing with milk and honey
Deu  So now I have come here with the first of the fruits of the earth which you O Lord have given me Then you will put it down before the Lord your God and give him worship
Deu  And you will have joy in every good thing which the Lord your God has given to you and to your family and the Levite and the man from a strange land who is with you will take part in your joy
Deu  When you have taken out a tenth from the tenth of all your produce in the third year which is the year when this has to be done give it to the Levite and the man from a strange land and the child without a father and the widow so that they may have food in your towns and be full
Deu  And say before the Lord your God I have taken all the holy things out of my house and have given them to the Levite and the man from a strange land and him who has no father and the widow as you have given me orders I have kept in mind all your orders in nothing have I gone against them
Deu  No part of these things has been used for food in a time of weeping or put away when I was unclean or given for the dead I have given ear to the voice of the Lord my God and have done all you have given me orders to do
Deu  So looking down from your holy place in heaven send your blessing on your people Israel and on the land which you have given us as you said in your oath to our fathers a land flowing with milk and honey
Deu  Today the Lord your God gives you orders to keep all these laws and decisions so then keep and do them with all your heart and all your soul
Deu  Today you have given witness that the Lord is your God and that you will go in his ways and keep his laws and his orders and his decisions and give ear to his voice
Deu  And the Lord has made it clear this day that you are a special people to him as he gave you his word and that you are to keep all his orders
Deu  And that he will make you high over all the nations he has made in praise in name and in honour and that you are to be a holy people to the Lord your God as he has said
Deu  Then Moses and the responsible men of Israel gave the people these orders Keep all the orders which I have given you this day
Deu  And on the day when you go over Jordan into the land which the Lord your God is giving you put up great stones coating them with buildingpaste
Deu  And writing on them all the words of this law after you have gone over so that you may take the heritage which the Lord your God is giving you a land flowing with milk and honey as the Lord the God of your fathers has said
Deu  And when you have gone over Jordan you are to put up these stones as I have said to you today in Mount Ebal and have them coated with buildingpaste
Deu  There you are to make an altar to the Lord your God of stones on which no iron instrument has been used
Deu  You are to make the altar of the Lord your God of uncut stones offering on it burned offerings to the Lord your God
Deu  And you are to make your peaceofferings feasting there with joy before the Lord your God
Deu  And put on the stones all the words of this law writing them very clearly
Deu  Then Moses and the priests the Levites said to all Israel Be quiet and give ear O Israel today you have become the people of the Lord your God
Deu  For this cause you are to give ear to the voice of the Lord your God and do his orders and his laws which I give you this day
Deu  That same day Moses said to the people
Deu  These are to take their places on Mount Gerizim for blessing the people when you have gone over Jordan Simeon and Levi and Judah and Issachar and Joseph and Benjamin
Deu  And these are to be on Mount Ebal for the curse Reuben Gad and Asher and Zebulun Dan and Naphtali
Deu  Then the Levites are to say in a loud voice to all the men of Israel
Deu  Cursed is the man who makes any image of wood or stone or metal disgusting to the Lord the work of mans hands and puts it up in secret And let all the people say So be it
Deu  Cursed is he who does not give honour to his father or mother And let all the people say So be it
Deu  Cursed is he who takes his neighbours landmark from its place And let all the people say So be it
Deu  Cursed is he by whom the blind are turned out of the way And let all the people say So be it
Deu  Cursed is he who gives a wrong decision in the cause of a man from a strange land or of one without a father or of a widow And let all the people say So be it
Deu  Cursed is he who has sex relations with his fathers wife for he has put shame on his father And let all the people say So be it
Deu  Cursed is he who has sex relations with any sort of beast And let all the people say So be it
Deu  Cursed is he who has sex relations with his sister the daughter of his father or of his mother And let all the people say So be it
Deu  Cursed is he who has sex relations with his motherinlaw And let all the people say So be it
Deu  Cursed is he who takes his neighbours life secretly And let all the people say So be it
Deu  Cursed is he who for a reward puts to death one who has done no wrong And let all the people say So be it
Deu  Cursed is he who does not take this law to heart to do it And let all the people say So be it
Deu  Now if you give ear to the voice of the Lord your God and keep with care all these orders which I have given you today then the Lord your God will put you high over all the nations of the earth
Deu  And all these blessings will come on you and overtake you if your ears are open to the voice of the Lord your God
Deu  A blessing will be on you in the town and a blessing in the field
Deu  A blessing will be on the fruit of your body and on the fruit of your land on the fruit of your cattle the increase of your herd and the young of your flock
Deu  A blessing will be on your basket and on your breadbasin
Deu  A blessing will be on your coming in and on your going out
Deu  By the power of the Lord those who take arms against you will be overcome before you they will come out against you one way and will go in flight from you seven ways
Deu  The Lord will send his blessing on your storehouses and on everything to which you put your hand his blessing will be on you in the land which the Lord your God is giving you
Deu  The Lord will keep you as a people holy to himself as he has said to you in his oath if you keep the orders of the Lord your God and go on walking in his ways
Deu  And all the peoples of the earth will see that the name of the Lord is on you and they will go in fear of you
Deu  And the Lord will make you fertile in every good thing in the fruit of your body and the fruit of your cattle and the fruit of your fields in the land which the Lord by his oath to your fathers said he would give you
Deu  Opening his storehouse in heaven the Lord will send rain on your land at the right time blessing all the work of your hands other nations will make use of your wealth and you will have no need of theirs
Deu  The Lord will make you the head and not the tail and you will ever have the highest place if you give ear to the orders of the Lord your God which I give you today to keep and to do them
Deu  Not turning away from any of the orders which I give you today to the right hand or to the left or going after any other gods to give them worship
Deu  But if you do not give ear to the voice of the Lord your God and take care to do all his orders and his laws which I give you today then all these curses will come on you and overtake you
Deu  You will be cursed in the town and cursed in the field
Deu  A curse will be on your basket and on your breadbasin
Deu  A curse will be on the fruit of your body and on the fruit of your land on the increase of your cattle and the young of your flock
Deu  You will be cursed when you come in and cursed when you go out
Deu  The Lord will send on you cursing and trouble and punishment in everything to which you put your hand till sudden destruction overtakes you because of your evil ways in which you have been false to me
Deu  The Lord will send disease after disease on you till you have been cut off by death from the land to which you are going
Deu  The Lord will send wasting disease and burning pain and flaming heat against you keeping back the rain till your land is waste and dead so will it be till your destruction is complete
Deu  And the heaven over your heads will be brass and the earth under you hard as iron
Deu  The Lord will make the rain of your land powder and dust sending it down on you from heaven till your destruction is complete
Deu  The Lord will let you be overcome by your haters you will go out against them one way and you will go in flight before them seven ways you will be the cause of fear among all the kingdoms of the earth
Deu  Your bodies will be meat for all the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth there will be no one to send them away
Deu  The Lord will send on you the disease of Egypt and other sorts of skin diseases which nothing will make well
Deu  He will make your minds diseased and your eyes blind and your hearts wasted with fear
Deu  You will go feeling your way when the sun is high like a blind man for whom all is dark and nothing will go well for you you will be crushed and made poor for ever and you will have no saviour
Deu  You will take a wife but another man will have the use of her the house which your hands have made will never be your restingplace you will make a vinegarden and never take the fruit of it
Deu  Your ox will be put to death before your eyes but its flesh will not be your food your ass will be violently taken away before your face and will not be given back to you your sheep will be given to your haters and there will be no saviour for you
Deu  Your sons and your daughters will be given to another people and your eyes will be wasted away with looking and weeping for them all the day and you will have no power to do anything
Deu  The fruit of your land and all the work of your hands will be food for a nation which is strange to you and to your fathers you will only be crushed down and kept under for ever
Deu  So that the things which your eyes have to see will send you out of your minds
Deu  The Lord will send a skin disease attacking your knees and your legs bursting out from your feet to the top of your head so that nothing will make you well
Deu  And you and the king whom you have put over you will the Lord take away to a nation strange to you and to your fathers there you will be servants to other gods of wood and stone
Deu  And you will become a wonder and a name of shame among all the nations where the Lord will take you
Deu  You will take much seed out into the field and get little in for the locust will get it
Deu  You will put in vines and take care of them but you will get no wine or grapes from them for they will be food for worms
Deu  Your land will be full of olivetrees but there will be no oil for the comfort of your body for your olivetree will give no fruit
Deu  You will have sons and daughters but they will not be yours for they will go away prisoners into a strange land
Deu  All your trees and the fruit of your land will be the locusts
Deu  The man from a strange land who is living among you will be lifted up higher and higher over you while you go down lower and lower
Deu  He will let you have his wealth at interest and will have no need of yours he will be the head and you the tail
Deu  And all these curses will come after you and overtake you till your destruction is complete because you did not give ear to the voice of the Lord your God or keep his laws and his orders which he gave you
Deu  These things will come on you and on your seed to be a sign and a wonder for ever
Deu  Because you did not give honour to the Lord your God worshipping him gladly with joy in your hearts on account of all your wealth of good things
Deu  For this cause you will become servants to those whom the Lord your God will send against you without food and drink and clothing and in need of all things and he will put a yoke of iron on your neck till he has put an end to you
Deu  The Lord will send a nation against you from the farthest ends of the earth coming with the flight of an eagle a nation whose language is strange to you
Deu  A hardfaced nation who will have no respect for the old or mercy for the young
Deu  He will take the fruit of your cattle and of your land till death puts an end to you he will let you have nothing of your grain or wine or oil or any of the increase of your cattle or the young of your flock till he has made your destruction complete
Deu  Your towns will be shut in by his armies till your high walls in which you put your faith have come down his armies will be round your towns through all your land which the Lord your God has given you
Deu  And your food will be the fruit of your body the flesh of the sons and daughters which the Lord your God has given you because of your bitter need and the cruel grip of your haters
Deu  That man among you who is soft and used to comfort will be hard and cruel to his brother and to his dear wife and to of those his children who are still living
Deu  And will not give to any of them the flesh of his children which will be his food because he has no other in the cruel grip of your haters on all your towns
Deu  The most soft and delicate of your women who would not so much as put her foot on the earth so delicate is she will be hardhearted to her husband and to her son and to her daughter
Deu  And to her baby newly come to birth and to the children of her body for having no other food she will make a meal of them secretly because of her bitter need and the cruel grip of your haters on all your towns
Deu  If you will not take care to do all the words of this law recorded in this book honouring that name of glory and of fear THE LORD YOUR GOD
Deu  Then the Lord your God will make your punishment and the punishment of your seed a thing to be wondered at great punishments and cruel diseases stretching on through long years
Deu  He will send on you again all the diseases of Egypt which were a cause of fear to you and they will take you in their grip
Deu  And all the diseases and the pains not recorded in the book of this law will the Lord send on you till your destruction is complete
Deu  And you will become a very small band though your numbers were like the stars of heaven because you did not give ear to the voice of the Lord your God
Deu  And as the Lord took delight in doing you good and increasing you so the Lord will take pleasure in cutting you off and causing your destruction and you will be uprooted from the land which you are about to take as your heritage
Deu  And the Lord will send you wandering among all peoples from one end of the earth to the other there you will be servants to other gods of wood and stone gods of which you and your fathers had no knowledge
Deu  And even among these nations there will be no peace for you and no rest for your feet but the Lord will give you there a shaking heart and wasting eyes and weariness of soul
Deu  Your very life will be hanging in doubt before you and day and night will be dark with fears and nothing in life will be certain
Deu  In the morning you will say If only it was evening And at evening you will say If only morning would come Because of the fear in your hearts and the things which your eyes will see
Deu  And the Lord will take you back to Egypt again in ships by the way of which I said to you You will never see it again there you will be offering yourselves as menservants and womenservants to your haters for a price and no man will take you
Deu  These are the words of the agreement which Moses was ordered by the Lord to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab in addition to the agreement which he made with them in Horeb
Deu  And Moses said in the hearing of all Israel You have seen all the Lord did before your eyes in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh and to all his servants and all his land
Deu  The great tests which your eyes saw and the signs and wonders
Deu  But even to this day the Lord has not given you a mind open to knowledge or seeing eyes or hearing ears
Deu  For forty years I have been your guide through the waste land your clothing has not become old on your backs or your shoes on your feet
Deu  You have had no bread or wine or strong drink so that you might see that I am the Lord your God
Deu  When you came to this place Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan came out to make war against us and we overcame them
Deu  And we took their land and gave it to the Reubenites and the Gadites and the halftribe of Manasseh for their heritage
Deu  So keep the words of this agreement and do them so that it may be well for you in everything you do
Deu  You have come here today all of you before the Lord your God the heads of your tribes the overseers and those who are in authority over you with all the men of Israel
Deu  And your little ones your wives and the men of other lands who are with you in your tents down to the woodcutter and the servant who gets water for you
Deu  With the purpose of taking part in the agreement of the Lord your God and his oath which he makes with you today
Deu  And so that he may make you his people today and be your God as he has said to you and as he made an oath to your fathers Abraham Isaac and Jacob
Deu  And not with you only do I make this agreement and this oath
Deu  But with everyone who is here with us today before the Lord our God as well as with those who are not here
Deu  For you have in mind how we were living in the land of Egypt and how we came through all the nations which were on your way
Deu  And you have seen their disgusting doings and the images of wood and stone and silver and gold which were among them
Deu  So that there may not be among you any man or woman or family or tribe whose heart is turned away from the Lord our God today to go after other gods and give them worship or any root among you whose fruit is poison and bitter sorrow
Deu  If such a man hearing the words of this oath takes comfort in the thought that he will have peace even if he goes on in the pride of his heart taking whatever chance may give him
Deu  The Lord will have no mercy on him but the wrath of the Lord will be burning against that man and all the curses recorded in this book will be waiting for him and the Lord will take away his name completely from the earth
Deu  He will be marked out by the Lord from all the tribes of Israel for an evil fate in keeping with all the curses of the agreement recorded in this book of the law
Deu  And future generations your children coming after you and travellers from far countries will say when they see the punishments of that land and the diseases which the Lord has sent on it
Deu  And that all the land is a salt and smoking waste not planted or giving fruit or clothed with grass but wasted like Sodom and Gomorrah Admah and Zeboiim on which the Lord sent destruction in the heat of his wrath
Deu  Truly all the nations will say Why has the Lord done so to this land what is the reason for this great and burning wrath
Deu  Then men will say Because they gave up the agreement of the Lord the God of their fathers which he made with them when he took them out of the land of Egypt
Deu  And they went after other gods and gave them worship gods who were strange to them and whom he had not given them
Deu  And so the wrath of the Lord was moved against this land to send on it all the curse recorded in this book
Deu  Rooting them out of their land in the heat of his wrath and passion and driving them out into another land as at this day
Deu  The secret things are the Lord our Gods but the things which have been made clear are ours and our childrens for ever so that we may do all the words of this law
Deu  Now when all these things have come on you the blessing and the curse which I have put before you if the thought of them comes back to your minds when you are living among the nations where the Lord your God has sent you
Deu  And your hearts are turned again to the Lord your God and you give ear to his word which I give you today you and your children with all your heart and with all your soul
Deu  Then the Lord will have pity on you changing your fate and taking you back again from among all the nations where you have been forced to go
Deu  Even if those who have been forced out are living in the farthest part of heaven the Lord your God will go in search of you and take you back
Deu  Placing you again in the land of your fathers as your heritage and he will do you good increasing you till you are more in number than your fathers were
Deu  And the Lord your God will give to you and to your seed a circumcision of the heart so that loving him with all your heart and all your soul you may have life
Deu  And the Lord your God will put all these curses on those who are against you and on your haters who put a cruel yoke on you
Deu  And you will again give ear to the voice of the Lord and do all his orders which I have given you today
Deu  And the Lord your God will make you fertile in all good things blessing the work of your hands and the fruit of your body and the fruit of your cattle and the fruit of your land for the Lord will have joy in you as he had in your fathers
Deu  If you give ear to the voice of the Lord your God keeping his orders and his laws which are recorded in this book of the law and turning to the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul
Deu  For these orders which I have given you today are not strange and secret and are not far away
Deu  They are not in heaven for you to say Who will go up to heaven for us and give us knowledge of them so that we may do them
Deu  And they are not across the sea for you to say Who will go over the sea for us and give us news of them so that we may do them
Deu  But the word is very near you in your mouth and in your heart so that you may do it
Deu  See I have put before you today life and good and death and evil
Deu  In giving you orders today to have love for the Lord your God to go in his ways and keep his laws and his orders and his decisions so that you may have life and be increased and that the blessing of the Lord your God may be with you in the land where you are going the land of your heritage
Deu  But if your heart is turned away and your ear is shut and you go after those who would make you servants and worshippers of other gods
Deu  I give witness against you this day that destruction will certainly be your fate and your days will be cut short in the land where you are going the land of your heritage on the other side of Jordan
Deu  Let heaven and earth be my witnesses against you this day that I have put before you life and death a blessing and a curse so take life for yourselves and for your seed
Deu  In loving the Lord your God hearing his voice and being true to him for he is your life and by him will your days be long so that you may go on living in the land which the Lord gave by an oath to your fathers Abraham Isaac and Jacob
Deu  So Moses said all these things to Israel
Deu  Then he said to them I am now a hundred and twenty years old I am no longer able to go out and come in and the Lord has said to me You are not to go over Jordan
Deu  The Lord your God he will go over before you he will send destruction on all those nations and you will take their land as your heritage and Joshua will go over at your head as the Lord has said
Deu  The Lord will do to them as he did to Sihon and to Og the kings of the Amorites and to their land whom he put to destruction
Deu  The Lord will give them up into your hands and you are to do to them as I have given you orders
Deu  Be strong and take heart and have no fear of them for it is the Lord your God who is going with you he will not take away his help from you
Deu  Then Moses sent for Joshua and before the eyes of all Israel said to him Be strong and take heart for you are to go with this people into the land which the Lord by his oath to their fathers has given them by your help they will take it for their heritage
Deu  It is the Lord who goes before you he will be with you he will not take away his help from you or give you up so have no fear
Deu  Then Moses put all this law in writing and gave it to the priests the sons of Levi who take up the ark of the Lords agreement and to all the responsible men of Israel
Deu  And Moses said to them At the end of every seven years at the time fixed for the ending of debts at the feast of tents
Deu  When all Israel has come before the Lord your God in the place named by him let a reading be given of this law in the hearing of all Israel
Deu  Make all the people come together men and women and children and anyone from another country who is with you so that hearing they may become wise in the fear of the Lord your God and take care to do all the words of this law
Deu  And so that your children to whom it is new may give ear and be trained in the fear of the Lord your God while you are living in the land which you are going over Jordan to take for your heritage
Deu  At that time the Lord said to Moses The day of your death is near send for Joshua and come to the Tent of meeting so that I may give him his orders So Moses and Joshua went to the Tent of meeting
Deu  And the Lord was seen in the Tent in a pillar of cloud resting by the door of the Tent
Deu  And the Lord said to Moses Now you are going to rest with your fathers and this people will be false to me uniting themselves to the strange gods of the land where they are going they will be turned away from me and will not keep the agreement I have made with them
Deu  In that day my wrath will be moved against them and I will be turned away from them veiling my face from them and destruction will overtake them and unnumbered evils and troubles will come on them so that in that day they will say Have not these evils come on us because our God is not with us
Deu  Truly my face will be turned away from them in that day because of all the evil they have done in going after other gods
Deu  Make then this song for yourselves teaching it to the children of Israel put it in their mouths so that this song may be a witness for me against the children of Israel
Deu  For when I have taken them into the land named in my oath to their fathers a land flowing with milk and honey and they have made themselves full of food and are fat then they will be turned to other gods and will give them worship no longer honouring me or keeping my agreement
Deu  Then when evils and troubles without number have overtaken them this song will be a witness to them for the words of it will be clear in the memories of their children for I see the thoughts which are moving in their hearts even now before I have taken them into the land of my oath
Deu  So that same day Moses made this song teaching it to the children of Israel
Deu  Then he gave orders to Joshua the son of Nun saying to him Be strong and take heart for you are to go at the head of the children of Israel into the land which I made an oath to give them and I will be with you
Deu  Now after writing all the words of this law in a book till the record of them was complete
Deu  Moses said to the Levites who were responsible for taking up the ark of the Lords agreement
Deu  Take this book of the law and put it by the ark of the Lords agreement so that it may be a witness against you
Deu  For I have knowledge of your hard and uncontrolled hearts even now while I am still living you will not be ruled by the Lord how much less after my death
Deu  Get together before me all those who are in authority in your tribes and your overseers so that I may say these things in their hearing and make heaven and earth my witnesses against them
Deu  For I am certain that after my death you will give yourselves up to sin wandering from the way which I have given you and evil will overtake you in the end because you will do evil in the eyes of the Lord moving him to wrath by the work of your hands
Deu  Then in the hearing of all the meeting of Israel Moses said the words of this song to the end
Deu  Give ear O heavens to my voice let the earth take note of the words of my mouth
Deu  My teaching is dropping like rain coming down like dew on the fields like rain on the young grass and showers on the garden plants
Deu  For I will give honour to the name of the Lord let our God be named great
Deu  He is the Rock complete is his work for all his ways are righteousness a God without evil who keeps faith true and upright is he
Deu  They have become false they are not his children the mark of sin is on them they are an evil and hardhearted generation
Deu  Is this your answer to the Lord O foolish people and unwise Is he not your father who has given you life He has made you and given you your place
Deu  Keep in mind the days of the past give thought to the years of generations gone by go to your father and he will make it clear to you to the old men and they will give you the story
Deu  When the Most High gave the nations their heritage separating into groups the children of men he had the limits of the peoples marked out keeping in mind the number of the children of Israel
Deu  For the Lords wealth is his people Jacob is the land of his heritage
Deu  He came to him in the waste land in the unpeopled waste of sand putting his arms round him and caring for him he kept him as the light of his eye
Deu  As an eagle teaching her young to make their flight with her wings outstretched over them takes them up on her strong feathers
Deu  So the Lord only was his guide no other god was with him
Deu  He put him on the high places of the earth his food was the increase of the field honey he gave him out of the rock and oil out of the hard rock
Deu  Butter from his cows and milk from his sheep with fat of lambs and sheep of Bashan and goats and the heart of the grain and for your drink wine from the blood of the grape
Deu  But Jeshurun became fat and would not be controlled you have become fat you are thick and full of food then he was untrue to the God who made him giving no honour to the Rock of his salvation
Deu  The honour which was his they gave to strange gods by their disgusting ways he was moved to wrath
Deu  They made offerings to evil spirits which were not God to gods who were strange to them which had newly come up not feared by your fathers
Deu  You have no thought for the Rock your father you have no memory of the God who gave you birth
Deu  And the Lord saw with disgust the evildoing of his sons and daughters
Deu  And he said My face will be veiled from them I will see what their end will be for they are an uncontrolled generation children in whom is no faith
Deu  They have given my honour to that which is not God moving me to wrath with their false worship I will give their honour to those who are not a people moving them to wrath by a foolish nation
Deu  For my wrath is a flaming fire burning to the deep parts of the underworld burning up the earth with her increase and firing the deep roots of the mountains
Deu  I will send a rain of troubles on them my arrows will be showered on them
Deu  They will be wasted from need of food and overcome by burning heat and bitter destruction and the teeth of beasts I will send on them with the poison of the worms of the dust
Deu  Outside they will be cut off by the sword and in the inner rooms by fear death will take the young man and the virgin the baby at the breast and the greyhaired man
Deu  I said I would send them wandering far away I would make all memory of them go from the minds of men
Deu  But for the fear that their haters uplifted in their pride might say Our hand is strong the Lord has not done all this
Deu  For they are a nation without wisdom there is no sense in them
Deu  If only they were wise if only this was clear to them and they would give thought to their future
Deu  How would it be possible for one to overcome a thousand and two to send ten thousand in flight if their rock had not let them go if the Lord had not given them up
Deu  For their rock is not like our Rock even our haters themselves being judges
Deu  For their vine is the vine of Sodom from the fields of Gomorrah their grapes are the grapes of evil and the berries are bitter
Deu  Their wine is the poison of dragons the cruel poison of snakes
Deu  Is not this among my secrets kept safe in my storehouse
Deu  Punishment is mine and reward at the time of the slipping of their feet for the day of their downfall is near sudden will be their fate
Deu  For the Lord will be judge of his people he will have pity for his servants when he sees that their power is gone there is no one shut up or free
Deu  And he will say Where are their gods the rock in which they put their faith
Deu  Who took the fat of their offerings and the wine of their drink offering Let them now come to your help let them be your salvation
Deu  See now I myself am he there is no other god but me giver of death and life wounding and making well and no one has power to make you free from my hand
Deu  For lifting up my hand to heaven I say By my unending life
Deu  If I make sharp my shining sword and my hand is outstretched for judging I will give punishment to those who are against me and their right reward to my haters
Deu  I will make my arrows red with blood my sword will be feasting on flesh with the blood of the dead and the prisoners of the longhaired heads of my haters
Deu  Be glad O you his people over the nations for he will take payment for the blood of his servants and will give punishment to his haters and take away the sin of his land for his people
Deu  So Moses said all the words of this song in the hearing of the people he and Hoshea the son of Nun
Deu  And after saying all this to the people
Deu  Moses said to them Let the words which I have said to you today go deep into your hearts and give orders to your children to do every word of this law
Deu  And this is no small thing for you but it is your life and through this you may make your days long in the land which you are going over Jordan to take for your heritage
Deu  That same day the Lord said to Moses

Deu  And let death come to you on the mountain where you are going and be put to rest with your people as death came to Aaron your brother on Mount Hor where he was put to rest with his people
Deu  Because of your sin against me before the children of Israel at the waters of Meribath Kadesh in the waste land of Zin because you did not keep my name holy among the children of Israel
Deu  So you will see the land before you but you will not go into the land which I am giving to the children of Israel
Deu  Now this is the blessing which Moses the man of God gave to the children of Israel before his death

Deu  Moses gave us a law a heritage for the people of Jacob
Deu  And there was a king in Jeshurun when the heads of the people and the tribes of Israel came together
Deu  Let life not death be Reubens let not the number of his men be small
Deu  And this is the blessing of Judah he said Give ear O Lord to the voice of Judah and make him one with his people let your hands take up his cause and be his help against his attackers

Deu  They will be the teachers of your decisions to Jacob and of your law to Israel the burning of perfumes before you will be their right and the ordering of burned offerings on your altar

Deu  And of Benjamin he said Benjamin is the loved one of the Lord he will be kept safe at all times he will be covered by the Most High resting between his arms

Deu  The good things of the earth and all its wealth the good pleasure of him who was seen in the burning tree may they come on the head of Joseph on the head of him who was prince among his brothers
Deu  He is a young ox glory is his his horns are the horns of the mountain ox with which all peoples will be wounded even to the ends of the earth they are the ten thousands of Ephraim and the thousands of Manasseh
Deu  And of Zebulun he said Be glad Zebulun in your going out and Issachar in your tents
Deu  They will send out the word for the people to come to the mountain taking there the offerings of righteousness for the store of the seas will be theirs and the secret wealth of the sand
Deu  Of Gad he said A blessing be on him who makes wide the limits of Gad he takes his rest like a shelion taking for himself the arm and the crown of the head

Deu  And of Dan he said Dan is a young lion springing out from Bashan
Deu  And of Naphtali he said O Naphtali made glad with grace and full of the blessing of the Lord the sea and its fishes will be his
Deu  And of Asher he said Let Asher have the blessing of children may he be pleasing to his brothers and let his foot be wet with oil
Deu  Your shoes will be iron and brass and as your days so may your work be
Deu  No other is like the God of Jeshurun coming on the heavens to your help and letting his glory be seen in the skies
Deu  The God of your fathers is your safe restingplace and under you are his eternal arms driving out the forces of your haters from before you he said Let destruction overtake them
Deu  And Israel is living in peace the fountain of Jacob by himself in a land of grain and wine with dew dropping from the heavens
Deu  Happy are you O Israel who is like you a people whose saviour is the Lord whose help is your cover whose sword is your strength All those who are against you will put themselves under your rule and your feet will be planted on their high places
Deu  And Moses went up from the tablelands of Moab to Mount Nebo to the top of Pisgah which is facing Jericho And the Lord let him see all the land the land of Gilead as far as Dan
Deu  And all Naphtali and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh and all the land of Judah as far as the Great Sea of the west
