Est  In those days while Mordecai was seated at the kings doorway two of the kings servants Bigthan and Teresh keepers of the door being angry were looking for a chance to make an attack on King Ahasuerus
Est  And Mordecai having knowledge of their purpose sent word of it to Esther the queen and Esther gave the news to the king in Mordecais name
Est  And when the thing had been looked into it was seen to be true and the two of them were put to death by hanging on a tree and it was put down in the records before the king
Est  After these things by the order of the king Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite was lifted up and given a position of honour and a higher place than all the other captains who were with him
Est  And all the kings servants who were in the kings house went down to the earth before Haman and gave him honour for so the king had given orders But Mordecai did not go down before him or give him honour
Est  Then the kings servants who were in the kings house said to Mordecai Why do you go against the kings order
Est  Now when they had said this to him day after day and he gave no attention they let Haman have news of it to see if Mordecais behaviour would be overlooked for he had said to them that he was a Jew
Est  And when Haman saw that Mordecai did not go down before him and give him honour Haman was full of wrath
Est  But it was not enough for him to make an attack on Mordecai only for they had made clear to him who Mordecais people were so Haman made it his purpose to put an end to all the Jews even Mordecais people through all the kingdom of Ahasuerus
Est  In the first month the month Nisan in the twelfth year of King Ahasuerus from day to day and from month to month they went on looking for a sign given by Pur that is chance before Haman till the sign came out for the thirteenth day of the twelfth month the month Adar
Est  And Haman said to King Ahasuerus There is a certain nation living here and there in small groups among the people in all the divisions of your kingdom their laws are different from those of any other nation and they do not keep the kings laws for this reason it is not right for the king to let them be
Est  If it is the kings pleasure let a statement ordering their destruction be put in writing and I will give to those responsible for the kings business ten thousand talents of silver for the kings storehouse
Est  And the king took his ring from his hand and gave it to Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite the hater of the Jews
Est  And the king said to Haman The money is yours and the people to do with them whatever seems right to you
Est  Then on the thirteenth day of the first month the kings scribes were sent for and they put in writing Hamans orders to all the kings captains and the rulers of every division of his kingdom and the chiefs of every people for every division of the kingdom in the writing commonly used there and to every people in the language which was theirs it was signed in the name of King Ahasuerus and stamped with the kings ring
Est  And letters were sent by the runners into every division of the kingdom ordering the death and destruction of all Jews young and old little children and women on the same day even the thirteenth day of the twelfth month the month Adar and the taking of all their goods by force
Est  A copy of the writing to be made public in every part of the kingdom was sent out to all the peoples so that they might be ready when that day came
Est  The runners went out quickly by the kings order and a public statement was made in Shushan and the king and Haman took wine together but the town of Shushan was troubled
Est  Now when Mordecai saw what was done pulling off his robe he put on haircloth with dust on his head and went out into the middle of the town crying out with a loud and bitter cry
Est  And he came even before the kings doorway for no one might come inside the kings door clothed in haircloth
Est  And in every part of the kingdom wherever the kings word and his order came there was great sorrow among the Jews and weeping and crying and going without food and numbers of them were stretched on the earth covered with dust and haircloth
Est  And Esthers women and her servants came and gave her word of it Then great was the grief of the queen and she sent robes for Mordecai so that his clothing of haircloth might be taken off but he would not have them
Est  Then Esther sent for Hathach one of the kings unsexed servants whom he had given her for waiting on her and she gave him orders to go to Mordecai and see what this was and why it was
Est  So Hathach went out and saw Mordecai in the open square of the town before the kings doorway
Est  And Mordecai gave him an account of what had taken place and of the amount of money which Haman had said he would put into the kings store for the destruction of the Jews
Est  And he gave him the copy of the order which had been given out in Shushan for their destruction ordering him to let Esther see it and to make it clear to her and to say to her that she was to go in to the king requesting his mercy and making prayer for her people
Est  And Hathach came back and gave Esther an account of what Mordecai had said
Est  Then Esther sent Hathach to say to Mordecai
Est  It is common knowledge among all the kings servants and the people of every part of the kingdom that if anyone man or woman comes to the king in his inner room without being sent for there is only one law for him that he is to be put to death only those to whom the kings rod of gold is stretched out may keep their lives but I have not been sent for to come before the king these thirty days
Est  And they said these words to Mordecai
Est  Then Mordecai sent this answer back to Esther Do not have the idea that you in the kings house will be safe from the fate of all the Jews
Est  If at this time you say nothing then help and salvation will come to the Jews from some other place but you and your fathers family will come to destruction and who is to say that you have not come to the kingdom even for such a time as this
Est  Then Esther sent them back to Mordecai with this answer
Est  Go get together all the Jews who are present in Shushan and go without food for me taking no food or drink night or day for three days and I and my women will do the same and so I will go in to the king which is against the law and if death is to be my fate then let it come
Est  So Mordecai went away and did everything as Esther had said
Est  Now on the third day Esther put on her queens robes and took her place in the inner room of the kings house facing the kings house and the king was seated on his high seat in the kings house facing the doorway of the house
Est  And when the king saw Esther the queen waiting in the inner room looking kindly on her he put out the rod of gold in his hand to her So Esther came near and put her fingers on the top of the rod
Est  Then the king said What is your desire Queen Esther and what is your request I will give it to you even to the half of my kingdom
Est  And Esther in answer said If it seems good to the king let the king and Haman come today to the feast which I have made ready for him
Est  Then the king said Let Haman come quickly so that what Esther has said may be done So the king and Haman came to the feast which Esther had made ready
Est  And while they were drinking wine the king said to Esther What is your prayer for it will be given to you and what is your request for it will be done even to the half of my kingdom
Est  Then Esther said in answer My prayer and my request is this
Est  If I have the kings approval and if it is the kings pleasure to give me my prayer and do my request let the king and Haman come to the feast which I will make ready for them and tomorrow I will do as the king has said
Est  Then on that day Haman went out full of joy and glad in heart but when he saw Mordecai in the kings doorway and he did not get to his feet or give any sign of fear before him Haman was full of wrath against Mordecai
Est  But controlling himself he went to his house and he sent for his friends and Zeresh his wife
Est  And he gave them an account of the glories of his wealth and the number of children he had and the ways in which he had been honoured by the king and how he had put him over the captains and servants of the king
Est  And Haman said further Truly Esther the queen let no man but myself come in to the feast which she had made ready for the king and tomorrow again I am to be her guest with the king
Est  But all this is nothing to me while I see Mordecai the Jew seated by the kings doorway
Est  Then his wife Zeresh and all his friends said to him Let a pillar fifty cubits high be made ready for hanging him and in the morning get the king to give orders for the hanging of Mordecai then you will be able to go to the feast with the king with a glad heart And Haman was pleased with the suggestion and he had the pillar made
Est  That night the king was unable to get any sleep and he sent for the books of the records and while some one was reading them to the king
Est  It came out that it was recorded in the book how Mordecai had given word of the designs of Bigthana and Teresh two of the kings servants keepers of the door by whom an attack on the king had been designed
Est  And the king said What honour and reward have been given to Mordecai for this Then the servants who were waiting on the king said Nothing has been done for him
Est  Then the king said Who is in the outer room Now Haman had come into the outer room to get the kings authority for the hanging of Mordecai on the pillar which he had made ready for him
Est  And the kings servants said to him See Haman is waiting in the outer room And the king said Let him come in
Est  So Haman came in And the king said to him What is to be done to the man whom the king has delight in honouring Then the thought came into Hamans mind Whom more than myself would the king have pleasure in honouring
Est  And Haman answering the king said For the man whom the king has delight in honouring
Est  Let them take the robes which the king generally puts on and the horse on which the king goes and the crown which is on his head
Est  And let the robes and the horse be given to one of the kings most noble captains so that they may put them on the man whom the king has delight in honouring and let him go on horseback through the streets of the town with men crying out before him So let it be done to the man whom the king has delight in honouring
Est  Then the king said to Haman Go quickly and take the robes and the horse as you have said and do even so to Mordecai the Jew who is seated at the kings doorway see that you do everything as you have said
Est  Then Haman took the robes and the horse and dressing Mordecai in the robes he made him go on horseback through the streets of the town crying out before him So let it be done to the man whom the king has delight in honouring
Est  And Mordecai came back to the kings doorway But Haman went quickly back to his house sad and with his head covered
Est  And Haman gave his wife Zeresh and all his friends an account of what had taken place Then his wise men and his wife Zeresh said to him If Mordecai who is starting to get the better of you is of the seed of the Jews you will not be able to do anything against him but you will certainly go down before him
Est  While they were still talking the kings servants came to take Haman to the feast which Esther had made ready
Est  So the king and Haman came to take wine with Esther the queen
Est  And the king said to Esther again on the second day while they were drinking What is your prayer Queen Esther for it will be given to you and what is your request for it will be done even to the half of my kingdom
Est  Then Esther the queen answering said If I have your approval O king and if it is the kings pleasure let my life be given to me in answer to my prayer and my people at my request
Est  For we are given up I and my people to destruction and death and to be cut off If we had been taken as menservants and womenservants for a price I would have said nothing for our trouble is little in comparison with the kings loss
Est  Then King Ahasuerus said to Esther the queen Who is he and where is he who has had this evil thought in his heart
Est  And Esther said Our hater and attacker is this evil Haman Then Haman was full of fear before the king and the queen
Est  And the king in his wrath got up from the feast and went into the garden and Haman got to his feet to make a prayer for his life to Esther the queen for he saw that the kings purpose was evil against him
Est  Then the king came back from the garden into the room where they had been drinking and Haman was stretched out on the seat where Esther was Then the king said Is he taking the queen by force before my eyes in my house And while the words were on the kings lips they put a cloth over Hamans face
Est  Then Harbonah one of the unsexed servants waiting before the king said See the pillar fifty cubits high which Haman made for Mordecai who said a good word for the king is still in its place in Hamans house Then the king said Put him to death by hanging him on it
Est  So Haman was put to death by hanging him on the pillar he had made for Mordecai Then the kings wrath became less
Est  That day the king gave all the family of Haman the hater of the Jews to Esther the queen And Mordecai came before the king for Esther had made clear what he was to her
Est  And the king took off his ring which he had taken from Haman and gave it to Mordecai And Esther put Mordecai over the family of Haman
Est  Then Esther again came before the king falling down at his feet and made request to him with weeping that he would put a stop to the evil purposes of Haman the Agagite and the designs which he had made against the Jews
Est  Then the king put out the rod of gold to Esther and she got up before the king
Est  And she said If it is the kings pleasure and if I have his approval and this thing seems right to the king and I am pleasing to him then let letters be sent giving orders against those which Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite sent out for the destruction of the Jews in all divisions of the kingdom
Est  For how is it possible for me to see the evil which is to overtake my nation how may I see the destruction of my people
Est  Then King Ahasuerus said to Esther the queen and to Mordecai the Jew See now I have given Esther the family of Haman and he has come to his death by hanging because he made an attack on the Jews
Est  So now send a letter about the Jews writing whatever seems good to you in the kings name and stamping it with the kings ring for a writing signed in the kings name and stamped with the kings ring may not be changed
Est  Then at that time on the twentythird day of the third month which is the month Sivan the kings scribes were sent for and everything ordered by Mordecai was put in writing and sent to the Jews and the captains and the rulers and the chiefs of all the divisions of the kingdom from India to Ethiopia a hundred and twentyseven divisions to every division in the writing commonly used there and to every people in their language and to the Jews in their writing and their language
Est  The letters were sent in the name of King Ahasuerus and stamped with his ring and they were taken by men on horseback going on the quickrunning horses used for the kings business the offspring of his best horses
Est  In these letters the king gave authority to the Jews in every town to come together and make a fight for their lives and to send death and destruction on the power of any people in any part of the kingdom attacking them or their children or their women and to take their goods from them by force
Est  On one day in every division of the kingdom of Ahasuerus that is on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month the month Adar
Est  A copy of the writing to be made public as an order in every division of the kingdom was given out to all the peoples so that the Jews might be ready when that day came to give punishment to their haters
Est  So the men went out on the quickrunning horses used on the kings business wasting no time and forced on by the kings order and the order was given out in Shushan the kings town
Est  And Mordecai went out from before the king dressed in kinglike robes of blue and white and with a great crown of gold and clothing of purple and the best linen and all the town of Shushan gave loud cries of joy
Est  And the Jews had light and joy and honour
Est  And in every part of the kingdom and in every town wherever the kings letter and his order came the Jews were glad with great joy and had a feast and a good day And a great number of the people of the land became Jews for the fear of the Jews had come on them
Est  Now on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month which is the month Adar when the time came for the kings order to be put into effect on the very day when the haters of the Jews had been hoping to have rule over them though the opposite had come about and the Jews had rule over their haters
Est  On that day the Jews came together in their towns through all the divisions of the kingdom of Ahasuerus for the purpose of attacking all those who were attempting evil against them and everyone had to give way before them for the fear of them had come on all the peoples
Est  And all the chiefs and the captains and the rulers and those who did the kings business gave support to the Jews because the fear of Mordecai had come on them
Est  For Mordecai was great in the kings house and word of him went out through every part of the kingdom for the man Mordecai became greater and greater
Est  So the Jews overcame all their attackers with the sword and with death and destruction and did to their haters whatever they had a desire to do
Est  And in Shushan the Jews put to death five hundred men
Est  They put to death Parshandatha Dalphon Aspatha
Est  Poratha Adalia Aridatha
Est  Parmashta Arisai Aridai and Vaizatha
Est  The ten sons of Haman the son of Hammedatha the hater of the Jews but they put not a hand on any of their goods
Est  On that day the number of those who had been put to death in the town of Shushan was given to the king
Est  And the king said to Esther the queen The Jews have put five hundred men to death in Shushan as well as the ten sons of Haman what then have they done in the rest of the kingdom Now what is your prayer for it will be given to you what other request have you and it will be done
Est  Then Esther said If it is the kings pleasure let authority be given to the Jews in Shushan to do tomorrow as has been done today and let orders be given for the hanging of Hamans ten sons
Est  And the king said that this was to be done and the order was given out in Shushan and the hanging of Hamans ten sons was effected
Est  For the Jews who were in Shushan came together again on the fourteenth day of the month Adar and put to death three hundred men in Shushan but they put not a hand on their goods
Est  And the other Jews in every division of the kingdom came together fighting for their lives and got salvation from their haters and put seventyfive thousand of them to death but they did not put a hand on their goods
Est  This they did on the thirteenth day of the month Adar and on the fourteenth day of the same month they took their rest and made it a day of feasting and joy
Est  But the Jews in Shushan came together on the thirteenth and on the fourteenth day of the month and on the fifteenth day they took their rest and made it a day of feasting and joy
Est  So the Jews of the country places living in unwalled towns make the fourteenth day of the month Adar a day of feasting and joy and a good day a day for sending offerings one to another
Est  And Mordecai sent letters to all the Jews in every division of the kingdom of Ahasuerus near and far
Est  Ordering them to keep the fourteenth day of the month Adar and the fifteenth day of the same month every year
Est  As days on which the Jews had rest from their haters and the month which for them was turned from sorrow to joy and from weeping to a good day and that they were to keep them as days of feasting and joy of sending offerings to one another and good things to the poor
Est  And the Jews gave their word to go on as they had been doing and as Mordecai had given them orders in writing
Est  Because Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite the hater of all the Jews had made designs for their destruction attempting to get a decision by Pur that is chance with a view to putting an end to them and cutting them off
Est  But when the business was put before the king he gave orders by letters that the evil design which he had made against the Jews was to be turned against himself and that he and his sons were to be put to death by hanging
Est  So these days were named Purim after the name of Pur And so because of the words of this letter and of what they had seen in connection with this business and what had come to them
Est  The Jews made a rule and gave an undertaking causing their seed and all those who were joined to them to do the same so that it might be in force for ever that they would keep those two days as ordered in the letter at the fixed time every year
Est  And that those days were to be kept in memory through every generation and every family in every division of the kingdom and every town that there might never be a time when these days of Purim would not be kept among the Jews or when the memory of them would go from the minds of their seed
Est  Then Esther the queen daughter of Abihail and Mordecai the Jew sent a second letter giving the force of their authority to the order about the Purim
Est  And he sent letters to all the Jews in the hundred and twentyseven divisions of the kingdom of Ahasuerus with true words of peace
Est  Giving the force of law to these days of Purim at their fixed times as they had been ordered by Mordecai the Jew and Esther the queen and in keeping with the rules they had made for themselves and their seed in connection with their time of going without food and their cry for help
Est  The order given by Esther gave the force of law to the rules about the Purim and it was recorded in the book
Est  And King Ahasuerus put a tax on the land and on the islands of the sea
Est  And all his acts of power and his great strength and the full story of the high place which the king gave Mordecai are they not recorded in the book of the history of the kings of Media and Persia
Est  For Mordecai the Jew was second only to King Ahasuerus and great among the Jews and respected by the body of his countrymen working for the good of his people and saying words of peace to all his seed
Job  There was a man in the land of Uz whose name was Job He was without sin and upright fearing God and keeping himself far from evil
Job  And he had seven sons and three daughters
Job  And of cattle he had seven thousand sheep and goats and three thousand camels and a thousand oxen and five hundred sheasses and a very great number of servants And the man was greater than any of the sons of the east
Job  His sons regularly went to one anothers houses and every one on his day gave a feast and at these times they sent for their three sisters to take part in their feasts with them
Job  And at the end of their days of feasting Job sent and made them clean getting up early in the morning and offering burned offerings for them all For Job said It may be that my sons have done wrong and said evil of God in their hearts And Job did this whenever the feasts came round
Job  And there was a day when the sons of the gods came together before the Lord and the Satan came with them
Job  And the Lord said to the Satan Where do you come from And the Satan said in answer From wandering this way and that on the earth and walking about on it
Job  And the Lord said to the Satan Have you taken note of my servant Job for there is no one like him on the earth a man without sin and upright fearing God and keeping himself far from evil
Job  And the Satan said in answer to the Lord Is it for nothing that Job is a godfearing man
Job  Have you yourself not put a wall round him and his house and all he has on every side blessing the work of his hands and increasing his cattle in the land
Job  But now put out your hand against all he has and he will be cursing you to your face
Job  And the Lord said to the Satan See I give all he has into your hands only do not put a finger on the man himself And the Satan went out from before the Lord
Job  And there was a day when his sons and daughters were feasting in the house of their oldest brother
Job  And a man came to Job and said The oxen were ploughing and the asses were taking their food by their side
Job  And the men of Sheba came against them and took them away putting the young men to the sword and I was the only one who got away safe to give you the news
Job  And this one was still talking when another came and said The fire of God came down from heaven burning up the sheep and the goats and the young men completely and I was the only one who got away safe to give you the news
Job  And this one was still talking when another came and said The Chaldaeans made themselves into three bands and came down on the camels and took them away putting the young men to the sword and I was the only one who got away safe to give you the news
Job  And this one was still talking when another came and said Your sons and your daughters were feasting together in their oldest brothers house
Job  When a great wind came rushing from the waste land against the four sides of the house and it came down on the young men and they are dead and I was the only one who got away safe to give you the news
Job  Then Job got up and after parting his clothing and cutting off his hair he went down on his face to the earth and gave worship and said
Job  With nothing I came out of my mothers body and with nothing I will go back there the Lord gave and the Lord has taken away let the Lords name be praised
Job  In all this Job did no sin and did not say that Gods acts were foolish
Job  And there was a day when the sons of the gods came together before the Lord and the Satan came with them
Job  And the Lord said to the Satan Where do you come from And the Satan said in answer From wandering this way and that on the earth and walking about on it
Job  And the Lord said to the Satan Have you taken note of my servant Job for there is no one like him on the earth a man without sin and upright fearing God and keeping himself far from evil and he still keeps his righteousness though you have been moving me to send destruction on him without cause
Job  And the Satan said in answer to the Lord Skin for skin all a man has he will give for his life
Job  But now if you only put your hand on his bone and his flesh he will certainly be cursing you to your face
Job  And the Lord said to the Satan See he is in your hands only do not take his life
Job  And the Satan went out from before the Lord and sent on Job an evil disease covering his skin from his feet to the top of his head
Job  And he took a broken bit of a pot and seated in the dust was rubbing himself with the sharp edge of it
Job  And his wife said to him Are you still keeping your righteousness Say a curse against God and put an end to yourself
Job  And he said to her You are talking like one of the foolish women If we take the good God sends us are we not to take the evil when it comes In all this Job kept his lips from sin
Job  And Jobs three friends had word of all this evil which had come on him And they came every one from his place Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite So they came together to a meetingplace in order that they might go and make clear to Job their grief for him and give him comfort
Job  And lifting up their eyes when they were still far off it did not seem that the man they saw was Job because of the change in him And they gave way to bitter weeping with signs of grief and put dust on their heads
Job  And they took their seats on the earth by his side for seven days and seven nights but no one said a word to him for they saw that his pain was very great
Job  Then opening his mouth and cursing the day of his birth
Job  Job made answer and said
Job  Let destruction take the day of my birth and the night on which it was said A man child has come into the world
Job  That daylet it be dark let not God take note of it from on high and let not the light be shining on it
Job  Let the dark and the black night take it for themselves let it be covered with a cloud let the dark shades of day send fear on it
Job  That nightlet the thick dark take it let it not have joy among the days of the year let it not come into the number of the months
Job  As for that night let it have no fruit let no voice of joy be sounded in it
Job  Let it be cursed by those who put a curse on the day who are ready to make Leviathan awake
Job  Let its morning stars be dark let it be looking for light but may it not have any let it not see the eyes of the dawn
Job  Because it did not keep the doors of my mothers body shut so that trouble might be veiled from my eyes
Job  Why did death not take me when I came out of my mothers body why did I not when I came out give up my last breath
Job  Why did the knees take me or why the breasts that they might give me milk
Job  For then I might have gone to my rest in quiet and in sleep have been in peace
Job  With kings and the wise ones of the earth who put up great houses for themselves
Job  Or with rulers who had gold and whose houses were full of silver
Job  Or as a child dead at birth I might never have come into existence like young children who have not seen the light
Job  There the passions of the evil are over and those whose strength has come to an end have rest
Job  There the prisoners are at peace together the voice of the overseer comes not again to their ears
Job  The small and the great are there and the servant is free from his master
Job  Why does he give light to him who is in trouble and life to the bitter in soul
Job  To those whose desire is for death but it comes not who are searching for it more than for secret wealth
Job  Who are glad with great joy and full of delight when they come to their last restingplace
Job  To a man whose way is veiled and who is shut in by God
Job  In place of my food I have grief and cries of sorrow come from me like water
Job  For I have a fear and it comes on me and my heart is greatly troubled
Job  I have no peace no quiet and no rest nothing but pain comes on me
Job  And Eliphaz the Temanite made answer and said
Job  If one says a word will it be a weariness to you but who is able to keep from saying what is in his mind
Job  Truly you have been a helper to others and you have made feeble hands strong
Job  He who was near to falling has been lifted up by your words and you have given strength to bent knees
Job  But now it has come on you and it is a weariness to you you are touched by it and your mind is troubled
Job  Is not your fear of God your support and your upright way of life your hope
Job  Have you ever seen destruction come to an upright man or when were the godfearing ever cut off
Job  What I have seen is that those by whom trouble has been ploughed and evil planted get the same for themselves
Job  By the breath of God destruction takes them and by the wind of his wrath they are cut off
Job  Though the noise of the lion and the sounding of his voice may be loud the teeth of the young lions are broken
Job  The old lion comes to his end for need of food and the young of the shelion go wandering in all directions
Job  A word was given to me secretly and the low sound of it came to my ears
Job  In troubled thoughts from visions of the night when deep sleep comes on men
Job  Fear came on me and shaking and my bones were full of trouble
Job  And a breath was moving over my face the hair of my flesh became stiff
Job  Something was present before me but I was not able to see it clearly there was a form before my eyes a quiet voice came to my ears saying
Job  May a man be upright before God or a man be clean before his Maker
Job  Truly he puts no faith in his servants and he sees error in his angels
Job  How much more those living in houses of earth whose bases are in the dust They are crushed more quickly than an insect
Job  Between morning and evening they are completely broken they come to an end for ever and no one takes note
Job  If their tentcord is pulled up do they not come to an end and without wisdom
Job  Give now a cry for help is there anyone who will give you an answer and to which of the holy ones will you make your prayer
Job  For wrath is the cause of death to the foolish and he who has no wisdom comes to his end through passion
Job  I have seen the foolish taking root but suddenly the curse came on his house
Job  Now his children have no safe place and they are crushed before the judges for no one takes up their cause
Job  Their produce is taken by him who has no food and their grain goes to the poor and he who is in need of water gets it from their spring
Job  For evil does not come out of the dust or trouble out of the earth
Job  But trouble is mans fate from birth as the flames go up from the fire
Job  But as for me I would make my prayer to God and I would put my cause before him
Job  Who does great things outside our knowledge wonders without number
Job  Who gives rain on the earth and sends water on the fields
Job  Lifting up those who are low and putting the sad in a safe place
Job  Who makes the designs of the wise go wrong so that they are unable to give effect to their purposes
Job  He takes the wise in their secret designs and the purposes of the twisted are cut off suddenly
Job  In the daytime it becomes dark for them and in the sunlight they go feeling about as if it was night
Job  But he keeps safe from their sword those who have no father and the poor from the power of the strong
Job  So the poor man has hope and the mouth of the evildoer is stopped
Job  Truly that man is happy who has training from the hand of God so do not let your heart be shut to the teaching of the Ruler of all
Job  For after his punishment he gives comfort and after wounding his hands make you well
Job  He will keep you safe from six troubles and in seven no evil will come near you
Job  When there is need of food he will keep you from death and in war from the power of the sword
Job  He will keep you safe from the evil tongue and you will have no fear of wasting when it comes
Job  You will make sport of destruction and need and will have no fear of the beasts of the earth
Job  For you will be in agreement with the stones of the earth and the beasts of the field will be at peace with you
Job  And you will be certain that your tent is at peace and after looking over your property you will see that nothing is gone
Job  You will be certain that your seed will be great and your offspring like the plants of the earth
Job  You will come to your last restingplace in full strength as the grain is taken up to the crushingfloor in its time
Job  See we have made search with care and it is so it has come to our ears see that you take note of it for yourself
Job  And Job made answer and said
Job  If only my passion might be measured and put into the scales against my trouble
Job  For then its weight would be more than the sand of the seas because of this my words have been uncontrolled
Job  For the arrows of the Ruler of all are present with me and their poison goes deep into my spirit his army of fears is put in order against me
Job  Does the ass of the fields give out his voice when he has grass or does the ox make sounds over his food
Job  Will a man take food which has no taste without salt or is there any taste in the soft substance of purslain
Job  My soul has no desire for such things they are as disease in my food
Job  If only I might have an answer to my prayer and God would give me my desire
Job  If only he would be pleased to put an end to me and would let loose his hand so that I might be cut off
Job  So I would still have comfort and I would have joy in the pains of death for I have not been false to the words of the Holy One
Job  Have I strength to go on waiting or have I any end to be looking forward to
Job  Is my strength the strength of stones or is my flesh brass
Job  I have no help in myself and wisdom is completely gone from me
Job  He whose heart is shut against his friend has given up the fear of the Ruler of all
Job  My friends have been false like a stream like streams in the valleys which come to an end
Job  Which are dark because of the ice and the snow falling into them
Job  Under the burning sun they are cut off and come to nothing because of the heat
Job  The cameltrains go out of their way they go up into the waste and come to destruction
Job  The cameltrains of Tema were searching with care the bands of Sheba were waiting for them
Job  They were put to shame because of their hope they came and their hope was gone
Job  So have you now become to me you see my sad condition and are in fear
Job  Did I say Give me something or Make a payment for me out of your wealth
Job  Or Get me out of the power of my hater or Give money so that I may be free from the power of the cruel ones
Job  Give me teaching and I will be quiet and make me see my error
Job  How pleasing are upright words but what force is there in your arguments
Job  My words may seem wrong to you but the words of him who has no hope are for the wind
Job  Truly you are such as would give up the child of a dead man to his creditors and would make a profit out of your friend
Job  Now then let your eyes be turned to me for truly I will not say what is false to your face
Job  Let your minds be changed and do not have an evil opinion of me yes be changed for my righteousness is still in me
Job  Is there evil in my tongue is not the cause of my trouble clear to me
Job  Has not man his ordered time of trouble on the earth and are not his days like the days of a servant working for payment
Job  As a servant desiring the shades of evening and a workman looking for his payment
Job  So I have for my heritage months of pain to no purpose and nights of weariness are given to me
Job  When I go to my bed I say When will it be time to get up but the night is long and I am turning from side to side till morning light
Job  My flesh is covered with worms and dust my skin gets hard and then is cracked again
Job  My days go quicker than the clothworkers thread and come to an end without hope
Job  O keep in mind that my life is wind my eye will never again see good
Job  The eye of him who sees me will see me no longer your eyes will be looking for me but I will be gone
Job  A cloud comes to an end and is gone so he who goes down into the underworld comes not up again
Job  He will not come back to his house and his place will have no more knowledge of him
Job  So I will not keep my mouth shut I will let the words come from it in the pain of my spirit my soul will make a bitter outcry
Job  Am I a sea or a seabeast that you put a watch over me
Job  When I say In my bed I will have comfort there I will get rest from my disease
Job  Then you send dreams to me and visions of fear
Job  So that a hard death seems better to my soul than my pains
Job  I have no desire for life I would not be living for ever Keep away from me for my days are as a breath
Job  What is man that you have made him great and that your attention is fixed on him
Job  And that your hand is on him every morning and that you are testing him every minute
Job  How long will it be before your eyes are turned away from me so that I may have a minutes breathingspace
Job  If I have done wrong what have I done to you O keeper of men why have you made me a mark for your blows so that I am a weariness to myself
Job  And why do you not take away my sin and let my wrongdoing be ended for now I go down to the dust and you will be searching for me with care but I will be gone
Job  Then Bildad the Shuhite made answer and said
Job  How long will you say these things and how long will the words of your mouth be like a strong wind
Job  Does God give wrong decisions or is the Ruler of all not upright in his judging
Job  If your children have done evil against him then their punishment is from his hand
Job  If you will make search for God with care and put your request before the Ruler of all
Job  If you are clean and upright then he will certainly be moved to take up your cause and will make clear your righteousness by building up your house again
Job  And though your start was small your end will be very great
Job  Put the question now to the past generations and give attention to what has been searched out by their fathers
Job  For we are but of yesterday and have no knowledge because our days on earth are gone like a shade
Job  Will they not give you teaching and say words of wisdom to you
Job  Will the riverplant come up in its pride without wet earth will the grass get tall without water
Job  When it is still green without being cut down it becomes dry and dead before any other plant
Job  So is the end of all who do not keep God in mind and the hope of the evildoer comes to nothing
Job  Whose support is cut off and whose hope is no stronger than a spiders thread
Job  He is looking to his family for support but it is not there he puts his hope in it but it comes to nothing
Job  He is full of strength before the sun and his branches go out over his garden
Job  His roots are twisted round the stones forcing their way in between them
Job  If he is taken away from his place then it will say I have not seen you
Job  Such is the joy of his way and out of the dust another comes up to take his place
Job  Truly God will not give up him who is without sin and will not take evildoers by the hand
Job  The time will come when your mouth will be full of laughing and cries of joy will come from your lips
Job  Your haters will be clothed with shame and the tent of the sinner will not be seen again
Job  And Job made answer and said
Job  Truly I see that it is so and how is it possible for a man to get his right before God
Job  If a man was desiring to go to law with him he would not be able to give him an answer to one out of a thousand questions
Job  He is wise in heart and great in strength who ever made his face hard against him and any good came of it
Job  It is he who takes away the mountains without their knowledge overturning them in his wrath
Job  Who is moving the earth out of its place so that its pillars are shaking
Job  Who gives orders to the sun and it does not give its light and who keeps the stars from shining
Job  By whose hand the heavens were stretched out and who is walking on the waves of the sea
Job  Who made the Bear and Orion and the Pleiades and the storehouses of the south
Job  Who does great things not to be searched out yes wonders without number
Job  See he goes past me and I see him not he goes on before but I have no knowledge of him
Job  If he puts out his hand to take by whom may it be turned back who may say to him What are you doing
Job  Gods wrath may not be turned back the helpers of Rahab were bent down under him
Job  How much less may I give an answer to him using the right words in argument with him
Job  Even if my cause was good I would not be able to give an answer I would make request for grace from him who was against me
Job  If I had sent for him to be present and he had come I would have no faith that he would give ear to my voice
Job  For I would be crushed by his storm my wounds would be increased without cause
Job  He would not let me take my breath but I would be full of bitter grief
Job  If it is a question of strength he says Here I am and if it is a question of a cause at law he says Who will give me a fixed day
Job  Though I was in the right he would say that I was in the wrong I have done no evil but he says that I am a sinner
Job  I have done no wrong I give no thought to what becomes of me I have no desire for life
Job  It is all the same to me so I say He puts an end to the sinner and to him who has done no wrong together
Job  If death comes suddenly through disease he makes sport of the fate of those who have done no wrong
Job  The land is given into the power of the evildoer the faces of its judges are covered if not by him then who has done it
Job  My days go quicker than a postrunner they go in flight they see no good
Job  They go rushing on like reedboats like an eagle dropping suddenly on its food
Job  If I say I will put my grief out of mind I will let my face be sad no longer and I will be bright
Job  I go in fear of all my pains I am certain that I will not be free from sin in your eyes
Job  You will not let me be clear of sin why then do I take trouble for nothing
Job  If I am washed with snow water and make my hands clean with soap
Job  Then you will have me pushed into the dust so that I will seem disgusting to my very clothing
Job  For he is not a man as I am that I might give him an answer that we might come together before a judge
Job  There is no one to give a decision between us who might have control over us
Job  Let him take away his rod from me and not send his fear on me
Job  Then I would say what is in my mind without fear of him for there is no cause of fear in myself
Job  My soul is tired of life I will let my sad thoughts go free in words my soul will make a bitter outcry
Job  I will say to God Do not put me down as a sinner make clear to me what you have against me
Job  What profit is it to you to be cruel to give up the work of your hands looking kindly on the design of evildoers
Job  Have you eyes of flesh or do you see as man sees
Job  Are your days as the days of man or your years like his
Job  That you take note of my sin searching after my wrongdoing
Job  Though you see that I am not an evildoer and there is no one who is able to take a man out of your hands
Job  Your hands made me and I was formed by you but then changing your purpose you gave me up to destruction
Job  O keep in mind that you made me out of earth and will you send me back again to dust
Job  Was I not drained out like milk becoming hard like cheese
Job  By you I was clothed with skin and flesh and joined together with bones and muscles
Job  You have been kind to me and your grace has been with me and your care has kept my spirit safe
Job  But you kept these things in the secret of your heart I am certain this was in your thoughts
Job  That if I did wrong you would take note of it and would not make me clear from sin
Job  That if I was an evildoer the curse would come on me and if I was upright my head would not be lifted up being full of shame and overcome with trouble
Job  And that if there was cause for pride you would go after me like a lion and again put out your wonders against me
Job  That you would send new witnesses against me increasing your wrath against me and letting loose new armies on me
Job  Why then did you make me come out of my mothers body It would have been better for me to have taken my last breath and for no eye to have seen me
Job  And for me to have been as if I had not been to have been taken from my mothers body straight to my last restingplace
Job  Are not the days of my life small in number Let your eyes be turned away from me so that I may have a little pleasure
Job  Before I go to the place from which I will not come back to the land where all is dark and black
Job  A land of thick dark without order where the very light is dark
Job  Then Zophar the Naamathite made answer and said
Job  Are all these words to go unanswered and is a man seen to be right because he is full of talk
Job  Are your words of pride to make men keep quiet and are you to make sport with no one to put you to shame
Job  You may say My way is clean and I am free from sin in your eyes
Job  But if only God would take up the word opening his lips in argument with you
Job  And would make clear to you the secrets of wisdom and the wonders of his purpose
Job  Are you able to take Gods measure to make discovery of the limits of the Ruler of all
Job  They are higher than heaven what is there for you to do deeper than the underworld and outside your knowledge
Job  Longer in measure than the earth and wider than the sea
Job  If he goes on his way shutting a man up and putting him to death who may make him go back from his purpose
Job  For in his eyes men are as nothing he sees evil and takes note of it
Job  And so a hollowminded man will get wisdom when a young ass of the field gets teaching
Job  But if you put your heart right stretching out your hands to him
Job  If you put far away the evil of your hands and let no wrongdoing have a place in your tent
Job  Then truly your face will be lifted up with no mark of sin and you will be fixed in your place without fear
Job  For your sorrow will go from your memory like waters flowing away
Job  And your life will be brighter than day though it is dark it will become like the morning
Job  And you will be safe because there is hope after looking round you will take your rest in quiet
Job  Sleeping with no fear of danger and men will be desiring to have grace in your eyes
Job  But the eyes of the evildoers will be wasting away their way of flight is gone and their only hope is the taking of their last breath
Job  And Job made answer and said
Job  No doubt you have knowledge and wisdom will come to an end with you
Job  But I have a mind as well as you I am equal to you yes who has not knowledge of such things as these
Job  It seems that I am to be as one who is a cause of laughing to his neighbour one who makes his prayer to God and is answered the upright man who has done no wrong is to be made sport of
Job  In the thought of him who is in comfort there is no respect for one who is in trouble such is the fate of those whose feet are slipping
Job  There is wealth in the tents of those who make destruction and those by whom God is moved to wrath are safe even those whose god is their strength
Job  But put now a question to the beasts and get teaching from them or to the birds of the heaven and they will make it clear to you
Job  Or to the things which go flat on the earth and they will give you wisdom and the fishes of the sea will give you news of it
Job  Who does not see by all these that the hand of the Lord has done this
Job  In whose hand is the soul of every living thing and the breath of all flesh of man
Job  Are not words tested by the ear even as food is tasted by the mouth
Job  Old men have wisdom and a long life gives knowledge
Job  With him there is wisdom and strength power and knowledge are his
Job  Truly there is no building up of what is pulled down by him when a man is shut up by him no one may let him loose
Job  Truly he keeps back the waters and they are dry he sends them out and the earth is overturned
Job  With him are strength and wise designs he who is guided into error together with his guide are in his hands
Job  He takes away the wisdom of the wise guides and makes judges foolish
Job  He undoes the chains of kings and puts his band on them
Job  He makes priests prisoners overturning those in safe positions
Job  He makes the words of responsible persons without effect and takes away the good sense of the old
Job  He puts shame on chiefs and takes away the power of the strong
Job  Uncovering deep things out of the dark and making the deep shade bright
Job  Increasing nations and sending destruction on them making wide the lands of peoples and then giving them up
Job  He takes away the wisdom of the rulers of the earth and sends them wandering in a waste where there is no way
Job  They go feeling about in the dark without light wandering without help like those overcome with wine
Job  Truly my eye has seen all this word of it has come to my ear and I have knowledge of it
Job  The same things are in my mind as in yours I am equal to you
Job  But I would have talk with the Ruler of all and my desire is to have an argument with God
Job  But you put a false face on things all your attempts to put things right are of no value
Job  If only you would keep quiet it would be a sign of wisdom
Job  Give ear to the argument of my mouth and take note of the words of my lips
Job  Will you say in Gods name what is not right and put false words into his mouth
Job  Will you have respect for Gods person in this cause and put yourselves forward as his supporters
Job  Will it be good for you to be searched out by him or have you the thought that he may be guided into error like a man
Job  He will certainly put you right if you have respect for persons in secret
Job  Will not his glory put you in fear so that your hearts will be overcome before him
Job  Your wise sayings are only dust and your strong places are only earth
Job  Keep quiet and let me say what is in my mind whatever may come to me
Job  I will take my flesh in my teeth and put my life in my hand
Job  Truly he will put an end to me I have no hope but I will not give way in argument before him
Job  And that will be my salvation for an evildoer would not come before him
Job  Give ear with care to my words and keep what I say in your minds
Job  See now I have put my cause in order and I am certain that I will be seen to be right
Job  Is any one able to take up the argument against me If so I would keep quiet and give up my breath
Job  Only two things do not do to me then I will come before your face
Job  Take your hand far away from me and let me not be overcome by fear of you
Job  Then at the sound of your voice I will give answer or let me put forward my cause for you to give me an answer
Job  What is the number of my evildoings and my sins give me knowledge of them
Job  Why is your face veiled from me as if I was numbered among your haters
Job  Will you be hard on a leaf in flight before the wind will you make a dry stem go more quickly on its way
Job  For you put bitter things on record against me and send punishment on me for the sins of my early years
Job  And you put chains on my feet watching all my ways and making a limit for my steps
Job  Though a man comes to nothing like a bit of dead wood or like a robe which has become food for the worm
Job  As for man the son of woman his days are short and full of trouble
Job  He comes out like a flower and is cut down he goes in flight like a shade and is never seen again
Job  Is it on such a one as this that your eyes are fixed with the purpose of judging him
Job  If only a clean thing might come out of an unclean But it is not possible
Job  If his days are ordered and you have knowledge of the number of his months having given him a fixed limit past which he may not go
Job  Let your eyes be turned away from him and take your hand from him so that he may have pleasure at the end of his day like a servant working for payment
Job  For there is hope of a tree if it is cut down it will come to life again and its branches will not come to an end
Job  Though its root may be old in the earth and its cutoff end may be dead in the dust
Job  Still at the smell of water it will make buds and put out branches like a young plant
Job  But man comes to his death and is gone he gives up his spirit and where is he
Job  The waters go from a pool and a river becomes waste and dry
Job  So man goes down to his last restingplace and comes not again till the heavens come to an end they will not be awake or come out of their sleep
Job  If only you would keep me safe in the underworld putting me in a secret place till your wrath is past giving me a fixed time when I might come to your memory again
Job  If death takes a man will he come to life again All the days of my trouble I would be waiting till the time came for me to be free
Job  At the sound of your voice I would give an answer and you would have a desire for the work of your hands
Job  For now my steps are numbered by you and my sin is not overlooked
Job  My wrongdoing is corded up in a bag and my sin is shut up safe
Job  But truly a mountain falling comes to dust and a rock is moved from its place
Job  The stones are crushed small by the force of the waters the dust of the earth is washed away by their overflowing and so you put an end to the hope of man
Job  You overcome him for ever and he is gone his face is changed in death and you send him away
Job  His sons come to honour and he has no knowledge of it they are made low but he is not conscious of it
Job  Only his flesh still has pain and his soul is sad
Job  And Eliphaz the Temanite made answer and said
Job  Will a wise man make answer with knowledge of no value or will he give birth to the east wind
Job  Will he make arguments with words in which is no profit and with sayings which have no value
Job  Truly you make the fear of God without effect so that the time of quiet worship before God is made less by your outcry
Job  For your mouth is guided by your sin and you have taken the tongue of the false for yourself
Job  It is by your mouth even yours that you are judged to be in the wrong and not by me and your lips give witness against you
Job  Were you the first man to come into the world or did you come into being before the hills
Job  Were you present at the secret meeting of God and have you taken all wisdom for yourself
Job  What knowledge have you which we have not is there anything in your mind which is not in ours
Job  With us are men who are greyhaired and full of years much older than your father
Job  Are the comforts of God not enough for you and the gentle word which was said to you
Job  Why is your heart uncontrolled and why are your eyes lifted up
Job  So that you are turning your spirit against God and letting such words go out of your mouth
Job  What is man that he may be clean and how may the son of woman be upright
Job  Truly he puts no faith in his holy ones and the heavens are not clean in his eyes
Job  How much less one who is disgusting and unclean a man who takes in evil like water
Job  Take note and give ear to my words and I will say what I have seen
Job  The things which wise men have got from their fathers and have not kept secret from us
Job  For only to them was the land given and no strange people were among them
Job  The evil man is in pain all his days and the number of the years stored up for the cruel is small
Job  A sound of fear is in his ears in time of peace destruction will come on him
Job  He has no hope of coming safe out of the dark and his fate will be the sword
Job  He is wandering about in search of bread saying Where is it and he is certain that the day of trouble is ready for him
Job  He is greatly in fear of the dark day trouble and pain overcome him
Job  Because his hand is stretched out against God and his heart is lifted up against the Ruler of all
Job  Running against him like a man of war covered by his thick breastplate even like a king ready for the fight
Job  Because his face is covered with fat and his body has become thick
Job  And he has made his restingplace in the towns which have been pulled down in houses where no man had a right to be whose fate was to become masses of broken walls
Job  He does not get wealth for himself and is unable to keep what he has got the heads of his grain are not bent down to the earth
Job  He does not come out of the dark his branches are burned by the flame and the wind takes away his bud
Job  Let him not put his hope in what is false falling into error for he will get deceit as his reward
Job  His branch is cut off before its time and his leaf is no longer green
Job  He is like a vine whose grapes do not come to full growth or an olivetree dropping its flowers
Job  For the band of the evildoers gives no fruit and the tents of those who give wrong decisions for reward are burned with fire
Job  Evil has made them with child and they give birth to trouble and the fruit of their body is shame for themselves
Job  And Job made answer and said
Job  Such things have frequently come to my ears you are comforters who only give trouble
Job  May words which are like the wind be stopped or what is troubling you to make answer to them
Job  It would not be hard for me to say such things if your souls were in my souls place joining words together against you and shaking my head at you
Job  I might give you strength with my mouth and not keep back the comfort of my lips
Job  If I say what is in my mind my pain becomes no less and if I keep quiet how much of it goes from me
Job  But now he has overcome me with weariness and fear and I am in the grip of all my trouble
Job  It has come up as a witness against me and the wasting of my flesh makes answer to my face
Job  I am broken by his wrath and his hate has gone after me he has made his teeth sharp against me my haters are looking on me with cruel eyes
Job  Their mouths are open wide against me the blows of his bitter words are falling on my face all of them come together in a mass against me
Job  God gives me over to the power of sinners sending me violently into the hands of evildoers
Job  I was in comfort but I have been broken up by his hands he has taken me by the neck shaking me to bits he has put me up as a mark for his arrows
Job  His bowmen come round about me their arrows go through my body without mercy my life is drained out on the earth
Job  I am broken with wound after wound he comes rushing on me like a man of war
Job  I have made haircloth the clothing of my skin and my horn is rolled in the dust
Job  My face is red with weeping and my eyes are becoming dark
Job  Though my hands have done no violent acts and my prayer is clean
Job  O earth let not my blood be covered and let my cry have no restingplace
Job  Even now my witness is in heaven and the supporter of my cause is on high
Job  My friends make sport of me to God my eyes are weeping
Job  So that he may give decision for a man in his cause with God and between a son of man and his neighbour
Job  For in a short time I will take the journey from which I will not come back
Job  My spirit is broken my days are ended the last restingplace is ready for me
Job  Truly those who make sport of me are round about me and my eyes become dark because of their bitter laughing
Job  Be pleased now to be responsible for me to yourself for there is no other who will put his hand in mine
Job  You have kept their hearts from wisdom for this cause you will not give them honour
Job  As for him who is false to his friend for a reward light will be cut off from the eyes of his children
Job  He has made me a word of shame to the peoples I have become a mark for their sport
Job  My eyes have become dark because of my pain and all my body is wasted to a shade
Job  The upright are surprised at this and he who has done no wrong is troubled because of the evildoers
Job  Still the upright keeps on his way and he who has clean hands gets new strength
Job  But come back now all of you come and I will not see a wise man among you
Job  My days are past my purposes are broken off even the desires of my heart
Job  They are changing night into day they say The light is near the dark
Job  If I am waiting for the underworld as my house if I have made my bed in the dark
Job  If I say to the earth You are my father and to the worm My mother and my sister
Job  Where then is my hope and who will see my desire
Job  Will they go down with me into the underworld Will we go down together into the dust
Job  Then Bildad the Shuhite made answer and said
Job  How long will it be before you have done talking Get wisdom and then we will say what is in our minds
Job  Why do we seem as beasts in your eyes and as completely without knowledge
Job  But come back now come you who are wounding yourself in your passion will the earth be given up because of you or a rock be moved out of its place
Job  For the light of the sinner is put out and the flame of his fire is not shining
Job  The light is dark in his tent and the light shining over him is put out
Job  The steps of his strength become short and by his design destruction overtakes him
Job  His feet take him into the net and he goes walking into the cords
Job  His foot is taken in the net he comes into its grip
Job  The twisted cord is put secretly in the earth to take him and the cord is placed in his way
Job  He is overcome by fears on every side they go after him at every step
Job  His strength is made feeble for need of food and destruction is waiting for his falling footstep
Job  His skin is wasted by disease and his body is food for the worst of diseases
Job  He is pulled out of his tent where he was safe and he is taken away to the king of fears
Job  In his tent will be seen that which is not his burning stone is dropped on his house
Job  Under the earth his roots are dry and over it his branch is cut off
Job  His memory is gone from the earth and in the open country there is no knowledge of his name
Job  He is sent away from the light into the dark he is forced out of the world
Job  He has no offspring or family among his people and in his livingplace there is no one of his name
Job  At his fate those of the west are shocked and those of the east are overcome with fear
Job  Truly these are the houses of the sinner and this is the place of him who has no knowledge of God
Job  And Job made answer and said
Job  How long will you make my life bitter crushing me with words
Job  Ten times now you have made sport of me it gives you no sense of shame to do me wrong
Job  And truly if I have been in error the effect of my error is only on myself
Job  If you make yourselves great against me using my punishment as an argument against me
Job  Be certain that it is God who has done me wrong and has taken me in his net
Job  Truly I make an outcry against the violent man but there is no answer I give a cry for help but no one takes up my cause
Job  My way is walled up by him so that I may not go by he has made my roads dark
Job  He has put off my glory from me and taken the crown from my head
Job  I am broken down by him on every side and I am gone my hope is uprooted like a tree
Job  His wrath is burning against me and I am to him as one of his haters
Job  His armies come on together they make their road high against me and put up their tents round mine
Job  He has taken my brothers far away from me they have seen my fate and have become strange to me
Job  My relations and my near friends have given me up and those living in my house have put me out of their minds
Job  I am strange to my womenservants and seem to them as one from another country
Job  At my cry my servant gives me no answer and I have to make a prayer to him
Job  My breath is strange to my wife and I am disgusting to the offspring of my mothers body
Job  Even young children have no respect for me when I get up their backs are turned on me
Job  All the men of my circle keep away from me and those dear to me are turned against me
Job  My bones are joined to my skin and I have got away with my flesh in my teeth
Job  Have pity on me have pity on me O my friends for the hand of God is on me
Job  Why are you cruel to me like God for ever saying evil against me
Job  If only my words might be recorded if they might be put in writing in a book
Job  And with an iron pen and lead be cut into the rock for ever
Job  But I am certain that he who will take up my cause is living and that in time to come he will take his place on the dust
Job  And  without my flesh I will see God
Job  Whom I will see on my side and not as one strange to me My heart is broken with desire
Job  If you say How cruel we will be to him because the root of sin is clearly in him
Job  Be in fear of the sword for the sword is the punishment for such things so that you may be certain that there is a judge
Job  Then Zophar the Naamathite made answer and said
Job  For this cause my thoughts are troubling me and driving me on
Job  I have to give ear to arguments which put me to shame and your answers to me are wind without wisdom
Job  Have you knowledge of this from early times when man was placed on the earth
Job  That the pride of the sinner is short and the joy of the evildoer but for a minute
Job  Though he is lifted up to the heavens and his head goes up to the clouds
Job  Like the waste from his body he comes to an end for ever those who have seen him say Where is he
Job  He is gone like a dream and is not seen again he goes in flight like a vision of the night
Job  The eye which saw him sees him no longer and his place has no more knowledge of him
Job  His children are hoping that the poor will be kind to them and his hands give back his wealth
Job  His bones are full of young strength but it will go down with him into the dust
Job  Though evildoing is sweet in his mouth and he keeps it secretly under his tongue
Job  Though he takes care of it and does not let it go but keeps it still in his mouth
Job  His food becomes bitter in his stomach the poison of snakes is inside him
Job  He takes down wealth as food and sends it up again it is forced out of his stomach by God
Job  He takes the poison of snakes into his mouth the tongue of the snake is the cause of his death
Job  Let him not see the rivers of oil the streams of honey and milk
Job  He is forced to give back the fruit of his work and may not take it for food he has no joy in the profit of his trading
Job  Because he has been cruel to the poor turning away from them in their trouble because he has taken a house by force which he did not put up
Job  There is no peace for him in his wealth and no salvation for him in those things in which he took delight
Job  He had never enough for his desire for this cause his wellbeing will quickly come to an end
Job  Even when his wealth is great he is full of care for the hand of everyone who is in trouble is turned against him
Job  God gives him his desire and sends the heat of his wrath on him making it come down on him like rain
Job  He may go in flight from the iron spear but the arrow from the bow of brass will go through him
Job  He is pulling it out and it comes out of his back and its shining point comes out of his side he is overcome by fears
Job  All his wealth is stored up for the dark a fire not made by man sends destruction on him and on everything in his tent
Job  The heavens make clear his sin and the earth gives witness against him
Job  The produce of his house is taken away into another country like things given into the hands of others in the day of wrath
Job  This is the reward of the evil man and the heritage given to him by God
Job  Then Job made answer and said
Job  Give attention with care to my words and let this be your comfort
Job  Let me say what is in my mind and after that go on making sport of me
Job  As for me is my outcry against man is it then to be wondered at if my spirit is troubled
Job  Take note of me and be full of wonder put your hand on your mouth
Job  At the very thought of it my flesh is shaking with fear
Job  Why is life given to the evildoers why do they become old and strong in power
Job  Their children are ever with them and their offspring before their eyes
Job  Their houses are free from fear and the rod of God does not come on them
Job  Their ox is ready at all times to give seed their cow gives birth without dropping her young
Job  They send out their young ones like a flock and their children have pleasure in the dance
Job  They make songs to the instruments of music and are glad at the sound of the pipe
Job  Their days come to an end without trouble and suddenly they go down to the underworld
Job  Though they said to God Go away from us for we have no desire for the knowledge of your ways
Job  What is the Ruler of all that we may give him worship and what profit is it to us to make prayer to him
Job  Truly is not their wellbeing in their power The purpose of the evildoers is far from me
Job  How frequently is the light of the evildoers put out or does trouble come on them how frequently does his wrath take them with cords
Job  How frequently are they as dry stems before the wind or as grass taken away by the stormwind
Job  You say God keeps punishment stored up for his children Let him send it on the man himself so that he may have the punishment of it
Job  Let his eyes see his trouble and let him be full of the wrath of the Ruler of all
Job  For what interest has he in his house after him when the number of his months is ended
Job  Is anyone able to give teaching to God for he is the judge of those who are on high
Job  One comes to his end in complete wellbeing full of peace and quiet
Job  His buckets are full of milk and there is no loss of strength in his bones
Job  And another comes to his end with a bitter soul without ever tasting good
Job  Together they go down to the dust and are covered by the worm
Job  See I am conscious of your thoughts and of your violent purposes against me
Job  For you say Where is the house of the ruler and where is the tent of the evildoer
Job  Have you not put the question to the travellers and do you not take note of their experience
Job  How the evil man goes free in the day of trouble and has salvation in the day of wrath
Job  Who will make his way clear to his face and if he has done a thing who gives him punishment for it
Job  He is taken to his last restingplace and keeps watch over it
Job  The earth of the valley covering his bones is sweet to him and all men come after him as there were unnumbered before him
Job  Why then do you give me comfort with words in which there is no profit when you see that there is nothing in your answers but deceit
Job  Then Eliphaz the Temanite made answer and said
Job  Is it possible for a man to be of profit to God No for a mans wisdom is only of profit to himself
Job  Is it of any interest to the Ruler of all that you are upright or is it of use to him that your ways are without sin
Job  Is it because you give him honour that he is sending punishment on you and is judging you
Job  Is not your evildoing great and there is no end to your sins
Job  For you have taken your brothers goods when he was not in your debt and have taken away the clothing of those who have need of it
Job  You do not give water to the tired traveller and from him who has no food you keep back bread
Job  For it was the man with power who had the land and the man with an honoured name who was living in it
Job  You have sent widows away without hearing their cause and you have taken away the support of the child who has no father
Job  For this cause nets are round your feet and you are overcome with sudden fear
Job  Your light is made dark so that you are unable to see and you are covered by a mass of waters
Job  Is not God as high as heaven and see the stars how high they are
Job  And you say What knowledge has God is he able to give decisions through the deep dark
Job  Thick clouds are covering him so that he is unable to see and he is walking on the arch of heaven
Job  Will you keep the old way by which evil men went
Job  Who were violently taken away before their time who were overcome by the rush of waters
Job  Who said to God Go away from us and What is the Ruler of all able to do to us
Job  Though he made their houses full of good things but the purpose of the evildoers is far from me
Job  The upright saw it and were glad and those who had done no wrong made sport of them
Job  Saying Truly their substance is cut off and their wealth is food for the fire
Job  Put yourself now in a right relation with him and be at peace so will you do well in your undertakings
Job  Be pleased to take teaching from his mouth and let his words be stored up in your heart
Job  If you come back to the Ruler of all making yourself low before him if you put evil far away from your tents
Job  And put your gold in the dust even your gold of Ophir among the rocks of the valleys
Job  Then the Ruler of all will be your gold and his teaching will be your silver
Job  For then you will have delight in the Ruler of all and your face will be lifted up to God
Job  You will make your prayer to him and be answered and you will give effect to your oaths
Job  Your purposes will come about and light will be shining on your ways
Job  For God makes low those whose hearts are lifted up but he is a saviour to the poor in spirit
Job  He makes safe the man who is free from sin and if your hands are clean salvation will be yours
Job  And Job made answer and said
Job  Even today my outcry is bitter his hand is hard on my sorrow
Job  If only I had knowledge of where he might be seen so that I might come even to his seat
Job  I would put my cause in order before him and my mouth would be full of arguments
Job  I would see what his answers would be and have knowledge of what he would say to me
Job  Would he make use of his great power to overcome me No but he would give attention to me
Job  There an upright man might put his cause before him and I would be free for ever from my judge
Job  See I go forward but he is not there and back but I do not see him
Job  I am looking for him on the left hand but there is no sign of him and turning to the right I am not able to see him
Job  For he has knowledge of the way I take after I have been tested I will come out like gold
Job  My feet have gone in his steps I have kept in his way without turning to one side or to the other
Job  I have never gone against the orders of his lips the words of his mouth have been stored up in my heart
Job  But his purpose is fixed and there is no changing it and he gives effect to the desire of his soul
Job  For what has been ordered for me by him will be gone through to the end and his mind is full of such designs
Job  For this cause I am in fear before him my thoughts of him overcome me
Job  For God has made my heart feeble and my mind is troubled before the Ruler of all
Job  For I am overcome by the dark and by the black night which is covering my face
Job  Why are times not stored up by the Ruler of all and why do those who have knowledge of him not see his days
Job  The landmarks are changed by evil men they violently take away flocks together with their keepers
Job  They send away the ass of him who has no father they take the widows ox for debt
Job  The crushed are turned out of the way all the poor of the earth go into a secret place together
Job  Like asses in the waste land they go out to their work looking for food with care from the waste land they get bread for their children
Job  They get mixed grain from the field and they take away the late fruit from the vines of those who have wealth
Job  They take their rest at night without clothing and have no cover in the cold
Job  They are wet with the rain of the mountains and get into the cracks of the rock for cover
Job  The child without a father is forced from its mothers breast and they take the young children of the poor for debt
Job  Others go about without clothing and though they have no food they get in the grain from the fields
Job  Between the lines of olivetrees they make oil though they have no drink they are crushing out the grapes
Job  From the town come sounds of pain from those who are near death and the soul of the wounded is crying out for help but God does not take note of their prayer
Job  Then there are those who are haters of the light who have no knowledge of its ways and do not go in them
Job  He who is purposing death gets up before day so that he may put to death the poor and those in need
