Job  And the man whose desire is for the wife of another is waiting for the evening saying No eye will see me and he puts a cover on his face And in the night the thief goes about
Job  In the dark he makes holes in the walls of houses in the daytime they are shutting themselves up they have no knowledge of the light
Job  For the middle of the night is as morning to them they are not troubled by the fear of the dark
Job  They go quickly on the face of the waters their heritage is cursed in the earth the steps of the crusher of grapes are not turned to their vinegarden
Job  Snow waters become dry with the heat so do sinners go down into the underworld
Job  The public place of his town has no more knowledge of him and his name has gone from the memory of men he is rooted up like a dead tree
Job  He is not kind to the widow and he has no pity for her child
Job  But God by his power gives long life to the strong he gets up again though he has no hope of life
Job  He takes away his fear of danger and gives him support and his eyes are on his ways
Job  For a short time they are lifted up then they are gone they are made low they are pulled off like fruit and like the heads of grain they are cut off
Job  And if it is not so now who will make it clear that my words are false and that what I say is of no value
Job  Then Bildad the Shuhite made answer and said
Job  Rule and power are his he makes peace in his high places
Job  Is it possible for his armies to be numbered and on whom is not his light shining
Job  How then is it possible for man to be upright before God or how may he be clean who is a son of woman
Job  See even the moon is not bright and the stars are not clean in his eyes
Job  How much less man who is an insect and the son of man who is a worm
Job  Then Job made answer and said
Job  How have you given help to him who has no power how have you been the salvation of the arm which has no strength
Job  How have you given teaching to him who has no wisdom and fully made clear true knowledge
Job  To whom have your words been said and whose spirit came out from you
Job  The shades in the underworld are shaking the waters and those living in them
Job  The underworld is uncovered before him and Destruction has no veil
Job  By his hand the north is stretched out in space and the earth is hanging on nothing
Job  By him the waters are shut up in his thick clouds and the cloud does not give way under them
Job  By him the face of his high seat is veiled and his cloud stretched out over it
Job  By him a circle is marked out on the face of the waters to the limits of the light and the dark
Job  The pillars of heaven are shaking and are overcome by his sharp words
Job  By his power the sea was made quiet and by his wisdom Rahab was wounded
Job  By his wind the heavens become bright by his hand the quickly moving snake was cut through
Job  See these are only the outskirts of his ways and how small is that which comes to our ears about him But the thunder of his acts of power is outside all knowledge
Job  And Job again took up the word and said
Job  By the life of God who has taken away my right and of the Ruler of all who has made my soul bitter
Job  For all my breath is still in me and the spirit of God is my life
Job  Truly there is no deceit in my lips and my tongue does not say what is false
Job  Let it be far from me I will certainly not say that you are right I will come to death before I give up my righteousness
Job  I will keep it safe and will not let it go my heart has nothing to say against any part of my life
Job  Let my hater be like the evil man and let him who comes against me be as the sinner
Job  For what is the hope of the sinner when he is cut off when God takes back his soul
Job  Will his cry come to the ears of God when he is in trouble
Job  Will he take delight in the Ruler of all and make his prayer to God at all times
Job  I will give you teaching about the hand of God I will not keep secret from you what is in the mind of the Ruler of all
Job  Truly you have all seen it yourselves why then have you become completely foolish
Job  This is the punishment of the evildoer from God and the heritage given to the cruel by the Ruler of all
Job  If his children are increased it is for the sword and his offspring have not enough bread
Job  When those of his house who are still living come to their end by disease they are not put into the earth and their widows are not weeping for them
Job  Though he may get silver together like dust and make ready great stores of clothing
Job  He may get them ready but the upright will put them on and he who is free from sin will take the silver for a heritage
Job  His house has no more strength than a spiders thread or a watchmans tent
Job  He goes to rest full of wealth but does so for the last time on opening his eyes he sees it there no longer
Job  Fears overtake him like rushing waters in the night the stormwind takes him away
Job  The east wind takes him up and he is gone he is forced violently out of his place
Job  God sends his arrows against him without mercy he goes in flight before his hand
Job  Men make signs of joy because of him driving him from his place with sounds of hissing
Job  Truly there is a mine for silver and a place where gold is washed out
Job  Iron is taken out of the earth and stone is changed into brass by the fire
Job  Man puts an end to the dark searching out to the farthest limit the stones of the deep places of the dark
Job  He makes a deep mine far away from those living in the light of day when they go about on the earth they have no knowledge of those who are under them who are hanging far from men twisting from side to side on a cord
Job  As for the earth bread comes out of it but under its face it is turned up as if by fire
Job  Its stones are the place of sapphires and it has dust of gold
Job  No bird has knowledge of it and the hawks eye has never seen it
Job  The great beasts have not gone over it and the cruel lion has not taken that way
Job  Man puts out his hand on the hard rock overturning mountains by the roots
Job  He makes deep ways cut through the rock and his eye sees everything of value
Job  He keeps back the streams from flowing and makes the secret things come out into the light
Job  But where may wisdom be seen and where is the restingplace of knowledge
Job  Man has not seen the way to it and it is not in the land of the living
Job  The deep waters say It is not in me and the sea says It is not with me
Job  Gold may not be given for it or a weight of silver in payment for it
Job  It may not be valued with the gold of Ophir with the onyx of great price or the sapphire
Job  Gold and glass are not equal to it in price and it may not be exchanged for jewels of the best gold
Job  There is no need to say anything about coral or crystal and the value of wisdom is greater than that of pearls
Job  The topaz of Ethiopia is not equal to it and it may not be valued with the best gold
Job  From where then does wisdom come and where is the restingplace of knowledge
Job  For it is kept secret from the eyes of all living unseen by the birds of the air
Job  Destruction and Death say We have only had word of it with our ears
Job  God has knowledge of the way to it and of its restingplace
Job  For his eyes go to the ends of the earth and he sees everything under heaven
Job  When he made a weight for the wind measuring out the waters
Job  When he made a law for the rain and a way for the thunderflames
Job  Then he saw it and put it on record he gave it its fixed form searching it out completely
Job  And he said to man Truly the fear of the Lord is wisdom and to keep from evil is the way to knowledge
Job  And Job again took up the word and said
Job  If only I might again be as I was in the months which are past in the days when God was watching over me
Job  When his light was shining over my head and when I went through the dark by his light
Job  As I was in my flowering years when my tent was covered by the hand of God
Job  While the Ruler of all was still with me and my children were round me
Job  When my steps were washed with milk and rivers of oil were flowing out of the rock for me
Job  When I went out of my door to go up to the town and took my seat in the public place
Job  The young men saw me and went away and the old men got up from their seats
Job  The rulers kept quiet and put their hands on their mouths
Job  The chiefs kept back their words and their tongues were joined to the roofs of their mouths
Job  For when it came to their ears men said that I was truly happy and when their eyes saw they gave witness to me
Job  For I was a saviour to the poor when he was crying for help to the child with no father and to him who had no supporter
Job  The blessing of him who was near to destruction came on me and I put a song of joy into the widows heart
Job  I put on righteousness as my clothing and was full of it right decisions were to me a robe and a headdress
Job  I was eyes to the blind and feet to him who had no power of walking
Job  I was a father to the poor searching out the cause of him who was strange to me
Job  By me the great teeth of the evildoer were broken and I made him give up what he had violently taken away
Job  Then I said I will come to my end with my children round me my days will be as the sand in number
Job  My root will be open to the waters and the night mist will be on my branches
Job  My glory will be ever new and my bow will be readily bent in my hand
Job  Men gave ear to me waiting and keeping quiet for my suggestions
Job  After I had said what was in my mind they were quiet and let my words go deep into their hearts
Job  They were waiting for me as for the rain opening their mouths wide as for the spring rains
Job  I was laughing at them when they had no hope and the light of my face was never clouded by their fear
Job  I took my place as a chief guiding them on their way and I was as a king among his army 
Job  But now those who are younger than I make sport of me those whose fathers I would not have put with the dogs of my flocks
Job  Of what use is the strength of their hands to me all force is gone from them
Job  They are wasted for need of food biting the dry earth their only hope of life is in the waste land
Job  They are pulling off the salt leaves from the brushwood and making a meal of roots
Job  They are sent out from among their townsmen men are crying after them as thieves
Job  They have to get a restingplace in the hollows of the valleys in holes of the earth and rocks
Job  They make noises like asses among the brushwood they get together under the thorns
Job  They are sons of shame and of men without a name who have been forced out of the land
Job  And now I have become their song and I am a word of shame to them
Job  I am disgusting to them they keep away from me and put marks of shame on me
Job  For he has made loose the cord of my bow and put me to shame he has sent down my flag to the earth before me
Job  The lines of his men of war put themselves in order and make high their ways of destruction against me
Job  They have made waste my roads with a view to my destruction his bowmen come round about me
Job  As through a wide broken place in the wall they come on I am overturned by the shock of their attack
Job  Fears have come on me my hope is gone like the wind and my wellbeing like a cloud
Job  But now my soul is turned to water in me days of trouble overtake me
Job  The flesh is gone from my bones and they give me no rest there is no end to my pains
Job  With great force he takes a grip of my clothing pulling me by the neck of my coat
Job  Truly God has made me low even to the earth and I have become like dust
Job  You give no answer to my cry and take no note of my prayer
Job  You have become cruel to me the strength of your hand is hard on me
Job  Lifting me up you make me go on the wings of the wind I am broken up by the storm
Job  For I am certain that you will send me back to death and to the meetingplace ordered for all living
Job  Has not my hand been stretched out in help to the poor have I not been a saviour to him in his trouble
Job  Have I not been weeping for the crushed and was not my soul sad for him who was in need
Job  For I was looking for good and evil came I was waiting for light and it became dark
Job  My feelings are strongly moved and give me no rest days of trouble have overtaken me
Job  I go about in dark clothing uncomforted I get up in the public place crying out for help
Job  I have become a brother to the jackals and go about in the company of ostriches
Job  My skin is black and dropping off me and my bones are burning with the heat of my disease
Job  And my music has been turned to sorrow and the sound of my pipe into the noise of weeping
Job  I made an agreement with my eyes how then might my eyes be looking on a virgin
Job  For what is Gods reward from on high or the heritage given by the Ruler of all from heaven
Job  Is it not trouble for the sinner and destruction for the evildoers
Job  Does he not see my ways and are not my steps all numbered
Job  If I have gone in false ways or my foot has been quick in working deceit
Job  Let me be measured in upright scales and let God see my righteousness
Job  If my steps have been turned out of the way or if my heart went after my eyes or if the property of another is in my hands
Job  Let me put seed in the earth for another to have the fruit of it and let my produce be uprooted
Job  If my heart went after another mans wife or if I was waiting secretly at my neighbours door
Job  Then let my wife give pleasure to another man and let others make use of her body
Job  For that would be a crime it would be an act for which punishment would be measured out by the judges
Job  It would be a fire burning even to destruction and taking away all my produce
Job  If I did wrong in the cause of my manservant or my womanservant when they went to law with me
Job  What then will I do when God comes as my judge and what answer may I give to his questions
Job  Did not God make him as well as me did he not give us life in our mothers bodies
Job  If I kept back the desire of the poor if the widows eye was looking for help to no purpose
Job  If I kept my food for myself and did not give some of it to the child with no father
Job  For I was cared for by God as by a father from my earliest days he was my guide from the body of my mother
Job  If I saw one near to death for need of clothing and that the poor had nothing covering him
Job  If his back did not give me a blessing and the wool of my sheep did not make him warm
Job  If my hand had been lifted up against him who had done no wrong when I saw that I was supported by the judges
Job  May my arm be pulled from my body and be broken from its base
Job  For the fear of God kept me back and because of his power I might not do such things
Job  If I made gold my hope or if I ever said to the best gold I have put my faith in you
Job  If I was glad because my wealth was great and because my hand had got together a great store
Job  If when I saw the sun shining and the moon moving on its bright way
Job  A secret feeling of worship came into my heart and my hand gave kisses from my mouth
Job  That would have been another sin to be rewarded with punishment by the judges for I would have been false to God on high
Job  If I was glad at the trouble of my hater and gave cries of joy when evil overtook him
Job  For I did not let my mouth give way to sin in putting a curse on his life
Job  If the men of my tent did not say Who has not had full measure of his meat
Job  The traveller did not take his nights rest in the street and my doors were open to anyone on a journey
Job  If I kept my evil doings covered and my sin in the secret of my breast
Job  For fear of the great body of people or for fear that families might make sport of me so that I kept quiet and did not go out of my door
Job  If only God would give ear to me and the Ruler of all would give me an answer or if what he has against me had been put in writing
Job  Truly I would take up the book in my hands it would be to me as a crown
Job  I would make clear the number of my steps I would put it before him like a prince The words of Job are ended
Job  If my land has made an outcry against me or the ploughed earth has been in sorrow
Job  If I have taken its produce without payment causing the death of its owners
Job  Then in place of grain let thorns come up and in place of barley evilsmelling plants
Job  So these three men gave no more answers to Job because he seemed to himself to be right
Job  And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite of the family of Ram was angry burning with wrath against Job because he seemed to himself more right than God
Job  And he was angry with his three friends because they had been unable to give him an answer and had not made Jobs sin clear
Job  Now Elihu had kept quiet while Job was talking because they were older than he
Job  And when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of the three men he was very angry
Job  And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite made answer and said I am young and you are very old so I was in fear and kept myself from putting my knowledge before you
Job  I said to myself It is right for the old to say what is in their minds and for those who are far on in years to give out wisdom
Job  But truly it is the spirit in man even the breath of the Ruler of all which gives them knowledge
Job  It is not the old who are wise and those who are full of years have not the knowledge of what is right
Job  So I say Give ear to me and I will put forward my knowledge
Job  I was waiting for your words I was giving ear to your wise sayings while you were searching out what to say
Job  I was taking note and truly not one of you was able to make clear Jobs error or to give an answer to his words
Job  Take care that you do not say Wisdom is here God may overcome him but not man
Job  I will not put forward words like these or make use of your sayings in answer to him
Job  Fear has overcome them they have no more answers to give they have come to an end of words
Job  And am I to go on waiting while they have nothing to say while they keep quiet and give no more answers
Job  I will give my answer I will put forward my knowledge
Job  For I am full of words I am unable to keep in my breath any longer
Job  My stomach is like wine which is unable to get out like skins full of new wine it is almost burst
Job  Let me say what is in my mind so that I may get comfort let me give answer with open mouth
Job  Let me not give respect to any man or give names of honour to any living
Job  For I am not able to give names of honour to any man and if I did my Maker would quickly take me away
Job  And now O Job give ear to my words and take note of all I say
Job  See now my mouth is open my tongue gives out words
Job  My heart is overflowing with knowledge my lips say what is true
Job  The spirit of God has made me and the breath of the Ruler of all gives me life
Job  If you are able give me an answer put your cause in order and come forward
Job  See I am the same as you are in the eyes of God I was cut off from the same bit of wet earth
Job  Fear of me will not overcome you and my hand will not be hard on you
Job  But you said in my hearing and your voice came to my ears
Job  I am clean without sin I am washed and there is no evil in me
Job  See he is looking for something against me in his eyes I am as one of his haters
Job  He puts chains on my feet he is watching all my ways
Job  Truly in saying this you are wrong for God is greater than man
Job  Why do you put forward your cause against him saying He gives no answer to any of my words
Job  For God gives his word in one way even in two and man is not conscious of it
Job  In a dream in a vision of the night when deep sleep comes on men while they take their rest on their beds
Job  Then he makes his secrets clear to men so that they are full of fear at what they see
Job  In order that man may be turned from his evil works and that pride may be taken away from him
Job  To keep back his soul from the underworld and his life from destruction
Job  Pain is sent on him as a punishment while he is on his bed there is no end to the trouble in his bones
Job  He has no desire for food and his soul is turned away from delicate meat
Job  His flesh is so wasted away that it may not be seen and his bones 
Job  And his soul comes near to the underworld and his life to the angels of death
Job  If now there may be an angel sent to him one of the thousands which there are to be between him and God and to make clear to man what is right for him
Job  And if he has mercy on him and says Let him not go down to the underworld I have given the price for his life
Job  Then his flesh becomes young again and he comes back to the days of his early strength
Job  He makes his prayer to God and he has mercy on him he sees Gods face with cries of joy he gives news of his righteousness to men
Job  He makes a song saying I did wrong turning from the straight way but he did not give me the reward of my sin
Job  He kept my soul from the underworld and my life sees the light in full measure
Job  Truly God does all these things to man twice and three times
Job  Keeping back his soul from the underworld so that he may see the light of life
Job  Take note O Job give ear to me keep quiet while I say what is in my mind
Job  If you have anything to say give me an answer for it is my desire that you may be judged free from sin
Job  If not give attention to me and keep quiet and I will give you wisdom
Job  And Elihu made answer and said
Job  Give ear you wise to my words and you who have knowledge give attention to me
Job  For words are tested by the ear as food is tasted by the mouth
Job  Let us make the decision for ourselves as to what is right let us have the knowledge among ourselves of what is good
Job  For Job has said I am upright and it is God who has taken away my right
Job  Though I am right still I am in pain my wound may not be made well though I have done no wrong
Job  What man is like Job a man who freely makes sport of God
Job  And goes in the company of evildoers walking in the way of sinners
Job  For he has said It is no profit to a man to take delight in God
Job  Now then you wise take note you men of knowledge give ear to me Let it be far from God to do evil and from the Ruler of all to do wrong
Job  For he gives to every man the reward of his work and sees that he gets the fruit of his ways
Job  Truly God does not do evil and the Ruler of all is not a false judge
Job  Who put the earth into his care or made him responsible for the world
Job  If he made his spirit come back to him taking his breath into himself again
Job  All flesh would come to an end together and man would go back to the dust
Job  If you are wise take note of this give ear to the voice of my words
Job  How may a hater of right be a ruler and will you say that the upright Ruler of all is evil
Job  He who says to a king You are an evildoer and to rulers You are sinners
Job  Who has no respect for rulers and who gives no more attention to those who have wealth than to the poor for they are all the work of his hands
Job  Suddenly they come to an end even in the middle of the night the blow comes on the men of wealth and they are gone and the strong are taken away without the hand of man
Job  For his eyes are on the ways of a man and he sees all his steps
Job  There is no dark place and no thick cloud in which the workers of evil may take cover
Job  For he does not give man a fixed time to come before him to be judged
Job  He sends the strong to destruction without searching out their cause and puts others in their place
Job  For he has knowledge of their works overturning them in the night so that they are crushed
Job  The evildoers are broken by his wrath he puts his hand on them with force before the eyes of all onlookers
Job  Because they did not go after him and took no note of his ways
Job  So that the cry of the poor might come up to him and the prayer of those in need come to his ears

Job  Men of knowledge and all wise men hearing me will say
Job  Jobs words do not come from knowledge they are not the fruit of wisdom
Job  May Job be tested to the end because his answers have been like those of evil men
Job  For in addition to his sin he is uncontrolled in heart before our eyes he makes sport of God increasing his words against him
Job  And Elihu made answer and said
Job  Does it seem to you to be right and righteousness before God to say
Job  What profit is it to me and how am I better off than if I had done wrong
Job  I will make answer to you and to your friends
Job  Let your eyes be turned to the heavens and lifted up to see the skies they are higher than you
Job  If you have done wrong is he any the worse for it and if your sins are great in number what is it to him
Job  If you are upright what do you give to him or what does he take from your hand
Job  Your evildoing may have an effect on a man like yourself or your righteousness on a son of man
Job  Because the hand of the cruel is hard on them men are making sounds of grief they are crying out for help because of the arm of the strong
Job  But no one has said Where is God my Maker who gives songs in the night
Job  Who gives us more knowledge than the beasts of the earth and makes us wiser than the birds of the heaven
Job  There they are crying out because of the pride of the evildoers but he gives them no answer
Job  But God will not give ear to what is false or the Ruler of all take note of it
Job  How much less when you say that you do not see him that the cause is before him and you are waiting for him
Job  And now  
Job  And Jobs mouth is open wide to give out what is of no profit increasing words without knowledge
Job  And Elihu went on to say
Job  Give me a little more time and I will make it clear to you for I have still something to say for God
Job  I will get my knowledge from far and I will give righteousness to my Maker
Job  For truly my words are not false one who has all knowledge is talking with you
Job  Truly God gives up the hardhearted and will not give life to the sinner
Job  His eyes are ever on the upright and he gives to the crushed their right
Job  Lifting them up to the seat of kings and making them safe for ever
Job  And if they have been prisoned in chains and taken in cords of trouble
Job  Then he makes clear to them what they have done even their evil works in which they have taken pride
Job  Their ear is open to his teaching and he gives them orders so that their hearts may be turned from evil
Job  If they give ear to his voice and do his word then he gives them long life and years full of pleasure
Job  But if not they come to their end and give up their breath without knowledge
Job  Those who have no fear of God keep wrath stored up in their hearts they give no cry for help when they are made prisoners
Job  They come to their end while they are still young their life is short like that of those who are used for sex purposes in the worship of their gods
Job  He makes the wrong done to the poor the way of their salvation opening their ears by their trouble

Job  Take care not to be turned to sin for you have taken evil for your part in place of sorrow
Job  Truly God is lifted up in strength who is a ruler like him
Job  Who ever gave orders to him or said to him You have done wrong
Job  See that you give praise to his work about which men make songs
Job  All people are looking on it man sees it from far
Job  Truly God is great greater than all our knowledge the number of his years may not be searched out
Job  For he takes up the drops from the sea he sends them through his mist as rain
Job  Flowing down from the sky and dropping on the peoples
Job  And who has knowledge of how the clouds are stretched out or of the thunders of his tent
Job  See he is stretching out his mist covering the tops of the mountains with it
Job  For by these he gives food to the peoples and bread in full measure
Job  He takes the light in his hands sending it against the mark
Job  The thunder makes clear his passion and the storm gives news of his wrath
Job  At this my heart is shaking it is moved out of its place
Job  Give ear to the rolling noise of his voice to the hollow sound which goes out of his mouth
Job  He sends it out through all the heaven and his thunderflame to the ends of the earth
Job  After it a voice is sounding thundering out the word of his power he does not keep back his thunderflames from his mouth his voice is sounding
Job  He does wonders more than may be searched out great things of which we have no knowledge
Job  For he says to the snow Make the earth wet and to the rainstorm Come down
Job  He puts an end to the work of every man so that all may see his work
Job  Then the beasts go into their holes and take their rest
Job  Out of its place comes the stormwind and the cold out of its storehouses
Job  By the breath of God ice is made and the wide waters are shut in
Job  The thick cloud is weighted with thunderflame and the cloud sends out its light
Job  And it goes this way and that round about turning itself by his guiding to do whatever he gives orders to be done on the face of his world of men
Job  For a rod or for a curse or for mercy causing it to come on the mark
Job  Give ear to this O Job and keep quiet in your place and take note of the wonders worked by God
Job  Have you knowledge of Gods ordering of his works how he makes the light of his cloud to be seen
Job  Have you knowledge of the balancings of the clouds the wonders of him who has all wisdom
Job  You whose clothing is warm when the earth is quiet because of the south wind
Job  Will you with him make the skies smooth and strong as a polished lookingglass
Job  Make clear to me what we are to say to him we are unable to put our cause before him because of the dark
Job  How may he have knowledge of my desire for talk with him or did any man ever say May destruction come on me
Job  And now the light is not seen for it is dark because of the clouds but a wind comes clearing them away
Job  A bright light comes out of the north Gods glory is greatly to be feared
Job  There is no searching out of the Ruler of all his strength and his judging are great he is full of righteousness doing no wrong
Job  For this cause men go in fear of him he has no respect for any who are wise in heart
Job  And the Lord made answer to Job out of the stormwind and said
Job  Who is this who makes the purpose of God dark by words without knowledge
Job  Get your strength together like a man of war I will put questions to you and you will give me the answers
Job  Where were you when I put the earth on its base Say if you have knowledge
Job  By whom were its measures fixed Say if you have wisdom or by whom was the line stretched out over it
Job  On what were its pillars based or who put down its anglestone
Job  When the morning stars made songs together and all the sons of the gods gave cries of joy
Job  Or where were you when the sea came to birth pushing out from its secret place
Job  When I made the cloud its robe and put thick clouds as bands round it
Job  Ordering a fixed limit for it with locks and doors
Job  And said So far you may come and no farther and here the pride of your waves will be stopped
Job  Have you from your earliest days given orders to the morning or made the dawn conscious of its place
Job  So that it might take a grip of the skirts of the earth shaking all the evildoers out of it
Job  It is changed like wet earth under a stamp and is coloured like a robe
Job  And from the evildoers their light is kept back and the arm of pride is broken
Job  Have you come into the springs of the sea walking in the secret places of the deep
Job  Have the doors of death been open to you or have the doorkeepers of the dark ever seen you
Job  Have you taken note of the wide limits of the earth Say if you have knowledge of it all
Job  Which is the way to the restingplace of the light and where is the storehouse of the dark
Job  So that you might take it to its limit guiding it to its house
Job  No doubt you have knowledge of it for then you had come to birth and the number of your days is great
Job  Have you come into the secret place of snow or have you seen the storehouses of the icedrops
Job  Which I have kept for the time of trouble for the day of war and fighting
Job  Which is the way to the place where the wind is measured out and the east wind sent out over the earth
Job  By whom has the way been cut for the flowing of the rain and the flaming of the thunder
Job  Causing rain to come on a land where no man is living on the waste land which has no people
Job  To give water to the land where there is waste and destruction and to make the dry land green with young grass
Job  Has the rain a father or who gave birth to the drops of night mist
Job  Out of whose body came the ice and who gave birth to the cold mist of heaven
Job  The waters are joined together hard as a stone and the face of the deep is covered
Job  Are the bands of the Pleiades fixed by you or are the cords of Orion made loose
Job  Do you make Mazzaroth come out in its right time or are the Bear and its children guided by you
Job  Have you knowledge of the laws of the heavens did you give them rule over the earth
Job  Is your voice sent up to the cloud so that you may be covered by the weight of waters
Job  Do you send out the thunderflames so that they may go and say to you Here we are
Job  Who has put wisdom in the high clouds or given knowledge to the lights of the north
Job  By whose wisdom are the clouds numbered or the waterskins of the heavens turned to the earth
Job  When the earth becomes hard as metal and is joined together in masses
Job  Do you go after food for the shelion or get meat so that the young lions may have enough
Job  When they are stretched out in their holes and are waiting in the brushwood
Job  Who gives in the evening the meat he is searching for when his young ones are crying to God when the young lions with loud noise go wandering after their food
Job  Have you knowledge of the rockgoats or do you see the roes giving birth to their young
Job  Is the number of their months fixed by you or is the time when they give birth ordered by you
Job  They are bent down they give birth to their young they let loose the fruit of their body
Job  Their young ones are strong living in the open country they go out and do not come back again
Job  Who has let the ass of the fields go free or made loose the bands of the loudvoiced beast
Job  To whom I have given the waste land for a heritage and the salt land as a livingplace
Job  He makes sport of the noise of the town the voice of the driver does not come to his ears
Job  He goes looking for his grasslands in the mountains searching out every green thing
Job  Will the ox of the mountains be your servant or is his nights restingplace by your foodstore
Job  Will he be pulling your plough with cords turning up the valleys after you
Job  Will you put your faith in him because his strength is great will you give the fruit of your work into his care
Job  Will you be looking for him to come back and get in your seed to the crushingfloor
Job  Is the wing of the ostrich feeble or is it because she has no feathers
Job  That she puts her eggs on the earth warming them in the dust
Job  Without a thought that they may be crushed by the foot and broken by the beasts of the field
Job  She is cruel to her young ones as if they were not hers her work is to no purpose she has no fear
Job  For God has taken wisdom from her mind and given her no measure of knowledge
Job  When she is shaking her wings on high she makes sport of the horse and of him who is seated on him
Job  Do you give strength to the horse is it by your hand that his neck is clothed with power
Job  Is it through you that he is shaking like a locust in the pride of his loudsounding breath
Job  He is stamping with joy in the valley he makes sport of fear
Job  In his strength he goes out against the arms of war turning not away from the sword
Job  The bow is sounding against him he sees the shining point of spear and arrow
Job  Shaking with passion he is biting the earth he is not able to keep quiet at the sound of the horn
Job  When it comes to his ears he says Aha He is smelling the fight from far off and hearing the thunder of the captains and the warcries
Job  Is it through your knowledge that the hawk takes his flight stretching out his wings to the south
Job  Or is it by your orders that the eagle goes up and makes his restingplace on high
Job  On the rock is his house and on the mountaintop his strong place
Job  From there he is watching for food his eye sees it far off
Job  His young have blood for their drink and where the dead bodies are there is he to be seen

Job  Will he who is protesting give teaching to the Ruler of all Let him who has arguments to put forward against God give an answer
Job  And Job said in answer to the Lord
Job  Truly I am of no value what answer may I give to you I will put my hand on my mouth
Job  I have said once and even twice what was in my mind but I will not do so again
Job  Then the Lord made answer to Job out of the stormwind and said
Job  Get your strength together like a man of war I will put questions to you and you will give me the answers
Job  Will you even make my right of no value will you say that I am wrong in order to make clear that you are right

Job  Then I will give praise to you saying that your right hand is able to give you salvation
Job  See now the Great Beast whom I made even as I made you he takes grass for food like the ox
Job  His strength is in his body and his force in the muscles of his stomach
Job  His tail is curving like a cedar the muscles of his legs are joined together
Job  His bones are pipes of brass his legs are like rods of iron
Job  He is the chief of the ways of God made by him for his pleasure
Job  He takes the produce of the mountains where all the beasts of the field are at play
Job  He takes his rest under the trees of the river and in the pool under the shade of the waterplants
Job  He is covered by the branches of the trees the grasses of the stream are round him
Job  Truly if the river is overflowing it gives him no cause for fear he has no sense of danger even if Jordan is rushing against his mouth
Job  Will anyone take him when he is on the watch or put metal teeth through his nose
Job  Is it possible for Leviathan to be pulled out with a fishhook or for a hook to be put through the bone of his mouth
Job  Will you put a cord into his nose or take him away with a cord round his tongue
Job  Will he make prayers to you or say soft words to you
Job  Will he make an agreement with you so that you may take him as a servant for ever
Job  Will you make sport with him as with a bird or put him in chains for your young women
Job  Will the fishermen make profit out of him will they have him cut up for the traders
Job  Will you put sharppointed irons into his skin or fishspears into his head
Job  Only put your hand on him and see what a fight you will have you will not do it again
Job  Truly the hope of his attacker is false he is overcome even on seeing him
Job  He is so cruel that no one is ready to go against him Who then is able to keep his place before me
Job  Who ever went against me and got the better of me There is no one under heaven
Job  I will not keep quiet about the parts of his body or about his power and the strength of his frame
Job  Who has ever taken off his outer skin who may come inside his inner coat of iron
Job  Who has made open the doors of his face Fear is round about his teeth
Job  His back is made of lines of plates joined tight together one against the other like a stamp
Job  One is so near to the other that no air may come between them
Job  They take a grip of one another they are joined together so that they may not be parted
Job  His sneezings give out flames and his eyes are like the eyes of the dawn
Job  Out of his mouth go burning lights and flames of fire are jumping up
Job  Smoke comes out of his nose like a pot boiling on the fire
Job  His breath puts fire to coals and a flame goes out of his mouth
Job  Strength is in his neck and fear goes dancing before him
Job  The plates of his flesh are joined together fixed and not to be moved
Job  His heart is as strong as a stone hard as the lower crushingstone
Job  When he gets ready for the fight the strong are overcome with fear
Job  The sword may come near him but is not able to go through him the spear or the arrow or the sharppointed iron
Job  Iron is to him as dry grass and brass as soft wood
Job  The arrow is not able to put him to flight stones are no more to him than dry stems
Job  A thick stick is no better than a leaf of grass and he makes sport of the onrush of the spear
Job  Under him are sharp edges of broken pots as if he was pulling a graincrushing instrument over the wet earth
Job  The deep is boiling like a pot of spices and the sea like a perfumevessel
Job  After him his way is shining so that the deep seems white
Job  On earth there is not another like him who is made without fear
Job  Everything which is high goes in fear of him he is king over all the sons of pride
Job  And Job said in answer to the Lord
Job  I see that you are able to do every thing and to give effect to all your designs
Job  Who is this who makes dark the purpose of God by words without knowledge For I have been talking without knowledge about wonders not to be searched out
Job  Give ear to me and I will say what is in my mind I will put questions to you and you will give me the answers
Job  Word of you had come to my ears but now my eye has seen you
Job  For this cause I give witness that what I said is false and in sorrow I take my seat in the dust
Job  And it came about after he had said these words to Job that the Lord said to Eliphaz the Temanite I am very angry with you and your two friends because you have not said what is right about me as my servant Job has
Job  And now take seven oxen and seven sheep and go to my servant Job and give a burned offering for yourselves and my servant Job will make prayer for you that I may not send punishment on you because you have not said what is right about me as my servant Job has
Job  And Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went and did as the Lord had said And the Lord gave ear to Job
Job  And the Lord made up to Job for all his losses after he had made prayer for his friends and all Job had before was increased by the Lord twice as much
Job  And all his brothers and sisters and his friends of earlier days came and took food with him in his house and made clear their grief for him and gave him comfort for all the evil which the Lord had sent on him and they all gave him a bit of money and a gold ring
Job  And the Lords blessing was greater on the end of Jobs life than on its start and so he came to have fourteen thousand sheep and goats and six thousand camels and two thousand oxen and a thousand sheasses
Job  And he had seven sons and three daughters
Job  And he gave the first the name of Jemimah the second Keziah and the third Kerenhappuch
Job  And there were no women so beautiful as the daughters of Job in all the earth and their father gave them a heritage among their brothers
Job  And after this Job had a hundred and forty years of life and saw his sons and his sons sons even four generations
Job  And Job came to his end old and full of days

Psm  To his worshippers he will give their desire their cry comes to his ears and he gives them salvation
Psm  The Lord will keep all his worshippers from danger but he will send destruction on all sinners
Psm  My mouth will give praise to the Lord let all flesh be blessing his holy name for ever and ever
Psm  Let the Lord be praised Give praise to the Lord O my soul
Psm  While I have breath I will give praise to the Lord I will make melody to my God while I have my being
Psm  Put not your faith in rulers or in the son of man in whom there is no salvation
Psm  Mans breath goes out he is turned back again to dust in that day all his purposes come to an end
Psm  Happy is the man who has the God of Jacob for his help whose hope is in the Lord his God
Psm  Who made heaven and earth the sea and all things in them who keeps faith for ever
Psm  Who gives their rights to those who are crushed down and gives food to those who are in need of it the Lord makes the prisoners free
Psm  The Lord makes open the eyes of the blind the Lord is the lifter up of those who are bent down the Lord is a lover of the upright
Psm  The Lord takes care of those who are in a strange land he gives help to the widow and to the child who has no father but he sends destruction on the way of sinners
Psm  The Lord will be King for ever your God O Zion will be King through all generations Praise be to the Lord
Psm  Give praise to the Lord for it is good to make melody to our God praise is pleasing and beautiful
Psm  The Lord is building up Jerusalem he makes all the outlaws of Israel come together
Psm  He makes the brokenhearted well and puts oil on their wounds
Psm  He sees the number of the stars he gives them all their names
Psm  Great is our Lord and great his power there is no limit to his wisdom
Psm  The Lord gives help to the poor in spirit but he sends sinners down in shame
Psm  Make songs of praise to the Lord make melody to our God with instruments of music
Psm  By his hand the heaven is covered with clouds and rain is stored up for the earth he makes the grass tall on the mountains
Psm  He gives food to every beast and to the young ravens in answer to their cry
Psm  He has no delight in the strength of a horse he takes no pleasure in the legs of a man
Psm  The Lord takes pleasure in his worshippers and in those whose hope is in his mercy
Psm  Give praise to the Lord O Jerusalem give praise to your God O Zion
Psm  He has made strong the iron bands of your doors he has sent blessings on your children inside your walls
Psm  He gives peace in all your land making your stores full of fat grain
Psm  He sends out his orders to the earth his word goes out quickly
Psm  He gives snow like wool he sends out icedrops like dust
Psm  He sends down ice like raindrops water is made hard by his cold
Psm  At the outgoing of his word the ice is turned to water when he sends out his wind there is a flowing of waters
Psm  He makes his word clear to Jacob teaching Israel his laws and his decisions
Psm  He has not done these things for any other nation and as for his laws they have no knowledge of them Let the Lord be praised
Psm  Give praise to the Lord Let the Lord be praised from the heavens give him praise in the skies
Psm  Give praise to him all you his angels give praise to him all his armies
Psm  Give praise to him you sun and moon give praise to him all you stars of light
Psm  Give praise to him you highest heavens and you waters which are over the heavens
Psm  Let them give praise to the name of the Lord for he gave the order and they were made
Psm  He has put them in their places for ever he has given them their limits which may not be broken
Psm  Give praise to the Lord from the earth you great seabeasts and deep places
Psm  Fire and rain of ice snow and mists stormwind doing his word
Psm  Mountains and all hills fruittrees and all trees of the mountains
Psm  Beasts and all cattle insects and winged birds
Psm  Kings of the earth and all peoples rulers and all judges of the earth
Psm  Young men and virgins old men and children
Psm  Let them give glory to the name of the Lord for his name only is to be praised his kingdom is over the earth and the heaven
Psm  He has put on high the horn of his people for the praise of all his saints even the children of Israel a people which is near to him Let the Lord be praised
Psm  Let the Lord be praised Make a new song to the Lord let his praise be in the meeting of his saints
Psm  Let Israel have joy in his maker let the children of Zion be glad in their King
Psm  Let them give praise to his name in the dance let them make melody to him with instruments of brass and corded instruments of music
Psm  For the Lord has pleasure in his people he gives the poor in spirit a crown of salvation
Psm  Let the saints have joy and glory let them give cries of joy on their beds
Psm  Let the high praises of God be in their mouths and a twoedged sword in their hands
Psm  To give the nations the reward of their sins and the peoples their punishment
Psm  To put their kings in chains and their rulers in bands of iron
Psm  To give them the punishment which is in the holy writings this honour is given to all his saints Praise be to the Lord
Psm  Let the Lord be praised Give praise to God in his holy place give him praise in the heaven of his power
Psm  Give him praise for his acts of power give him praise in the measure of his great strength
Psm  Give him praise with the sound of the horn give him praise with corded instruments of music
Psm  Give him praise with instruments of brass and in the dance give him praise with horns and corded instruments
Psm  Give him praise with the loud brass give him praise with the highsounding brass
Psm  Let everything which has breath give praise to the Lord Let the Lord be praised
Pro  The wise sayings of Solomon the son of David king of Israel
Pro  To have knowledge of wise teaching to be clear about the words of reason
Pro  To be trained in the ways of wisdom in righteousness and judging truly and straight behaviour
Pro  To make the simpleminded sharp and to give the young man knowledge and serious purpose
Pro  The wise man hearing will get greater learning and the acts of the man of good sense will be wisely guided
Pro  To get the sense of wise sayings and secrets and of the words of the wise and their dark sayings
Pro  The fear of the Lord is the start of knowledge but the foolish have no use for wisdom and teaching
Pro  My son give ear to the training of your father and do not give up the teaching of your mother
Pro  For they will be a crown of grace for your head and chainornaments about your neck
Pro  My son if sinners would take you out of the right way do not go with them
Pro  If they say Come with us let us make designs against the good waiting secretly for the upright without cause
Pro  Let us overcome them living like the underworld and in their strength as those who go down to death
Pro  Goods of great price will be ours our houses will be full of wealth
Pro  Take your chance with us and we will all have one moneybag
Pro  My son do not go with them keep your feet from their ways
Pro  For their feet are running after evil and they are quick to take a mans life
Pro  Truly to no purpose is the net stretched out before the eyes of the bird
Pro  And they are secretly waiting for their blood and making ready destruction for themselves
Pro  Such is the fate of everyone who goes in search of profit it takes away the life of its owners
Pro  Wisdom is crying out in the street her voice is loud in the open places
Pro  Her words are sounding in the meetingplaces and in the doorways of the town
Pro  How long you simple ones will foolish things be dear to you and pride a delight to the haters of authority how long will the foolish go on hating knowledge
Pro  Be turned again by my sharp words see I will send the flow of my spirit on you and make my words clear to you
Pro  Because your ears were shut to my voice no one gave attention to my outstretched hand
Pro  You were not controlled by my guiding and would have nothing to do with my sharp words
Pro  So in the day of your trouble I will be laughing I will make sport of your fear
Pro  When your fear comes on you like a storm and your trouble like a rushing wind when pain and sorrow come on you
Pro  Then I will give no answer to their cries searching for me early they will not see me
Pro  For they were haters of knowledge and did not give their hearts to the fear of the Lord
Pro  They had no desire for my teaching and my words of protest were as nothing to them
Pro  So the fruit of their way will be their food and with the designs of their hearts they will be made full
Pro  For the turning back of the simple from teaching will be the cause of their death and the peace of the foolish will be their destruction
Pro  But whoever gives ear to me will take his rest safely living in peace without fear of evil
Pro  My son if you will take my words to your heart storing up my laws in your mind
Pro  So that your ear gives attention to wisdom and your heart is turned to knowledge
Pro  Truly if you are crying out for good sense and your request is for knowledge
Pro  If you are looking for her as for silver and searching for her as for storedup wealth
Pro  Then the fear of the Lord will be clear to you and knowledge of God will be yours
Pro  For the Lord gives wisdom out of his mouth come knowledge and reason
Pro  He has salvation stored up for the upright he is a breastplate to those in whom there is no evil
Pro  He keeps watch on the ways which are right and takes care of those who have the fear of him
Pro  Then you will have knowledge of righteousness and right acting and upright behaviour even of every good way
Pro  For wisdom will come into your heart and knowledge will be pleasing to your soul
Pro  Wise purposes will be watching over you and knowledge will keep you
Pro  Giving you salvation from the evil man from those whose words are false
Pro  Who give up the way of righteousness to go by dark roads
Pro  Who take pleasure in wrongdoing and have joy in the evil designs of the sinner
Pro  Whose ways are not straight and whose footsteps are turned to evil
Pro  To take you out of the power of the strange woman who says smooth words with her tongue
Pro  Who is false to the husband of her early years and does not keep the agreement of her God in mind
Pro  For her house is on the way down to death her footsteps go down to the shades
Pro  Those who go to her do not come back again their feet do not keep in the ways of life
Pro  So that you may go in the way of good men and keep in the footsteps of the upright
Pro  For the upright will be living in the land and the good will have it for their heritage
Pro  But sinners will be cut off from the land and those whose acts are false will be uprooted
Pro  My son keep my teaching in your memory and my rules in your heart
Pro  For they will give you increase of days years of life and peace
Pro  Let not mercy and good faith go from you let them be hanging round your neck recorded on your heart
Pro  So you will have grace and a good name in the eyes of God and men
Pro  Put all your hope in God not looking to your reason for support
Pro  In all your ways give ear to him and he will make straight your footsteps
Pro  Put no high value on your wisdom let the fear of the Lord be before you and keep yourself from evil
Pro  This will give strength to your flesh and new life to your bones
Pro  Give honour to the Lord with your wealth and with the firstfruits of all your increase
Pro  So your storehouses will be full of grain and your vessels overflowing with new wine
Pro  My son do not make your heart hard against the Lords teaching do not be made angry by his training
Pro  For to those who are dear to him the Lord says sharp words and makes the son in whom he has delight undergo pain
Pro  Happy is the man who makes discovery of wisdom and he who gets knowledge
Pro  For trading in it is better than trading in silver and its profit greater than bright gold
Pro  She is of more value than jewels and nothing for which you may have a desire is fair in comparison with her
Pro  Long life is in her right hand and in her left are wealth and honour
Pro  Her ways are ways of delight and all her goings are peace
Pro  She is a tree of life to all who take her in their hands and happy is everyone who keeps her
Pro  The Lord by wisdom put in position the bases of the earth by reason he put the heavens in their place
Pro  By his knowledge the deep was parted and dew came dropping from the skies
Pro  My son keep good sense and do not let wise purpose go from your eyes
Pro  So they will be life for your soul and grace for your neck
Pro  Then you will go safely on your way and your feet will have no cause for slipping
Pro  When you take your rest you will have no fear and on your bed sleep will be sweet to you
Pro  Have no fear of sudden danger or of the storm which will come on evildoers
Pro  For the Lord will be your hope and will keep your foot from being taken in the net
Pro  Do not keep back good from those who have a right to it when it is in the power of your hand to do it
Pro  Say not to your neighbour Go and come again and tomorrow I will give when you have it by you at the time
Pro  Do not make evil designs against your neighbour when he is living with you without fear
Pro  Do not take up a cause at law against a man for nothing if he has done you no wrong
Pro  Have no envy of the violent man or take any of his ways as an example
Pro  For the wronghearted man is hated by the Lord but he is a friend to the upright
Pro  The curse of the Lord is on the house of the evildoer but his blessing is on the tent of the upright
Pro  He makes sport of the men of pride but he gives grace to the gentlehearted
Pro  The wise will have glory for their heritage but shame will be the reward of the foolish
Pro  Give ear my sons to the teaching of a father give attention so that you may have knowledge
Pro  For I give you good teaching do not give up the knowledge you are getting from me
Pro  For I was a son to my father a gentle and an only one to my mother
Pro  And he gave me teaching saying to me Keep my words in your heart keep my rules so that you may have life
Pro  Get wisdom get true knowledge keep it in memory do not be turned away from the words of my mouth
Pro  Do not give her up and she will keep you give her your love and she will make you safe
Pro  The first sign of wisdom is to get wisdom go give all you have to get true knowledge
Pro  Put her in a high place and you will be lifted up by her she will give you honour when you give her your love
Pro  She will put a crown of grace on your head giving you a headdress of glory
Pro  Give ear O my son and let your heart be open to my sayings and long life will be yours
Pro  I have given you teaching in the way of wisdom guiding your steps in the straight way
Pro  When you go your way will not be narrow and in running you will not have a fall
Pro  Take learning in your hands do not let her go keep her for she is your life
Pro  Do not go in the road of sinners or be walking in the way of evil men
Pro  Keep far from it do not go near be turned from it and go on your way
Pro  For they take no rest till they have done evil their sleep is taken away if they have not been the cause of someones fall
Pro  The bread of evildoing is their food the wine of violent acts their drink
Pro  But the way of the upright is like the light of early morning getting brighter and brighter till the full day
Pro  The way of sinners is dark they see not the cause of their fall
Pro  My son give attention to my words let your ear be turned to my sayings
Pro  Let them not go from your eyes keep them deep in your heart
Pro  For they are life to him who gets them and strength to all his flesh
Pro  And keep watch over your heart with all care so you will have life
Pro  Put away from you an evil tongue and let false lips be far from you
Pro  Keep your eyes on what is in front of you looking straight before you
Pro  Keep a watch on your behaviour let all your ways be rightly ordered
Pro  Let there be no turning to the right or to the left keep your feet from evil
Pro  My son give attention to my wisdom let your ear be turned to my teaching
Pro  So that you may be ruled by a wise purpose and your lips may keep knowledge
Pro  For honey is dropping from the lips of the strange woman and her mouth is smoother than oil
Pro  But her end is bitter as wormwood and sharp as a twoedged sword
Pro  Her feet go down to death and her steps to the underworld
Pro  She never keeps her mind on the road of life her ways are uncertain she has no knowledge
Pro  Give ear to me then my sons and do not put away my words from you
Pro  Go far away from her do not come near the door of her house
Pro  For fear that you may give your honour to others and your wealth to strange men
Pro  And strange men may be full of your wealth and the fruit of your work go to the house of others
Pro  And you will be full of grief at the end of your life when your flesh and your body are wasted
Pro  And you will say How was teaching hated by me and my heart put no value on training
Pro  I did not give attention to the voice of my teachers my ear was not turned to those who were guiding me
Pro  I was in almost all evil in the company of the people
Pro  Let water from your store and not that of others be your drink and running water from your fountain
Pro  Let not your springs be flowing in the streets or your streams of water in the open places
Pro  Let them be for yourself only not for other men with you
Pro  Let blessing be on your fountain have joy in the wife of your early years
Pro  As a loving hind and a gentle doe let her breasts ever give you rapture let your passion at all times be moved by her love
Pro  Why let yourself my son go out of the way with a strange woman and take another woman in your arms
Pro  For a mans ways are before the eyes of the Lord and he puts all his goings in the scales
Pro  The evildoer will be taken in the net of his crimes and prisoned in the cords of his sin
Pro  He will come to his end for need of teaching he is so foolish that he will go wandering from the right way
Pro  My son if you have made yourself responsible for your neighbour or given your word for another
Pro  You are taken as in a net by the words of your mouth the sayings of your lips have overcome you
Pro  Do this my son and make yourself free because you have come into the power of your neighbour go without waiting and make a strong request to your neighbour
Pro  Give no sleep to your eyes or rest to them
Pro  Make yourself free like the roe from the hand of the archer and the bird from him who puts a net for her
Pro  Go to the ant you hater of work give thought to her ways and be wise
Pro  Having no chief overseer or ruler
Pro  She gets her meat in the summer storing up food at the time of the graincutting
Pro  How long will you be sleeping O hater of work when will you get up from your sleep
Pro  A little sleep a little rest a little folding of the hands in sleep
Pro  Then loss will come on you like an outlaw and your need like an armed man
Pro  A goodfornothing man is an evildoer he goes on his way causing trouble with false words
Pro  Making signs with his eyes rubbing with his feet and giving news with his fingers
Pro  His mind is ever designing evil he lets loose violent acts
Pro  For this cause his downfall will be sudden quickly he will be broken and there will be no help for him
Pro  Six things are hated by the Lord seven things are disgusting to him
Pro  Eyes of pride a false tongue hands which take life without cause
Pro  A heart full of evil designs feet which are quick in running after sin
Pro  A false witness breathing out untrue words and one who lets loose violent acts among brothers
Pro  My son keep the rule of your father and have in memory the teaching of your mother
Pro  Keep them ever folded in your heart and have them hanging round your neck
Pro  In your walking it will be your guide when you are sleeping it will keep watch over you when you are awake it will have talk with you
Pro  For the rule is a light and the teaching a shining light and the guiding words of training are the way of life
Pro  They will keep you from the evil woman from the smooth tongue of the strange woman
Pro  Let not your hearts desire go after her fair body let not her eyes take you prisoner
Pro  For a loose woman is looking for a cake of bread but another mans wife goes after ones very life
Pro  May a man take fire to his breast without burning his clothing
Pro  Or may one go on lighted coals and his feet not be burned
Pro  So it is with him who goes in to his neighbours wife he who has anything to do with her will not go free from punishment
Pro  Men do not have a low opinion of a thief who takes food when he is in need of it
Pro  But if he is taken in the act he will have to give back seven times as much giving up all his property which is in his house
Pro  He who takes another mans wife is without all sense he who does it is the cause of destruction to his soul
Pro  Wounds will be his and loss of honour and his shame may not be washed away
Pro  For bitter is the wrath of an angry husband in the day of punishment he will have no mercy
Pro  He will not take any payment and he will not make peace with you though your money offerings are increased
Pro  My son keep my sayings and let my rules be stored up with you
Pro  Keep my rules and you will have life let my teaching be to you as the light of your eyes
Pro  Let them be fixed to your fingers and recorded in your heart
Pro  Say to wisdom You are my sister let knowledge be named your special friend
Pro  So that they may keep you from the strange woman even from her whose words are smooth
Pro  Looking out from my house and watching through the window
Pro  I saw among the young men one without sense
Pro  Walking in the street near the turn of her road going on the way to her house
Pro  At nightfall in the evening of the day in the black dark of the night
Pro  And the woman came out to him in the dress of a loose woman with a designing heart
Pro  She is full of noise and uncontrolled her feet keep not in her house
Pro  Now she is in the street now in the open spaces waiting at every turning of the road
Pro  So she took him by his hand kissing him and without a sign of shame she said to him
Pro  I have a feast of peaceofferings for today my oaths have been effected
Pro  So I came out in the hope of meeting you looking for you with care and now I have you
Pro  My bed is covered with cushions of needlework with coloured cloths of the cotton thread of Egypt
Pro  I have made my bed sweet with perfumes and spices
Pro  Come let us take our pleasure in love till the morning having joy in loves delights
Pro  For the master of the house is away on a long journey
Pro  He has taken a bag of money with him he is coming back at the full moon
Pro  With her fair words she overcame him forcing him with her smooth lips
Pro  The simple man goes after her like an ox going to its death like a roe pulled by a cord
Pro  Like a bird falling into a net with no thought that his life is in danger till an arrow goes into his side
Pro  So now my sons give ear to me give attention to the sayings of my mouth
Pro  Let not your heart be turned to her ways do not go wandering in her footsteps
Pro  For those wounded and made low by her are great in number and all those who have come to their death through her are a great army
Pro  Her house is the way to the underworld going down to the rooms of death
Pro  Is not wisdom crying out and the voice of knowledge sounding
Pro  At the top of the highways at the meeting of the roads she takes her place
Pro  Where the roads go into the town her cry goes out at the doorways her voice is loud
Pro  I am crying out to you O men my voice comes to the sons of men
Pro  Become expert in reason O you simple ones you foolish ones take training to heart
Pro  Give ear for my words are true and my lips are open to give out what is upright
Pro  For good faith goes out of my mouth and false lips are disgusting to me
Pro  All the words of my mouth are righteousness there is nothing false or twisted in them
Pro  They are all true to him whose mind is awake and straightforward to those who get knowledge
Pro  Take my teaching and not silver get knowledge in place of the best gold
Pro  For wisdom is better than jewels and all things which may be desired are nothing in comparison with her
Pro  I wisdom have made wise behaviour my near relation I am seen to be the special friend of wise purposes
Pro  The fear of the Lord is seen in hating evil pride a high opinion of oneself the evil way and the false tongue are unpleasing to me
Pro  Wise design and good sense are mine reason and strength are mine
Pro  Through me kings have their power and rulers give right decisions
Pro  Through me chiefs have authority and the noble ones are judging in righteousness
Pro  Those who have given me their love are loved by me and those who make search for me with care will get me
Pro  Wealth and honour are in my hands even wealth without equal and righteousness
Pro  My fruit is better than gold even than the best gold and my increase is more to be desired than silver
Pro  I go in the road of righteousness in the way of right judging
Pro  So that I may give my lovers wealth for their heritage making their storehouses full
Pro  The Lord made me as the start of his way the first of his works in the past
Pro  From eternal days I was given my place from the birth of time before the earth was
Pro  When there was no deep I was given birth when there were no fountains flowing with water
Pro  Before the mountains were put in their places before the hills was my birth
Pro  When he had not made the earth or the fields or the dust of the world
Pro  When he made ready the heavens I was there when he put an arch over the face of the deep
Pro  When he made strong the skies overhead when the fountains of the deep were fixed
Pro  When he put a limit to the sea so that the waters might not go against his word when he put in position the bases of the earth
Pro  Then I was by his side as a master workman and I was his delight from day to day playing before him at all times
Pro  Playing in his earth and my delight was with the sons of men
Pro  Give ear to me then my sons for happy are those who keep my ways
Pro  Take my teaching and be wise do not let it go
Pro  Happy is the man who gives ear to me watching at my doors day by day keeping his place by the pillars of my house
Pro  For whoever gets me gets life and grace from the Lord will come to him
Pro  But he who does evil to me does wrong to his soul all my haters are in love with death
Pro  Wisdom has made her house putting up her seven pillars
Pro  She has put her fat beasts to death her wine is mixed her table is ready
Pro  She has sent out her womenservants her voice goes out to the highest places of the town saying
Pro  Whoever is simple let him come in here and to him who has no sense she says
Pro  Come take of my bread and of my wine which is mixed
Pro  Give up the simple ones and have life and go in the way of knowledge
Pro  He who gives teaching to a man of pride gets shame for himself he who says sharp words to a sinner gets a bad name
Pro  Do not say sharp words to a man of pride or he will have hate for you make them clear to a wise man and you will be dear to him
Pro  Give teaching to a wise man and he will become wiser give training to an upright man and his learning will be increased
Pro  The fear of the Lord is the start of wisdom and the knowledge of the Holy One gives a wise mind
Pro  For by me your days will be increased and the years of your life will be long
Pro  If you are wise you are wise for yourself if your heart is full of pride you only will have the pain of it
Pro  The foolish woman is full of noise she has no sense at all
Pro  Seated at the door of her house in the high places of the town
Pro  Crying out to those who go by going straight on their way she says
Pro  Whoever is simple let him come in here and to him who is without sense she says
Pro  Drink taken without right is sweet and food in secret is pleasing
Pro  But he does not see that the dead are there that her guests are in the deep places of the underworld
Pro  A wise son makes a glad father but a foolish son is a sorrow to his mother
Pro  Wealth which comes from sin is of no profit but righteousness gives salvation from death
Pro  The Lord will not let the upright be in need of food but he puts far from him the desire of the evildoers
Pro  He who is slow in his work becomes poor but the hand of the ready worker gets in wealth
Pro  He who in summer gets together his store is a son who does wisely but he who takes his rest when the grain is being cut is a son causing shame
Pro  Blessings are on the head of the upright but the face of sinners will be covered with sorrow
Pro  The memory of the upright is a blessing but the name of the evildoer will be turned to dust
Pro  The wisehearted man will let himself be ruled but the man whose talk is foolish will have a fall
Pro  He whose ways are upright will go safely but he whose ways are twisted will be made low
Pro  He who makes signs with his eyes is a cause of trouble but he who makes a man see his errors is a cause of peace
Pro  The mouth of the upright man is a fountain of life but the mouth of the evildoer is a bitter cup
Pro  Hate is a cause of violent acts but all errors are covered up by love
Pro  In the lips of him who has knowledge wisdom is seen but a rod is ready for the back of him who is without sense
Pro  Knowledge is stored up by the wise but the mouth of the foolish man is a destruction which is near
Pro  The property of the man of wealth is his strong town the poor mans need is his destruction
Pro  The work of the upright gives life the increase of the evildoer is a cause of sin
Pro  He who takes note of teaching is a way of life but he who gives up training is a cause of error
Pro  Hate is covered up by the lips of the upright man but he who lets out evil about another is foolish
Pro  Where there is much talk there will be no end to sin but he who keeps his mouth shut does wisely
Pro  The tongue of the upright man is like tested silver the heart of the evildoer is of little value
Pro  The lips of the upright man give food to men but the foolish come to death for need of sense
Pro  The blessing of the Lord gives wealth hard work makes it no greater
Pro  It is sport to the foolish man to do evil but the man of good sense takes delight in wisdom
Pro  The thing feared by the evildoer will come to him but the upright man will get his desire
Pro  When the stormwind is past the sinner is seen no longer but the upright man is safe for ever
Pro  Like acid drink to the teeth and as smoke to the eyes so is the hater of work to those who send him
Pro  The fear of the Lord gives long life but the years of the evildoer will be cut short
Pro  The hope of the upright man will give joy but the waiting of the evildoer will have its end in sorrow
Pro  The way of the Lord is a strong tower for the upright man but destruction to the workers of evil
Pro  The upright man will never be moved but evildoers will not have a safe restingplace in the land
Pro  The mouth of the upright man is budding with wisdom but the twisted tongue will be cut off
Pro  The lips of the upright man have knowledge of what is pleasing but twisted are the mouths of evildoers
Pro  Scales of deceit are hated by the Lord but a true weight is his delight
Pro  When pride comes there comes shame but wisdom is with the quiet in spirit
Pro  The righteousness of the upright will be their guide but the twisted ways of the false will be their destruction
Pro  Wealth is of no profit in the day of wrath but righteousness keeps a man safe from death
Pro  The righteousness of the good man will make his way straight but the sin of the evildoer will be the cause of his fall
Pro  The righteousness of the upright will be their salvation but the false will themselves be taken in their evil designs
Pro  At the death of an upright man his hope does not come to an end but the hope of the evildoer comes to destruction
Pro  The upright man is taken out of trouble and in his place comes the sinner
Pro  With his mouth the evil man sends destruction on his neighbour but through knowledge the upright are taken out of trouble
Pro  When things go well for the upright man all the town is glad at the death of sinners there are cries of joy
Pro  By the blessing of the upright man the town is made great but it is overturned by the mouth of the evildoer
Pro  He who has a poor opinion of his neighbour has no sense but a wise man keeps quiet
