Pro  Have I not put in writing for you thirty sayings with wise suggestions and knowledge
Pro  To make you see how certain are true words so that you may give a true answer to those who put questions to you
Pro  Do not take away the property of the poor man because he is poor or be cruel to the crushed ones when they come before the judge
Pro  For the Lord will give support to their cause and take the life of those who take their goods
Pro  Do not be friends with a man who is given to wrath do not go in the company of an angry man
Pro  For fear of learning his ways and making a net ready for your soul
Pro  Be not one of those who give their hands in an agreement or of those who make themselves responsible for debts
Pro  If you have nothing with which to make payment he will take away your bed from under you
Pro  Let not the old landmark be moved which your fathers have put in place
Pro  Have you seen a man who is expert in his business he will take his place before kings his place will not be among low persons
Pro  When you take your seat at the feast with a ruler give thought with care to what is before you
Pro  And put a knife to your throat if you have a strong desire for food
Pro  Have no desire for his delicate food for it is the bread of deceit
Pro  Take no care to get wealth let there be an end to your desire for money
Pro  Are your eyes lifted up to it it is gone for wealth takes to itself wings like an eagle in flight up to heaven
Pro  Do not take the food of him who has an evil eye or have any desire for his delicate meat
Pro  For as the thoughts of his heart are so is he Take food and drink he says to you but his heart is not with you
Pro  The food which you have taken will come up again and your pleasing words will be wasted
Pro  Say nothing in the hearing of a foolish man for he will put no value on the wisdom of your words
Pro  Do not let the landmark of the widow be moved and do not go into the fields of those who have no father
Pro  For their saviour is strong and he will take up their cause against you
Pro  Give your heart to teaching and your ears to the words of knowledge
Pro  Do not keep back training from the child for even if you give him blows with the rod it will not be death to him
Pro  Give him blows with the rod and keep his soul safe from the underworld
Pro  My son if your heart becomes wise I even I will be glad in heart
Pro  And my thoughts in me will be full of joy when your lips say right things
Pro  Have no envy of sinners in your heart but keep in the fear of the Lord all through the day
Pro  For without doubt there is a future and your hope will not be cut off
Pro  Give ear my son and be wise guiding your heart in the right way
Pro  Do not be among those who give themselves to winedrinking or among those who make themselves full with meat
Pro  For those who take delight in drink and feasting will come to be in need and through love of sleep a man will be poorly clothed
Pro  Give ear to your father whose child you are and do not keep honour from your mother when she is old
Pro  Get for yourself that which is true and do not let it go for money get wisdom and teaching and good sense
Pro  The father of the upright man will be glad and he who has a wise child will have joy because of him
Pro  Let your father and your mother be glad let her who gave you birth have joy
Pro  My son give me your heart and let your eyes take delight in my ways
Pro  For a loose woman is a deep hollow and a strange woman is a narrow waterhole
Pro  Yes she is waiting secretly like a beast for its food and deceit by her is increased among men
Pro  Who says Oh who says Ah who has violent arguments who has grief who has wounds without cause whose eyes are dark
Pro  Those who are seated late over the wine those who go looking for mixed wine
Pro  Keep your eyes from looking on the wine when it is red when its colour is bright in the cup when it goes smoothly down
Pro  In the end its bite is like that of a snake its wound like the wound of a poisonsnake
Pro  Your eyes will see strange things and you will say twisted things
Pro  Yes you will be like him who takes his rest on the sea or on the top of a sailsupport
Pro  They have overcome me you will say and I have no pain they gave me blows without my feeling them when will I be awake from my wine I will go after it again
Pro  Have no envy for evil men or any desire to be with them
Pro  For the purposes of their hearts are destruction and their lips are talking of trouble
Pro  The building of a house is by wisdom and by reason it is made strong
Pro  And by knowledge its rooms are full of all dear and pleasing things
Pro  A wise man is strong and a man of knowledge makes strength greater
Pro  For by wise guiding you will overcome in war and in a number of wise guides there is salvation
Pro  Wisdom is outside the power of the foolish he keeps his mouth shut in the public place
Pro  He whose purposes are bad will be named a man of evil designs
Pro  The purpose of the foolish is sin and the hater of authority is disgusting to others
Pro  If you give way in the day of trouble your strength is small
Pro  Be the saviour of those who are given up to death and do not keep back help from those who are slipping to destruction
Pro  If you say See we had no knowledge of this does not the tester of hearts give thought to it and he who keeps your soul has he no knowledge of it and will he not give to every man the reward of his work
Pro  My son take honey for it is good and the flowing honey which is sweet to your taste
Pro  So let your desire be for wisdom if you have it there will be a future and your hope will not be cut off
Pro  Do not keep a secret watch O evildoer against the fields of the upright man or send destruction on his restingplace
Pro  For an upright man after falling seven times will get up again but trouble is the downfall of the evil
Pro  Do not be glad at the fall of your hater and let not your heart have joy at his downfall
Pro  For fear that the Lord may see it and it may be evil in his eyes and his wrath may be turned away from him
Pro  Do not be troubled because of evildoers or have envy of sinners
Pro  For there will be no future for the evil man the light of sinners will be put out
Pro  My son go in fear of the Lord and the king have nothing to do with those who are in high positions
Pro  For their downfall will come suddenly and who has knowledge of the destruction of those in high positions
Pro  These are more sayings of the wise To have respect for a persons position when judging is not good
Pro  He who says to the evildoer You are upright will be cursed by peoples and hated by nations
Pro  But those who say sharp words to him will have delight and a blessing of good will come on them
Pro  He gives a kiss with his lips who gives a right answer
Pro  Put your work in order outside and make it ready in the field and after that see to the building of your house
Pro  Do not be a violent witness against your neighbour or let your lips say what is false
Pro  Say not I will do to him as he has done to me I will give the man the reward of his work
Pro  I went by the field of the hater of work and by the vinegarden of the man without sense
Pro  And it was all full of thorns and covered with waste plants and its stone wall was broken down
Pro  Then looking at it I gave thought I saw and I got teaching from it
Pro  A little sleep a little rest a little folding of the hands in sleep
Pro  So loss will come on you like an outlaw and your need like an armed man
Pro  These are more wise sayings of Solomon copied out by the men of Hezekiah king of Judah
Pro  It is the glory of God to keep a thing secret but the glory of kings is to have it searched out
Pro  The heaven is high and the earth is deep and the hearts of kings may not be searched out
Pro  Take away the waste from silver and a vessel will come out for the silverworker
Pro  Take away evildoers from before the king and the seat of his power will be made strong in righteousness
Pro  Do not take glory for yourself before the king and do not put yourself in the place of the great
Pro  For it is better to have it said to you Come up here than for you to be put down in a lower place before the ruler
Pro  Do not be quick to go to law about what you have seen for what will you do in the end when your neighbour has put you to shame
Pro  Have a talk with your neighbour himself about your cause but do not give away the secret of another
Pro  Or your hearer may say evil of you and your shame will not be turned away
Pro  A word at the right time is like apples of gold in a network of silver
Pro  Like a nosering of gold and an ornament of the best gold is a wise man who says sharp words to an ear ready to give attention
Pro  As the cold of snow in the time of graincutting so is a true servant to those who send him for he gives new life to the soul of his master
Pro  As clouds and wind without rain so is one who takes credit for an offering he has not given
Pro  A judge is moved by one who for a long time undergoes wrongs without protest and by a soft tongue even bone is broken
Pro  If you have honey take only as much as is enough for you for fear that being full of it you may not be able to keep it down
Pro  Let not your foot be frequently in your neighbours house or he may get tired of you and his feeling be turned to hate
Pro  One who gives false witness against his neighbour is a hammer and a sword and a sharp arrow
Pro  Putting ones faith in a false man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth and a shaking foot
Pro  Like one who takes off clothing in cold weather and like acid on a wound is he who makes melody to a sad heart
Pro  If your hater is in need of food give him bread and if he is in need of drink give him water
Pro  For so you will put coals of fire on his head and the Lord will give you your reward
Pro  As the north wind gives birth to rain so is an angry face caused by a tongue saying evil secretly
Pro  It is better to be living in an angle of the housetop than with a bittertongued woman in a wide house
Pro  As cold water to a tired soul so is good news from a far country
Pro  Like a troubled fountain and a dirty spring is an upright man who has to give way before evildoers
Pro  It is not good to take much honey so he who is not looking for honour will be honoured
Pro  He whose spirit is uncontrolled is like an unwalled town which has been broken into
Pro  Like snow in summer and rain when the grain is being cut so honour is not natural for the foolish
Pro  As the sparrow in her wandering and the swallow in her flight so the curse does not come without a cause
Pro  A whip for the horse a mouthbit for the ass and a rod for the back of the foolish
Pro  Do not give to the foolish man a foolish answer or you will be like him
Pro  Give a foolish man a foolish answer or he will seem wise to himself
Pro  He who sends news by the hand of a foolish man is cutting off his feet and drinking in damage
Pro  The legs of one who has no power of walking are hanging loose so is a wise saying in the mouth of the foolish
Pro  Giving honour to a foolish man is like attempting to keep a stone fixed in a cord
Pro  Like a thorn which goes up into the hand of a man overcome by drink so is a wise saying in the mouth of a foolish man
Pro  Like an archer wounding all who go by is a foolish man overcome by drink
Pro  Like a dog going back to the food which he has not been able to keep down is the foolish man doing his foolish acts over again
Pro  Have you seen a man who seems to himself to be wise There is more hope for the foolish than for him
Pro  The hater of work says There is a lion in the way a lion is in the streets
Pro  A door is turned on its pillar and the hater of work on his bed
Pro  The hater of work puts his hand deep into the basin lifting it again to his mouth is a weariness to him
Pro  The hater of work seems to himself wiser than seven men who are able to give an answer with good sense
Pro  He who gets mixed up in a fight which is not his business is like one who takes a dog by the ears while it is going by
Pro  As one who is off his head sends about flaming sticks and arrows of death
Pro  So is the man who gets the better of his neighbour by deceit and says Am I not doing so in sport
Pro  Without wood the fire goes out and where there is no secret talk argument is ended
Pro  Like breath on coals and wood on fire so a man given to argument gets a fight started
Pro  The words of one who says evil of his neighbour secretly are like sweet food they go down into the inner parts of the stomach
Pro  Smooth lips and an evil heart are like a vessel of earth plated with silver waste
Pro  With his lips the hater makes things seem what they are not but deceit is stored up inside him
Pro  When he says fair words have no belief in him for in his heart are seven evils
Pro  Though his hate is covered with deceit his sin will be seen openly before the meeting of the people
Pro  He who makes a hole in the earth will himself go falling into it and on him by whom a stone is rolled the stone will come back again
Pro  A false tongue has hate for those who have clean hearts and a smooth mouth is a cause of falling
Pro  Do not make a noise about tomorrow for you are not certain what a days outcome may be
Pro  Let another man give you praise and not your mouth one who is strange to you and not your lips
Pro  A stone has great weight and sand is crushing but the wrath of the foolish is of greater weight than these
Pro  Wrath is cruel and angry feeling an overflowing stream but who does not give way before envy
Pro  Better is open protest than love kept secret
Pro  The wounds of a friend are given in good faith but the kisses of a hater are false
Pro  The full man has no use for honey but to the man in need of food every bitter thing is sweet
Pro  Like a bird wandering from the place of her eggs is a man wandering from his station
Pro  Oil and perfume make glad the heart and the wise suggestion of a friend is sweet to the soul
Pro  Do not give up your friend and your fathers friend and do not go into your brothers house in the day of your trouble better is a neighbour who is near than a brother far off
Pro  My son be wise and make my heart glad so that I may give back an answer to him who puts me to shame
Pro  The sharp man sees the evil and takes cover the simple go straight on and get into trouble
Pro  Take a mans clothing if he makes himself responsible for a strange man and get an undertaking from him who gives his word for strange men
Pro  He who gives a blessing to his friend with a loud voice getting up early in the morning will have it put to his account as a curse
Pro  Like an unending dropping on a day of rain is a bittertongued woman
Pro  He who keeps secret the secret of his friend will get himself a name for good faith
Pro  Iron makes iron sharp so a man makes sharp his friend
Pro  Whoever keeps a figtree will have its fruit and the servant waiting on his master will be honoured
Pro  Like face looking at face in water so are the hearts of men to one another
Pro  The underworld and Abaddon are never full and the eyes of man have never enough
Pro  The heatingpot is for silver and the ovenfire for gold and a man is measured by what he is praised for
Pro  Even if a foolish man is crushed with a hammer in a vessel among crushed grain still his foolish ways will not go from him
Pro  Take care to have knowledge about the condition of your flocks looking well after your herds
Pro  For wealth is not for ever and money does not go on for all generations
Pro  The grass comes up and the young grass is seen and the mountain plants are got in
Pro  The lambs are for your clothing and the hegoats make the value of a field
Pro  There will be goats milk enough for your food and for the support of your servantgirls
Pro  The evil man goes running away when no man is after him but the upright are without fear like the lion
Pro  Because of the sin of the land its troubles are increased but by a man of wisdom and knowledge they will be put out like a fire
Pro  A man of wealth who is cruel to the poor is like a violent rain causing destruction of food
Pro  Those who have no respect for the law give praise to the evildoer but such as keep the law are against him
Pro  Evil men have no knowledge of what is right but those who go after the Lord have knowledge of all things
Pro  Better is the poor man whose ways are upright than the man of wealth whose ways are not straight
Pro  He who keeps the law is a wise son but he who keeps company with feasters puts shame on his father
Pro  He who makes his wealth greater by taking interest only gets it together for him who has pity on the poor
Pro  As for the man whose ear is turned away from hearing the law even his prayer is disgusting
Pro  Anyone causing the upright to go wandering in an evil way will himself go down into the hole he has made but the upright will have good things for their heritage
Pro  The man of wealth seems to himself to be wise but the poor man who has sense has a low opinion of him
Pro  When the upright do well there is great glory but when evildoers are lifted up men do not let themselves be seen
Pro  He who keeps his sins secret will not do well but one who is open about them and gives them up will get mercy
Pro  Happy is the man in whom is the fear of the Lord at all times but he whose heart is hard will come into trouble
Pro  Like a loudvoiced lion and a wandering bear is an evil ruler over a poor people
Pro  The prince who has no sense is a cruel ruler but he who has no desire to get profit for himself will have long life
Pro  One who has been the cause of a mans death will go in flight to the underworld let no man give him help
Pro  He whose ways are upright will be safe but sudden will be the fall of him whose ways are twisted
Pro  By ploughing his land a man will have bread in full measure but he who goes after goodfornothing persons will be poor enough
Pro  A man of good faith will have great blessing but one attempting to get wealth quickly will not go free from punishment
Pro  It is not good to have respect for a mans position for a man will do wrong for a bit of bread
Pro  He who is ever desiring wealth goes running after money and does not see that need will come on him
Pro  He who says words of protest to a man will later have more approval than one who says smooth words with his tongue
Pro  He who takes from his father or his mother what is theirs by right and says It is no sin is the same as a taker of life
Pro  He who is ever desiring profit is a cause of fighting but he who puts his faith in the Lord will be made fat
Pro  He whose faith is in himself is foolish but everyone walking wisely will be kept safe
Pro  He who gives to the poor will never be in need but great curses will be on him who gives no attention to them
Pro  When evildoers are lifted up men take cover but when destruction overtakes them the upright are increased
Pro  A man hating sharp words and making his heart hard will suddenly be broken and will not be made well again
Pro  When the upright have power the people are glad when an evil man is ruler grief comes on the people
Pro  A man who is a lover of wisdom is a joy to his father but he who goes in the company of loose women is a waster of wealth
Pro  A king by right rule makes the land safe but one full of desires makes it a waste
Pro  A man who says smooth things to his neighbour is stretching out a net for his steps
Pro  In the steps of an evil man there is a net for him but the upright man gets away quickly and is glad
Pro  The upright man gives attention to the cause of the poor the evildoer gives no thought to it
Pro  Men of pride are the cause of violent acts in a town but by wise men wrath is turned away
Pro  If a wise man goes to law with a foolish man he may be angry or laughing but there will be no rest
Pro  Men of blood are haters of the good man and evildoers go after his soul
Pro  A foolish man lets out all his wrath but a wise man keeps it back quietly
Pro  If a ruler gives attention to false words all his servants are evildoers
Pro  The poor man and his creditor come face to face the Lord gives light to their eyes equally
Pro  The king who is a true judge in the cause of the poor will be safe for ever on the seat of his power
Pro  The rod and sharp words give wisdom but a child who is not guided is a cause of shame to his mother
Pro  When evil men are in power wrongdoing is increased but the upright will have pleasure when they see their downfall
Pro  Give your son training and he will give you rest he will give delight to your soul
Pro  Where there is no vision the people are uncontrolled but he who keeps the law will be happy
Pro  A servant will not be trained by words for though the sense of the words is clear to him he will not give attention
Pro  Have you seen a man who is quick with his tongue There is more hope for a foolish man than for him
Pro  If a servant is gently cared for from his early years he will become a cause of sorrow in the end
Pro  An angry man is the cause of fighting and a man given to wrath does much wrong
Pro  A mans pride will be the cause of his fall but he who has a gentle spirit will get honour
Pro  A man who takes part with a thief has hate for his soul he is put under oath but says nothing
Pro  The fear of man is a cause of danger but whoever puts his faith in the Lord will have a safe place on high
Pro  The approval of a ruler is desired by great numbers but the decision in a mans cause comes from the Lord
Pro  An evil man is disgusting to the upright and he who is upright is disgusting to evildoers
Pro  The words of Agur the son of Jakeh from Massa The man says I am full of weariness O God I am full of weariness O God I have come to an end
Pro  For I am more like a beast than any man I have no power of reasoning like a man
Pro  I have not got wisdom by teaching so that I might have the knowledge of the Holy One
Pro  Who has gone up to heaven and come down who has taken the winds in his hands prisoning the waters in his robe by whom have all the ends of the earth been fixed what is his name and what is his sons name if you are able to say
Pro  Every word of God is tested he is a breastplate to those who put their faith in him
Pro  Make no addition to his words or he will make clear your error and you will be seen to be false
Pro  I have made request to you for two things do not keep them from me before my death
Pro  Put far from me all false and foolish things do not give me great wealth or let me be in need but give me only enough food
Pro  For fear that if I am full I may be false to you and say Who is the Lord or if I am poor I may become a thief using the name of my God wrongly
Pro  Do not say evil of a servant to his master or he will put a curse on you and you will get into trouble
Pro  There is a generation who put a curse on their father and do not give a blessing to their mother
Pro  There is a generation who seem to themselves to be free from sin but are not washed from their unclean ways
Pro  There is a generation O how full of pride are their eyes O how their brows are lifted up
Pro  There is a generation whose teeth are like swords their strong teeth like knives for the destruction of the poor from the earth and of those who are in need from among men
Pro  The nightspirit has two daughters Give give There are three things which are never full even four which never say Enough
Pro  The underworld and the woman without a child the earth which never has enough water and the fire which never says Enough
Pro  The eye which makes sport of a father and sees no value in a mother when she is old will be rooted out by the ravens of the valley and be food for the young eagles
Pro  There are three things the wonder of which overcomes me even four things outside my knowledge
Pro  The way of an eagle in the air the way of a snake on a rock the way of a ship in the heart of the sea and the way of a man with a girl
Pro  This is the way of a false wife she takes food and cleaning her mouth says I have done no wrong
Pro  For three things the earth is moved and there are four which it will not put up with
Pro  A servant when he becomes a king a man without sense when his wealth is increased
Pro  A hated woman when she is married and a servantgirl who takes the place of her masters wife
Pro  There are four things which are little on the earth but they are very wise
Pro  The ants are a people not strong but they put by a store of food in the summer
Pro  The conies are only a feeble people but they make their houses in the rocks
Pro  The locusts have no king but they all go out in bands
Pro  You may take the lizard in your hands but it is in kings houses
Pro  There are three things whose steps are good to see even four whose goings are fair
Pro  The lion which is strongest among beasts not turning from his way for any
Pro  The warhorse and the hegoat and the king when his army is with him
Pro  If you have done foolishly in lifting yourself up or if you have had evil designs put your hand over your mouth
Pro  The shaking of milk makes butter and the twisting of the nose makes blood come so the forcing of wrath is a cause of fighting
Pro  The words of Lemuel king of Massa the teaching which he had from his mother
Pro  What am I to say to you O Lemuel my oldest son and what O son of my body and what O son of my oaths
Pro  Do not give your strength to women or your ways to that which is the destruction of kings
Pro  It is not for kings O Lemuel it is not for kings to take wine or for rulers to say Where is strong drink
Pro  For fear that through drinking they may come to have no respect for the law wrongly judging the cause of those who are in trouble
Pro  Give strong drink to him who is near to destruction and wine to him whose soul is bitter
Pro  Let him have drink and his need will go from his mind and the memory of his trouble will be gone
Pro  Let your mouth be open for those who have no voice in the cause of those who are ready for death
Pro  Let your mouth be open judging rightly and give right decisions in the cause of the poor and those in need
Pro  Who may make discovery of a woman of virtue For her price is much higher than jewels
Pro  The heart of her husband has faith in her and he will have profit in full measure
Pro  She does him good and not evil all the days of her life
Pro  She gets wool and linen working at the business of her hands
Pro  She is like the tradingships getting food from far away
Pro  She gets up while it is still night and gives meat to her family and their food to her servantgirls
Pro  After looking at a field with care she gets it for a price planting a vinegarden with the profit of her work
Pro  She puts a band of strength round her and makes her arms strong
Pro  She sees that her marketing is of profit to her her light does not go out by night
Pro  She puts her hands to the clothworking rod and her fingers take the wheel
Pro  Her hands are stretched out to the poor yes she is openhanded to those who are in need
Pro  She has no fear of the snow for her family for all those in her house are clothed in red
Pro  She makes for herself cushions of needlework her clothing is fair linen and purple
Pro  Her husband is a man of note in the public place when he takes his seat among the responsible men of the land
Pro  She makes linen robes and gets a price for them and traders take her cloth bands for a price
Pro  Strength and selfrespect are her clothing she is facing the future with a smile
Pro  Her mouth is open to give out wisdom and the law of mercy is on her tongue
Pro  She gives attention to the ways of her family she does not take her food without working for it
Pro  Her children get up and give her honour and her husband gives her praise saying
Pro  Unnumbered women have done well but you are better than all of them
Pro  Fair looks are a deceit and a beautiful form is of no value but a woman who has the fear of the Lord is to be praised
Pro  Give her credit for what her hands have made let her be praised by her works in the public place
Ecc  The words of the Preacher the son of David king in Jerusalem
Ecc  All is to no purpose said the Preacher all the ways of man are to no purpose
Ecc  What is a man profited by all his work which he does under the sun
Ecc  One generation goes and another comes but the earth is for ever
Ecc  The sun comes up and the sun goes down and goes quickly back to the place where he came up
Ecc  The wind goes to the south turning back again to the north circling round for ever
Ecc  All the rivers go down to the sea but the sea is not full to the place where the rivers go there they go again
Ecc  All things are full of weariness man may not give their story the eye has never enough of its seeing or the ear of its hearing
Ecc  That which has been is that which is to be and that which has been done is that which will be done and there is no new thing under the sun
Ecc  Is there anything of which men say See this is new It has been in the old time which was before us
Ecc  There is no memory of those who have gone before and of those who come after there will be no memory for those who are still to come after them
Ecc  I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem
Ecc  And I gave my heart to searching out in wisdom all things which are done under heaven it is a hard thing which God has put on the sons of men to do
Ecc  I have seen all the works which are done under the sun all is to no purpose and desire for wind
Ecc  That which is bent may not be made straight and that which is not there may not be numbered
Ecc  I said to my heart See I have become great and am increased in wisdom more than any who were before me in Jerusalemyes my heart has seen much wisdom and knowledge
Ecc  And I gave my heart to getting knowledge of wisdom and of the ways of the foolish And I saw that this again was desire for wind
Ecc  Because in much wisdom is much grief and increase of knowledge is increase of sorrow
Ecc  I said in my heart I will give you joy for a test so take your pleasurebut it was to no purpose
Ecc  Of laughing I said It is foolish and of joyWhat use is it
Ecc  I made a search with my heart to give pleasure to my flesh with wine still guiding my heart with wisdom and to go after foolish things so that I might see what was good for the sons of men to do under the heavens all the days of their life
Ecc  I undertook great works building myself houses and planting vinegardens
Ecc  I made myself gardens and fruit gardens planting in them fruittrees of all sorts
Ecc  I made pools to give water for the woods with their young trees
Ecc  I got menservants and womenservants and they gave birth to sons and daughters in my house I had great wealth of herds and flocks more than all who were in Jerusalem before me
Ecc  I got together silver and gold and the wealth of kings and of countries I got makers of song male and female and the delights of the sons of mengirls of all sorts to be my brides
Ecc  And I became great increasing more than all who had been before me in Jerusalem and my wisdom was still with me
Ecc  And nothing which was desired by my eyes did I keep from them I did not keep any joy from my heart because my heart took pleasure in all my work and this was my reward
Ecc  Then I saw all the works which my hands had made and everything I had been working to do and I saw that all was to no purpose and desire for wind and there was no profit under the sun
Ecc  And I went again in search of wisdom and of foolish ways What may the man do who comes after the king The thing which he has done before
Ecc  Then I saw that wisdom is better than foolish waysas the light is better than the dark
Ecc  The wise mans eyes are in his head but the foolish man goes walking in the dark but still I saw that the same event comes to them all
Ecc  Then said I in my heart As it comes to the foolish man so will it come to me so why have I been wise overmuch Then I said in my heart This again is to no purpose
Ecc  Of the wise man as of the foolish man there is no memory for ever seeing that those who now are will have gone from memory in the days to come See how death comes to the wise as to the foolish
Ecc  So I was hating life because everything under the sun was evil to me all is to no purpose and desire for wind
Ecc  Hate had I for all my work which I had done because the man who comes after me will have its fruits
Ecc  And who is to say if that man will be wise or foolish But he will have power over all my work which I have done and in which I have been wise under the sun This again is to no purpose
Ecc  So my mind was turned to grief for all the trouble I had taken and all my wisdom under the sun
Ecc  Because there is a man whose work has been done with wisdom with knowledge and with an expert hand but one who has done nothing for it will have it for his heritage This again is to no purpose and a great evil
Ecc  What does a man get for all his work and for the weight of care with which he has done his work under the sun
Ecc  All his days are sorrow and his work is full of grief Even in the night his heart has no rest This again is to no purpose
Ecc  There is nothing better for a man than taking meat and drink and having delight in his work This again I saw was from the hand of God
Ecc  Who may take food or have pleasure without him
Ecc  To the man with whom he is pleased God gives wisdom and knowledge and joy but to the sinner he gives the work of getting goods together and storing up wealth to give to him in whom God has pleasure This again is to no purpose and desire for wind
Ecc  For everything there is a fixed time and a time for every business under the sun
Ecc  A time for birth and a time for death a time for planting and a time for uprooting
Ecc  A time to put to death and a time to make well a time for pulling down and a time for building up
Ecc  A time for weeping and a time for laughing a time for sorrow and a time for dancing
Ecc  A time to take stones away and a time to get stones together a time for kissing and a time to keep from kissing
Ecc  A time for search and a time for loss a time to keep and a time to give away
Ecc  A time for undoing and a time for stitching a time for keeping quiet and a time for talk
Ecc  A time for love and a time for hate a time for war and a time for peace
Ecc  What profit has the worker in the work which he does
Ecc  I saw the work which God has put on the sons of man
Ecc  He has made everything right in its time but he has made their hearts without knowledge so that man is unable to see the works of God from the first to the last
Ecc  I am certain that there is nothing better for a man than to be glad and to do good while life is in him
Ecc  And for every man to take food and drink and have joy in all his work is a reward from God
Ecc  I am certain that whatever God does will be for ever No addition may be made to it nothing may be taken from it and God has done it so that man may be in fear before him
Ecc  Whatever is has been before and what is to be is now because God makes search for the things which are past
Ecc  And again I saw under the sun in the place of the judges that evil was there and in the place of righteousness that evil was there
Ecc  I said in my heart God will be judge of the good and of the bad because a time for every purpose and for every work has been fixed by him
Ecc  I said in my heart It is because of the sons of men so that God may put them to the test and that they may see themselves as beasts
Ecc  Because the fate of the sons of men and the fate of the beasts is the same As is the death of one so is the death of the other and all have one spirit Man is not higher than the beasts because all is to no purpose
Ecc  All go to one place all are of the dust and all will be turned to dust again
Ecc  Who is certain that the spirit of the sons of men goes up to heaven or that the spirit of the beasts goes down to the earth
Ecc  So I saw that there is nothing better than for a man to have joy in his workbecause that is his reward Who will make him see what will come after him
Ecc  And again I saw all the cruel things which are done under the sun there was the weeping of those who have evil done to them and they had no comforter and from the hands of the evildoers there went out power but they had no comforter
Ecc  So my praise was for the dead who have gone to their death more than for the living who still have life
Ecc  Yes happier than the dead or the living seemed he who has not ever been who has not seen the evil which is done under the sun
Ecc  And I saw that the cause of all the work and of everything which is done well was mans envy of his neighbour This again is to no purpose and a desire for wind
Ecc  The foolish man folding his hands takes the flesh of his body for food
Ecc  One hand full of rest is better than two hands full of trouble and desire for wind
Ecc  Then I came back and I saw an example of what is to no purpose under the sun
Ecc  It is one who is by himself without a second and without son or brother but there is no end to all his work and he has never enough of wealth For whom then am I working and keeping myself from pleasure This again is to no purpose and a bitter work
Ecc  Two are better than one because they have a good reward for their work
Ecc  And if one has a fall the other will give him a hand but unhappy is the man who is by himself because he has no helper
Ecc  So again if two are sleeping together they are warm but how may one be warm by himself
Ecc  And two attacked by one would be safe and three cords twisted together are not quickly broken
Ecc  A young man who is poor and wise is better than a king who is old and foolish and will not be guided by the wisdom of others
Ecc  Because out of a prison the young man comes to be king though by birth he was only a poor man in the kingdom
Ecc  I saw all the living under the sun round the young man who was to be ruler in place of the king
Ecc  There was no end of all the people of all those whose head he was but they who come later will have no delight in him This again is to no purpose and desire for wind
Ecc  Put your feet down with care when you go to the house of God for it is better to give ear than to make the burned offerings of the foolish whose knowledge is only of doing evil
Ecc  Be not unwise with your mouth and let not your heart be quick to say anything before God because God is in heaven and you are on the earthso let not the number of your words be great
Ecc  As a dream comes from much business so the voice of a foolish man comes with words in great number
Ecc  When you take an oath before God put it quickly into effect because he has no pleasure in the foolish keep the oath you have taken
Ecc  It is better not to take an oath than to take an oath and not keep it
Ecc  Let not your mouth make your flesh do evil And say not before the angel It was an error So that God may not be angry with your words and put an end to the work of your hands
Ecc  Because much talk comes from dreams and things of no purpose But let the fear of God be in you
Ecc  If you see the poor under a cruel yoke and law and right being violently overturned in a country be not surprised because one authority is keeping watch on another and there are higher than they
Ecc  It is good generally for a country where the land is worked to have a king
Ecc  He who has a love for silver never has enough silver or he who has love for wealth enough profit This again is to no purpose
Ecc  When goods are increased the number of those who take of them is increased and what profit has the owner but to see them
Ecc  The sleep of a working man is sweet if he has little food or much but to him who is full sleep will not come
Ecc  There is a great evil which I have seen under the sunwealth kept by the owner to be his downfall
Ecc  And I saw the destruction of his wealth by an evil chance and when he became the father of a son he had nothing in his hand
Ecc  As he came from his mother at birth so does he go again he gets from his work no reward which he may take away in his hand
Ecc  And this again is a great evil that in all points as he came so will he go and what profit has he in working for the wind
Ecc  All his days are in the dark and he has much sorrow pain disease and trouble
Ecc  This is what I have seen it is good and fair for a man to take meat and drink and to have joy in all his work under the sun all the days of his life which God has given him that is his reward
Ecc  Every man to whom God has given money and wealth and the power to have pleasure in it and to do his part and have joy in his work this is given by God
Ecc  He will not give much thought to the days of his life because God lets him be taken up with the joy of his heart
Ecc  There is an evil which I have seen under the sun and it is hard on men
Ecc  A man to whom God gives money wealth and honour so that he has all his desires but God does not give him the power to have joy of it and a strange man takes it This is to no purpose and an evil disease
Ecc  If a man has a hundred children and his life is long so that the days of his years are great in number but his soul takes no pleasure in good and he is not honoured at his death I say that a birth before its time is better than he
Ecc  In wind it came and to the dark it will go and with the dark will its name be covered
Ecc  Yes it saw not the sun and it had no knowledge it is better with this than with the other
Ecc  And though he goes on living a thousand years twice over and does not see good are not the two going to the same place
Ecc  All the work of man is for his mouth and still he has a desire for food
Ecc  What have the wise more than the foolish and what has the poor man by walking wisely before the living
Ecc  What the eyes see is better than the wandering of desire This is to no purpose and a desire for wind
Ecc  That which is has been named before and of what man is there is knowledge He has no power against one stronger than he
Ecc  There are words without number for increasing what is to no purpose but what is man profited by them
Ecc  Who is able to say what is good for man in life all the days of his foolish life which he goes through like a shade who will say what is to be after him under the sun
Ecc  A good name is better than oil of great price and the day of death than the day of birth
Ecc  It is better to go to the house of weeping than to go to the house of feasting because that is the end of every man and the living will take it to their hearts
Ecc  Sorrow is better than joy when the face is sad the mind gets better
Ecc  The hearts of the wise are in the house of weeping but the hearts of the foolish are in the house of joy
Ecc  It is better to take note of the protest of the wise than for a man to give ear to the song of the foolish
Ecc  Like the cracking of thorns under a pot so is the laugh of a foolish man and this again is to no purpose
Ecc  The wise are troubled by the ways of the cruel and the giving of money is the destruction of the heart
Ecc  The end of a thing is better than its start and a gentle spirit is better than pride
Ecc  Be not quick to let your spirit be angry because wrath is in the heart of the foolish
Ecc  Say not Why were the days which have gone by better than these Such a question comes not from wisdom
Ecc  Wisdom together with a heritage is good and a profit to those who see the sun
Ecc  Wisdom keeps a man from danger even as money does but the value of knowledge is that wisdom gives life to its owner
Ecc  Give thought to the work of God Who will make straight what he has made bent
Ecc  In the day of wealth have joy but in the day of evil take thought God has put the one against the other so that man may not be certain what will be after him
Ecc  These two have I seen in my life which is to no purpose a good man coming to his end in his righteousness and an evil man whose days are long in his evildoing
Ecc  Be not given overmuch to righteousness and be not overwise Why let destruction come on you
Ecc  Be not evil overmuch and be not foolish Why come to your end before your time
Ecc  It is good to take this in your hand and not to keep your hand from that he who has the fear of God will be free of the two
Ecc  Wisdom makes a wise man stronger than ten rulers in a town
Ecc  There is no man on earth of such righteousness that he does good and is free from sin all his days
Ecc  Do not give ear to all the words which men say for fear of hearing the curses of your servant
Ecc  Your heart has knowledge how frequently others have been cursed by you
Ecc  All this I have put to the test by wisdom I said I will be wise but it was far from me
Ecc  Far off is true existence and very deep who may have knowledge of it
Ecc  I gave my mind to knowledge and to searching for wisdom and the reason of things and to the discovery that sin is foolish and that to be foolish is to be without ones senses
Ecc  And I saw a thing more bitter than death even the woman whose heart is full of tricks and nets and whose hands are as bands He with whom God is pleased will get free from her but the sinner will be taken by her
Ecc  Look this I have seen said the Preacher taking one thing after another to get the true account
Ecc  For which my soul is still searching but I have it not one man among a thousand have I seen but a woman among all these I have not seen
Ecc  This only have I seen that God made men upright but they have been searching out all sorts of inventions
Ecc  Who is like the wise man and to whom is the sense of anything clear A mans wisdom makes his face shining and his hard face will be changed
Ecc  I say to you Keep the kings law from respect for the oath of God
Ecc  Be not quick to go from before him Be not fixed in an evil design because he does whatever is pleasing to him
Ecc  The word of a king has authority and who may say to him What is this you are doing
Ecc  Whoever keeps the law will come to no evil and a wise mans heart has knowledge of time and of decision
Ecc  For every purpose there is a time and a decision because the sorrow of man is great in him
Ecc  No one is certain what is to be and who is able to say to him when it will be
Ecc  No man has authority over the wind to keep the wind or is ruler over the day of his death In war no mans time is free and evil will not keep the sinner safe
Ecc  All this have I seen and have given my heart to all the work which is done under the sun there is a time when man has power over man for his destruction
Ecc  And then I saw evil men put to rest taken even from the holy place and they went about and were praised in the town because of what they had done This again is to no purpose
Ecc  Because punishment for an evil work comes not quickly the minds of the sons of men are fully given to doing evil
Ecc  Though a sinner does evil a hundred times and his life is long I am certain that it will be well for those who go in fear of God and are in fear before him
Ecc  But it will not be well for the evildoer he will not make his days long like a shade because he has no fear before God
Ecc  There is a thing which is to no purpose done on the earth that there are good men to whom is given the same punishment as those who are evil and there are evil men who get the reward of the good I say that this again is to no purpose
Ecc  So I gave praise to joy because there is nothing better for a man to do under the sun than to take meat and drink and be happy for that will be with him in his work all the days of his life which God gives him under the sun
Ecc  When I gave my mind to the knowledge of wisdom and to seeing the business which is done on the earth and there are those whose eyes see not sleep by day or by night
Ecc  Then I saw all the work of God and that man may not get knowledge of the work which is done under the sun because if a man gives hard work to the search he will not get knowledge and even if the wise man seems to be coming to the end of his search still he will be without knowledge
Ecc  All this I took to heart and my heart saw it all that the upright and the wise and their works are in the hand of God and men may not be certain if it will be love or hate all is to no purpose before them
Ecc  Because to all there is one event to the upright man and to the evil to the clean and to the unclean to him who makes an offering and to him who makes no offering as is the good so is the sinner he who takes an oath is as he who has fear of it
Ecc  This is evil in all things which are done under the sun that there is one fate for all and the hearts of the sons of men are full of evil while they have life their hearts are foolish and after thatto the dead
Ecc  For him who is joined to all the living there is hope a living dog is better than a dead lion
Ecc  The living are conscious that death will come to them but the dead are not conscious of anything and they no longer have a reward because there is no memory of them
Ecc  Their love and their hate and their envy are now ended and they have no longer a part for ever in anything which is done under the sun
Ecc  Come take your bread with joy and your wine with a glad heart God has taken pleasure in your works
Ecc  Let your clothing be white at all times and let not your head be without oil
Ecc  Have joy with the woman of your love all the days of your foolish life which he gives you under the sun Because that is your part in life and in your work which you do under the sun
Ecc  Whatever comes to your hand to do with all your power do it because there is no work or thought or knowledge or wisdom in the place of the dead to which you are going
Ecc  And again I saw under the sun that the reward goes not to him who is quick or the fruits of war to the strong and there is no bread for the wise or wealth for men of learning or respect for those who have knowledge but time and chance come to all
Ecc  Even man has no knowledge of his time like fishes taken in an evil net or like birds taken by deceit are the sons of men taken in an evil time when it comes suddenly on them
Ecc  This again I have seen under the sun as wisdom and it seemed great to me
Ecc  There was a little town and the number of its men was small and there came a great king against it and made an attack on it building works of war round about it
Ecc  Now there was in the town a poor wise man and he by his wisdom kept the town safe But no one had any memory of that same poor man
Ecc  Then I said Wisdom is better than strength but the poor mans wisdom is not respected and his words are not given a hearing
Ecc  The words of the wise which come quietly to the ear are noted more than the cry of a ruler among the foolish
Ecc  Wisdom is better than instruments of war but one sinner is the destruction of much good
Ecc  Dead flies make the oil of the perfumer give out an evil smell more valued is a little wisdom than the great glory of the foolish
Ecc  The heart of the wise man goes in the right direction but the heart of a foolish man in the wrong
Ecc  And when the foolish man is walking in the way he has no sense and lets everyone see that he is foolish
Ecc  If the wrath of the ruler is against you keep in your place in him who keeps quiet even great sins may be overlooked
Ecc  There is an evil which I have seen under the sun like an error which comes by chance from a ruler
Ecc  The foolish are placed in high positions but men of wealth are kept low
Ecc  I have seen servants on horses and rulers walking on the earth as servants
Ecc  He who makes a hole for others will himself go into it and for him who makes a hole through a wall the bite of a snake will be a punishment
Ecc  He who gets out stones from the earth will be damaged by them and in the cutting of wood there is danger
Ecc  If the iron has no edge and he does not make it sharp then he has to put out more strength but wisdom makes things go well
Ecc  If a snake gives a bite before the word of power is said then there is no longer any use in the word of power
Ecc  The words of a wise mans mouth are sweet to all but the lips of a foolish man are his destruction
Ecc  The first words of his mouth are foolish and the end of his talk is evil crime
Ecc  The foolish are full of words man has no knowledge of what will be and who is able to say what will be after him
Ecc  The work of the foolish will be a weariness to him because he has no knowledge of the way to the town
Ecc  Unhappy is the land whose king is a boy and whose rulers are feasting in the morning
Ecc  Happy is the land whose ruler is of noble birth and whose chiefs take food at the right time for strength and not for feasting
Ecc  When no work is done the roof goes in and when the hands do nothing water comes into the house
Ecc  A feast is for laughing and wine makes glad the heart but by the one and the other money is wasted
Ecc  Say not a curse against the king even in your thoughts and even secretly say not a curse against the man of wealth because a bird of the air will take the voice and that which has wings will give news of it
Ecc  Put out your bread on the face of the waters for after a long time it will come back to you again
Ecc  Give a part to seven or even to eight because you have no knowledge of the evil which will be on the earth
Ecc  If the clouds are full of rain they send it down on the earth and if a tree comes down to the south or the north in whatever place it comes down there it will be
Ecc  He who is watching the wind will not get the seed planted and he who is looking at the clouds will not get in the grain
Ecc  As you have no knowledge of the way of the wind or of the growth of the bones in the body of her who is with child even so you have no knowledge of the works of God who has made all
Ecc  In the morning put your seed into the earth and till the evening let not your hand be at rest because you are not certain which will do well this or thator if the two will be equally good
Ecc  Truly the light is sweet and it is good for the eyes to see the sun
Ecc  But even if a mans life is long and he has joy in all his years let him keep in mind the dark days because they will be great in number Whatever may come is to no purpose
Ecc  Have joy O young man while you are young and let your heart be glad in the days of your strength and go in the ways of your heart and in the desire of your eyes but be certain that for all these things God will be your judge
Ecc  So put away trouble from your heart and sorrow from your flesh because the early years and the best years are to no purpose
Ecc  Let your mind be turned to your Maker in the days of your strength while the evil days come not and the years are far away when you will say I have no pleasure in them
Ecc  While the sun or the light or the moon or the stars are not dark and the clouds come not back after the rain
Ecc  In the day when the keepers of the house are shaking for fear and the strong men are bent down and the women who were crushing the grain are at rest because their number is small and those looking out of the windows are unable to see
Ecc  When the doors are shut in the street and the sound of the crushing is low and the voice of the bird is soft and the daughters of music will be made low
Ecc  And he is in fear of that which is high and danger is in the road and the tree is white with flower and the least thing is a weight and desire is at an end because man goes to his last restingplace and those who are sorrowing are in the streets
Ecc  Before ever the silver cord is cut or the vessel of gold is broken or the pot is broken at the fountain or the wheel broken at the waterhole
Ecc  And the dust goes back to the earth as it was and the spirit goes back to God who gave it
Ecc  All things are to no purpose says the Preacher all is to no purpose
Ecc  And because the Preacher was wise he still gave the people knowledge searching out testing and putting in order a great number of wise sayings
Ecc  The Preacher made search for words which were pleasing but his writing was in words upright and true
Ecc  The words of the wise are pointed and sayings grouped together are like nails fixed with a hammer they are given by one guide
Ecc  And further my son take note of this of the making of books there is no end and much learning is a weariness to the flesh
Ecc  This is the last word All has been said Have fear of God and keep his laws because this is right for every man
Ecc  God will be judge of every work with every secret thing good or evil
Son  The song of Songs which is Solomons
Son  Let him give me the kisses of his mouth for his love is better than wine
Son  Sweet is the smell of your perfumes your name is as perfume running out so the young girls give you their love
Son  Take me to you and we will go after you the king has taken me into his house We will be glad and full of joy in you we will give more thought to your love than to wine rightly are they your lovers
Son  I am dark but fair of form O daughters of Jerusalem as the tents of Kedar as the curtains of Solomon
Son  Let not your eyes be turned on me because I am dark because I was looked on by the sun my mothers children were angry with me they made me the keeper of the vinegardens but my vinegarden I have not kept
Son  Say O love of my soul where you give food to your flock and where you make them take their rest in the heat of the day why have I to be as one wandering by the flocks of your friends
Son  If you have not knowledge O most beautiful among women go on your way in the footsteps of the flock and give your young goats food by the tents of the keepers
Son  I have made a comparison of you O my love to a horse in Pharaohs carriages
Son  Your face is a delight with rings of hair your neck with chains of jewels
Son  We will make you chains of gold with ornaments of silver

Son  As a bag of myrrh is my wellloved one to me when he is at rest all night between my breasts
Son  My love is to me as a branch of the cypresstree in the vinegardens of Engedi
Son  See you are fair my love you are fair you have the eyes of a dove
Son  See you are fair my loved one and a pleasure our bed is green
Son  Cedartrees are the pillars of our house and our boards are made of firtrees
Son  I am a rose of Sharon a flower of the valleys

Son  He took me to the house of wine and his flag over me was love
Son  Make me strong with winecakes let me be comforted with apples I am overcome with love
Son  His left hand is under my head and his right hand is round about me
Son  I say to you O daughters of Jerusalem by the roes of the field do not let love be moved till it is ready
Son  The voice of my loved one See he comes dancing on the mountains stepping quickly on the hills
Son  My loved one is like a roe see he is on the other side of our wall he is looking in at the windows letting himself be seen through the spaces
Son  My loved one said to me Get up my love my fair one and come away
Son  For see the winter is past the rain is over and gone
Son  The flowers are come on the earth the time of cutting the vines is come and the voice of the dove is sounding in our land
Son  The figtree puts out her green fruit and the vines with their young fruit give a good smell Get up from your bed my beautiful one and come away
Son  O my dove you are in the holes of the mountain sides in the cracks of the high hills let me see your face let your voice come to my ears for sweet is your voice and your face is fair
Son  Take for us the foxes the little foxes which do damage to the vines our vines have young grapes
Son  My loved one is mine and I am his he takes his food among the flowers
Son  Till the evening comes and the sky slowly becomes dark come my loved one and be like a roe on the mountains of Bether
Son  By night on my bed I was looking for him who is the love of my soul I was looking for him but I did not see him
Son  I will get up now and go about the town in the streets and in the wide ways I will go after him who is the love of my soul I went after him but I did not see him
Son  The watchmen who go about the town came by me to them I said Have you seen him who is my hearts desire
Son  I was but a little way from them when I came face to face with him who is the love of my soul I took him by the hands and did not let him go till I had taken him into my mothers house and into the room of her who gave me birth
Son  I say to you O daughters of Jerusalem by the roes of the field let not love be moved till it is ready
Son  Who is this coming out of the waste places like pillars of smoke perfumed with sweet spices with all the spices of the trader
Son  See it is the bed of Solomon sixty men of war are about it of the army of Israel
Son  All of them armed with swords trained in war every man has his sword at his side because of fear in the night
Son  King Solomon made himself a bed of the wood of Lebanon
Son  He made its pillars of silver its base of gold its seat of purple the middle of it of ebony
Son  Go out O daughters of Jerusalem and see King Solomon with the crown which his mother put on his head on the day when he was married and on the day of the joy of his heart
Son  See you are fair my love you are fair you have the eyes of a dove your hair is as a flock of goats which take their rest on the side of Gilead
Son  Your teeth are like a flock of sheep whose wool is newly cut which come up from the washing every one has two lambs and there is not one without young
Son  Your red lips are like a bright thread and your mouth is fair of form the sides of your head are like pomegranate fruit under your veil
Son  Your neck is like the tower of David made for a storehouse of arms in which a thousand breastplates are hanging breastplates for fightingmen
Son  Your two breasts are like two young roes of the same birth which take their food among the lilies

Son  You are all fair my love there is no mark on you
Son  Come with me from Lebanon my bride with me from Lebanon see from the top of Amana from the top of Senir and Hermon from the places of the lions from the mountains of the leopards
Son  You have taken away my heart my sister my bride you have taken away my heart with one look you have taken it with one chain of your neck
Son  How fair is your love my sister How much better is your love than wine and the smell of your oils than any perfume
Son  Your lips are dropping honey honey and milk are under your tongue and the smell of your clothing is like the smell of Lebanon
Son  A garden walledin is my sister my bride a garden shut up a spring of water stopped
Son  The produce of the garden is pomegranates with all the best fruits henna and spikenard
Son  Spikenard and safron calamus and cinnamon with all trees of frankincense myrrh and aloes with all the chief spices
Son  You are a fountain of gardens a spring of living waters and flowing waters from Lebanon
